Bug Summary

File:option.c
Warning:line 3513, column 5
Value stored to 'new_value' is never read

Annotated Source Code

Press '?' to see keyboard shortcuts

1// User-settable options. Checklist for adding a new option:
2// - Put it in options.lua
3// - For a global option: Add a variable for it in option_vars.h.
4// - For a buffer or window local option:
5// - Add a variable to the window or buffer struct in buffer_defs.h.
6// - For a window option, add some code to copy_winopt().
7// - For a window string option, add code to check_winopt()
8// and clear_winopt(). If setting the option needs parsing,
9// add some code to didset_window_options().
10// - For a buffer option, add some code to buf_copy_options().
11// - For a buffer string option, add code to check_buf_options().
12// - If it's a numeric option, add any necessary bounds checks to check_num_option_bounds().
13// - If it's a list of flags, add some code in do_set(), search for WW_ALL.
14// - Add documentation! "desc" in options.lua, and any other related places.
15// - Add an entry in runtime/optwin.vim.
16

143#define OPTION_COUNT((sizeof(options)/sizeof((options)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
options) % sizeof((options)[0]))))) ARRAY_SIZE(options)((sizeof(options)/sizeof((options)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
options) % sizeof((options)[0])))))

146typedef enum {

148 PREFIX_NONE, ///< no prefix
149 PREFIX_INV, ///< "inv" prefix
150} set_prefix_T;

174void set_init_tablocal(void)
175{
176 // susy baka: cmdheight calls itself OPT_GLOBAL but is really tablocal!
177 p_ch = options[kOptCmdheight].def_val.number;
178}
179
180/// Initialize the 'shell' option to a default value.
181static void set_init_default_shell(void)
182{
183 // Find default value for 'shell' option.
184 // Don't use it if it is empty.
185 const char *shell = os_getenv("SHELL");
186 if (shell != NULL((void*)0)) {
187 if (vim_strchr(shell, ' ') != NULL((void*)0)) {
188 const size_t len = strlen(shell) + 3; // two quotes and a trailing NUL
189 char *const cmd = xmalloc(len);
190 snprintf(cmd, len, "\"%s\"", shell);
191 set_string_default(kOptShell, cmd, true1);
192 } else {
193 set_string_default(kOptShell, (char *)shell, false0);
194 }
195 }
196}
197
198/// Set the default for 'backupskip' to include environment variables for
199/// temp files.
200static void set_init_default_backupskip(void)
201{
202#ifdef UNIX
203 static char *(names[4]) = { "", "TMPDIR", "TEMP", "TMP" };
204#else
205 static char *(names[3]) = { "TMPDIR", "TEMP", "TMP" };
206#endif
207 garray_T ga;
208 OptIndex opt_idx = kOptBackupskip;
209
210 ga_init(&ga, 1, 100);
211 for (size_t n = 0; n < ARRAY_SIZE(names)((sizeof(names)/sizeof((names)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(names
) % sizeof((names)[0]))))); n++) {
212 bool_Bool mustfree = true1;
213 char *p;
214#ifdef UNIX
215 if (*names[n] == NUL'\000') {
216# ifdef __APPLE__
217 p = "/private/tmp";
218# else
219 p = "/tmp";
220# endif
221 mustfree = false0;
222 } else
223#endif
224 {
225 p = vim_getenv(names[n]);
226 }
227 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && *p != NUL'\000') {
228 // First time count the NUL, otherwise count the ','.
229 const size_t len = strlen(p) + 3;
230 char *item = xmalloc(len);
231 xstrlcpy(item, p, len);
232 add_pathsep(item);
233 xstrlcat(item, "*", len);
234 if (find_dup_item(ga.ga_data, item, options[opt_idx].flags)
235 == NULL((void*)0)) {
236 ga_grow(&ga, (int)len);
237 if (!GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0)) {
238 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, ",")strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)(","));
239 }
240 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, p)strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)(p));
241 add_pathsep(ga.ga_data);
242 STRCAT(ga.ga_data, "*")strcat((char *)(ga.ga_data), (char *)("*"));
243 ga.ga_len += (int)len;
244 }
245 xfree(item);
246 }
247 if (mustfree) {
248 xfree(p);
249 }
250 }
251 if (ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
252 set_string_default(kOptBackupskip, ga.ga_data, true1);
253 }
254}
255
256/// Initialize the 'cdpath' option to a default value.
257static void set_init_default_cdpath(void)
258{
259 char *cdpath = vim_getenv("CDPATH");
260 if (cdpath == NULL((void*)0)) {
261 return;
262 }
263
264 char *buf = xmalloc(2 * strlen(cdpath) + 2);
265 buf[0] = ','; // start with ",", current dir first
266 int j = 1;
267 for (int i = 0; cdpath[i] != NUL'\000'; i++) {
268 if (vim_ispathlistsep(cdpath[i])) {
269 buf[j++] = ',';
270 } else {
271 if (cdpath[i] == ' ' || cdpath[i] == ',') {
272 buf[j++] = '\\';
273 }
274 buf[j++] = cdpath[i];
275 }
276 }
277 buf[j] = NUL'\000';
278 options[kOptCdpath].def_val.string = buf;
279 options[kOptCdpath].flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U;
280 xfree(cdpath);
281}
282
283/// Expand environment variables and things like "~" for the defaults.
284/// If option_expand() returns non-NULL the variable is expanded. This can
285/// only happen for non-indirect options.
286/// Also set the default to the expanded value, so ":set" does not list
287/// them.
288/// Don't set the P_ALLOCED flag, because we don't want to free the
289/// default.
290static void set_init_expand_env(void)
291{
292 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
293 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
294 if (opt->flags & P_NO_DEF_EXP0x04U) {
295 continue;
296 }
297 char *p;
298 if ((opt->flags & P_GETTEXT0x20000U) && opt->var != NULL((void*)0)) {
299 p = _(*(char **)opt->var)gettext(*(char **)opt->var);
300 } else {
301 p = option_expand(opt_idx, NULL((void*)0));
302 }
303 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
304 p = xstrdup(p);
305 *(char **)opt->var = p;
306 if (opt->flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U) {
307 xfree(opt->def_val.string);
308 }
309 opt->def_val.string = p;
310 opt->flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U;
311 }
312 }
313}
314
315/// Initialize the encoding used for "default" in 'fileencodings'.
316static void set_init_fenc_default(void)
317{
318 // enc_locale() will try to find the encoding of the current locale.
319 // This will be used when "default" is used as encoding specifier
320 // in 'fileencodings'.
321 char *p = enc_locale();
322 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
323 // Use utf-8 as "default" if locale encoding can't be detected.
324 p = xmemdupz(S_LEN("utf-8")("utf-8"), (sizeof("utf-8") - 1));
325 }
326 fenc_default = p;
327}
328
329/// Initialize the options, first part.
330///
331/// Called only once from main(), just after creating the first buffer.
332/// If "clean_arg" is true, Nvim was started with --clean.
333///
334/// NOTE: ELOG() etc calls are not allowed here, as log location depends on
335/// env var expansion which depends on expression evaluation and other
336/// editor state initialized here. Do logging in set_init_2 or later.
337void set_init_1(bool_Bool clean_arg)
338{
339 langmap_init();
340
341 set_init_default_shell();
342 set_init_default_backupskip();
343 set_init_default_cdpath();
344
345 char *backupdir = stdpaths_user_state_subpath("backup", 2, true1);
346 const size_t backupdir_len = strlen(backupdir);
347 backupdir = xrealloc(backupdir, backupdir_len + 3);
348 memmove(backupdir + 2, backupdir, backupdir_len + 1);
349 memmove(backupdir, ".,", 2);
350 set_string_default(kOptBackupdir, backupdir, true1);
351 set_string_default(kOptViewdir, stdpaths_user_state_subpath("view", 2, true1),
352 true1);
353 set_string_default(kOptDirectory, stdpaths_user_state_subpath("swap", 2, true1),
354 true1);
355 set_string_default(kOptUndodir, stdpaths_user_state_subpath("undo", 2, true1),
356 true1);
357 // Set default for &runtimepath. All necessary expansions are performed in
358 // this function.
359 char *rtp = runtimepath_default(clean_arg);
360 if (rtp) {
361 set_string_default(kOptRuntimepath, rtp, true1);
362 // Make a copy of 'rtp' for 'packpath'
363 set_string_default(kOptPackpath, rtp, false0);
364 rtp = NULL((void*)0); // ownership taken
365 }
366
367 // Set all the options (except the terminal options) to their default
368 // value. Also set the global value for local options.
369 set_options_default(0);
370
371 curbuf->b_p_initialized = true1;
372 curbuf->b_p_ar = -1; // no local 'autoread' value
373 curbuf->b_p_ul = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL(-123456);
374 check_buf_options(curbuf);
375 check_win_options(curwin);
376 check_options();
377
378 // set 'laststatus'
379 last_status(false0);
380
381 // Must be before option_expand(), because that one needs vim_isIDc()
382 didset_options();
383
384 // Use the current chartab for the generic chartab. This is not in
385 // didset_options() because it only depends on 'encoding'.
386 init_spell_chartab();
387
388 // Expand environment variables and things like "~" for the defaults.
389 set_init_expand_env();
390
391 save_file_ff(curbuf); // Buffer is unchanged
392
393 // Detect use of mlterm.
394 // Mlterm is a terminal emulator akin to xterm that has some special
395 // abilities (bidi namely).
396 // NOTE: mlterm's author is being asked to 'set' a variable
397 // instead of an environment variable due to inheritance.
398 if (os_env_exists("MLTERM")) {
399 set_option_value_give_err(kOptTermbidi, BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(true)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = 1 }), 0);
400 }
401
402 didset_options2();
403
404 lang_init();
405 set_init_fenc_default();
406
407#ifdef HAVE_WORKING_LIBINTL
408 // GNU gettext 0.10.37 supports this feature: set the codeset used for
409 // translated messages independently from the current locale.
410 (void)bind_textdomain_codeset(PROJECT_NAME"nvim", p_enc);
411#endif
412
413 // Set the default for 'helplang'.
414 set_helplang_default(get_mess_lang());
415}
416
417/// Set an option to its default value.
418/// This does not take care of side effects!
419///
420/// @param opt_flags OPT_FREE, OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL.
421///
422/// TODO(famiu): Refactor this when def_val uses OptVal.
423static void set_option_default(const OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags)
424{
425 bool_Bool both = (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0;
426
427 // pointer to variable for current option
428 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
429 void *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, both ? OPT_LOCAL : opt_flags);
430 uint32_t flags = opt->flags;
431 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) { // skip hidden option, nothing to do for it
432 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeString)) {
433 // Use set_string_option_direct() for local options to handle freeing and allocating the
434 // value.
435 if (opt->indir != PV_NONE) {
436 set_string_option_direct(opt_idx, opt->def_val.string, opt_flags, 0);
437 } else {
438 if (flags & P_ALLOCED0x01U) {
439 free_string_option(*(char **)(varp));
440 }
441 *(char **)varp = opt->def_val.string;
442 opt->flags &= ~P_ALLOCED0x01U;
443 }
444 } else if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeNumber)) {
445 if (opt->indir == PV_SCROLL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SCROLL))) {
446 win_comp_scroll(curwin);
447 } else {
448 OptInt def_val = opt->def_val.number;
449 if ((OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so
450 || (OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso) {
451 // 'scrolloff' and 'sidescrolloff' local values have a
452 // different default value than the global default.
453 *(OptInt *)varp = -1;
454 } else {
455 *(OptInt *)varp = def_val;
456 }
457 // May also set global value for local option.
458 if (both) {
459 *(OptInt *)get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_GLOBAL) = def_val;
460 }
461 }
462 } else { // boolean
463 *(int *)varp = opt->def_val.boolean;
464#ifdef UNIX
465 // 'modeline' defaults to off for root
466 if (opt->indir == PV_ML(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_ML)) && getuid() == ROOT_UID0) {
467 *(int *)varp = false0;
468 }
469#endif
470 // May also set global value for local option.
471 if (both) {
472 *(int *)get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_GLOBAL) =
473 *(int *)varp;
474 }
475 }
476
477 // The default value is not insecure.
478 uint32_t *flagsp = insecure_flag(curwin, opt_idx, opt_flags);
479 *flagsp = *flagsp & ~P_INSECURE0x100000U;
480 }
481
482 set_option_sctx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_sctx);
483}
484
485/// Set all options (except terminal options) to their default value.
486///
487/// @param opt_flags Option flags.
488static void set_options_default(int opt_flags)
489{
490 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
491 if (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_NODEFAULT0x08U)) {
492 set_option_default(opt_idx, opt_flags);
493 }
494 }
495
496 // The 'scroll' option must be computed for all windows.
497 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *(tp) = first_tabpage; (tp) != ((void*)0); (tp
) = (tp)->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin
: (tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next
) {
498 win_comp_scroll(wp);
499 }
500
501 parse_cino(curbuf);
502}
503
504/// Set the Vi-default value of a string option.
505/// Used for 'sh', 'backupskip' and 'term'.
506///
507/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
508/// @param val The value of the option.
509/// @param allocated If true, do not copy default as it was already allocated.
510static void set_string_default(OptIndex opt_idx, char *val, bool_Bool allocated)
511 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
512{
513 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid) {
514 return;
515 }
516
517 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
518 if (opt->flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U) {
519 xfree(opt->def_val.string);
520 }
521
522 opt->def_val.string = allocated ? val : xstrdup(val);
523 opt->flags |= P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U;
524}
525
526/// For an option value that contains comma separated items, find "newval" in
527/// "origval". Return NULL if not found.
528static char *find_dup_item(char *origval, const char *newval, uint32_t flags)
529 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2)
530{
531 if (origval == NULL((void*)0)) {
532 return NULL((void*)0);
533 }
534
535 int bs = 0;
536
537 const size_t newlen = strlen(newval);
538 for (char *s = origval; *s != NUL'\000'; s++) {
539 if ((!(flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) || s == origval || (s[-1] == ',' && !(bs & 1)))
540 && strncmp(s, newval, newlen) == 0
541 && (!(flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) || s[newlen] == ',' || s[newlen] == NUL'\000')) {
542 return s;
543 }
544 // Count backslashes. Only a comma with an even number of backslashes
545 // or a single backslash preceded by a comma before it is recognized as
546 // a separator.
547 if ((s > origval + 1 && s[-1] == '\\' && s[-2] != ',')
548 || (s == origval + 1 && s[-1] == '\\')) {
549 bs++;
550 } else {
551 bs = 0;
552 }
553 }
554 return NULL((void*)0);
555}
556
557/// Set the Vi-default value of a number option.
558/// Used for 'lines' and 'columns'.
559void set_number_default(OptIndex opt_idx, OptInt val)
560{
561 if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) {
562 options[opt_idx].def_val.number = val;
563 }
564}
565
566#if defined(EXITFREE)
567/// Free all options.
568void free_all_options(void)
569{
570 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
571 if (options[opt_idx].indir == PV_NONE) {
572 // global option: free value and default value.
573 if ((options[opt_idx].flags & P_ALLOCED0x01U) && options[opt_idx].var != NULL((void*)0)) {
574 optval_free(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, options[opt_idx].var));
575 }
576 if (options[opt_idx].flags & P_DEF_ALLOCED0x10U) {
577 optval_free(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, &options[opt_idx].def_val));
578 }
579 } else if (options[opt_idx].var != VAR_WIN((char *)-1)) {
580 // buffer-local option: free global value
581 optval_free(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, options[opt_idx].var));
582 }
583 }
584 free_operatorfunc_option();
585 free_tagfunc_option();
586 XFREE_CLEAR(fenc_default)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(fenc_default); xfree(*ptr_)
; *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
587 XFREE_CLEAR(p_term)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(p_term); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_
= ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
588 XFREE_CLEAR(p_ttytype)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(p_ttytype); xfree(*ptr_); *
ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
589}
590#endif
591
592/// Initialize the options, part two: After getting Rows and Columns.
593void set_init_2(bool_Bool headless)
594{
595 // set in set_init_1 but logging is not allowed there
596 ILOG("startup runtimepath/packpath value: %s", p_rtp)logmsg(2, ((void*)0), __func__, 596, 1, "startup runtimepath/packpath value: %s"
, p_rtp);
597
598 // 'scroll' defaults to half the window height. The stored default is zero,
599 // which results in the actual value computed from the window height.
600 if (!(options[kOptScroll].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U)) {
601 set_option_default(kOptScroll, OPT_LOCAL);
602 }
603 comp_col();
604
605 // 'window' is only for backwards compatibility with Vi.
606 // Default is Rows - 1.
607 if (!option_was_set(kOptWindow)) {
608 p_window = Rows - 1;
609 }
610 set_number_default(kOptWindow, Rows - 1);
611}
612
613/// Initialize the options, part three: After reading the .vimrc
614void set_init_3(void)
615{
616 parse_shape_opt(SHAPE_CURSOR2); // set cursor shapes from 'guicursor'
617
618 // Set 'shellpipe' and 'shellredir', depending on the 'shell' option.
619 // This is done after other initializations, where 'shell' might have been
620 // set, but only if they have not been set before.
621 bool_Bool do_srr = !(options[kOptShellredir].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U);
622 bool_Bool do_sp = !(options[kOptShellpipe].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U);
623
624 size_t len = 0;
625 char *p = (char *)invocation_path_tail(p_sh, &len);
626 p = xmemdupz(p, len);
627
628 {
629 //
630 // Default for p_sp is "| tee", for p_srr is ">".
631 // For known shells it is changed here to include stderr.
632 //
633 if (path_fnamecmp(p, "csh") == 0
634 || path_fnamecmp(p, "tcsh") == 0) {
635 if (do_sp) {
636 p_sp = "|& tee";
637 options[kOptShellpipe].def_val.string = p_sp;
638 }
639 if (do_srr) {
640 p_srr = ">&";
641 options[kOptShellredir].def_val.string = p_srr;
642 }
643 } else if (path_fnamecmp(p, "sh") == 0
644 || path_fnamecmp(p, "ksh") == 0
645 || path_fnamecmp(p, "mksh") == 0
646 || path_fnamecmp(p, "pdksh") == 0
647 || path_fnamecmp(p, "zsh") == 0
648 || path_fnamecmp(p, "zsh-beta") == 0
649 || path_fnamecmp(p, "bash") == 0
650 || path_fnamecmp(p, "fish") == 0
651 || path_fnamecmp(p, "ash") == 0
652 || path_fnamecmp(p, "dash") == 0) {
653 // Always use POSIX shell style redirection if we reach this
654 if (do_sp) {
655 p_sp = "2>&1| tee";
656 options[kOptShellpipe].def_val.string = p_sp;
657 }
658 if (do_srr) {
659 p_srr = ">%s 2>&1";
660 options[kOptShellredir].def_val.string = p_srr;
661 }
662 }
663 xfree(p);
664 }
665
666 if (buf_is_empty(curbuf)) {
667 int idx_ffs = find_option("ffs");
668
669 // Apply the first entry of 'fileformats' to the initial buffer.
670 if (idx_ffs >= 0 && (options[idx_ffs].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U)) {
671 set_fileformat(default_fileformat(), OPT_LOCAL);
672 }
673 }
674
675 set_title_defaults(); // 'title', 'icon'
676}
677
678/// When 'helplang' is still at its default value, set it to "lang".
679/// Only the first two characters of "lang" are used.
680void set_helplang_default(const char *lang)
681{
682 if (lang == NULL((void*)0)) {
683 return;
684 }
685
686 const size_t lang_len = strlen(lang);
687 if (lang_len < 2) { // safety check
688 return;
689 }
690 if (options[kOptHelplang].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U) {
691 return;
692 }
693
694 if (options[kOptHelplang].flags & P_ALLOCED0x01U) {
695 free_string_option(p_hlg);
696 }
697 p_hlg = xmemdupz(lang, lang_len);
698 // zh_CN becomes "cn", zh_TW becomes "tw".
699 if (STRNICMP(p_hlg, "zh_", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(p_hlg), (char *)("zh_"), (size_t)(3)) == 0 && strlen(p_hlg) >= 5) {
700 p_hlg[0] = (char)TOLOWER_ASC(p_hlg[3])(((p_hlg[3]) < 'A' || (p_hlg[3]) > 'Z') ? (p_hlg[3]) : (
p_hlg[3]) + ('a' - 'A'));
701 p_hlg[1] = (char)TOLOWER_ASC(p_hlg[4])(((p_hlg[4]) < 'A' || (p_hlg[4]) > 'Z') ? (p_hlg[4]) : (
p_hlg[4]) + ('a' - 'A'));
702 } else if (strlen(p_hlg) >= 1 && *p_hlg == 'C') {
703 // any C like setting, such as C.UTF-8, becomes "en"
704 p_hlg[0] = 'e';
705 p_hlg[1] = 'n';
706 }
707 p_hlg[2] = NUL'\000';
708 options[kOptHelplang].flags |= P_ALLOCED0x01U;
709}
710
711/// 'title' and 'icon' only default to true if they have not been set or reset
712/// in .vimrc and we can read the old value.
713/// When 'title' and 'icon' have been reset in .vimrc, we won't even check if
714/// they can be reset. This reduces startup time when using X on a remote
715/// machine.
716void set_title_defaults(void)
717{
718 // If GUI is (going to be) used, we can always set the window title and
719 // icon name. Saves a bit of time, because the X11 display server does
720 // not need to be contacted.
721 if (!(options[kOptTitle].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U)) {
722 options[kOptTitle].def_val.boolean = false0;
723 p_title = false0;
724 }
725 if (!(options[kOptIcon].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U)) {
726 options[kOptIcon].def_val.boolean = false0;
727 p_icon = false0;
728 }
729}
730
731void ex_set(exarg_T *eap)
732{
733 int flags = 0;
734
735 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_setlocal) {
736 flags = OPT_LOCAL;
737 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_setglobal) {
738 flags = OPT_GLOBAL;
739 }
740 if (eap->forceit) {
741 flags |= OPT_ONECOLUMN;
742 }
743 do_set(eap->arg, flags);
744}
745
746/// Get the default value for a string option.
747static char *stropt_get_default_val(OptIndex opt_idx, uint64_t flags)
748{
749 char *newval = options[opt_idx].def_val.string;
750 // expand environment variables and ~ since the default value was
751 // already expanded, only required when an environment variable was set
752 // later
753 if (newval == NULL((void*)0)) {
754 newval = empty_string_option;
755 } else if (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_NO_DEF_EXP0x04U)) {
756 char *s = option_expand(opt_idx, newval);
757 if (s == NULL((void*)0)) {
758 s = newval;
759 }
760 newval = xstrdup(s);
761 } else {
762 newval = xstrdup(newval);
763 }
764 return newval;
765}
766
767/// Copy the new string value into allocated memory for the option.
768/// Can't use set_string_option_direct(), because we need to remove the backslashes.
769static char *stropt_copy_value(char *origval, char **argp, set_op_T op,
770 uint32_t flags FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
771{
772 char *arg = *argp;
773
774 // get a bit too much
775 size_t newlen = strlen(arg) + 1;
776 if (op != OP_NONE) {
777 newlen += strlen(origval) + 1;
778 }
779 char *newval = xmalloc(newlen);
780 char *s = newval;
781
782 // Copy the string, skip over escaped chars.
783 // For MS-Windows backslashes before normal file name characters
784 // are not removed, and keep backslash at start, for "\\machine\path",
785 // but do remove it for "\\\\machine\\path".
786 // The reverse is found in escape_option_str_cmdline().
787 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && !ascii_iswhite(*arg)) {
788 if (*arg == '\\' && arg[1] != NUL'\000'
789#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
790 && !((flags & P_EXPAND0x02U)
791 && vim_isfilec((uint8_t)arg[1])
792 && !ascii_iswhite(arg[1])
793 && (arg[1] != '\\'
794 || (s == newval && arg[2] != '\\')))
795#endif
796 ) {
797 arg++; // remove backslash
798 }
799 int i = utfc_ptr2len(arg);
800 if (i > 1) {
801 // copy multibyte char
802 memmove(s, arg, (size_t)i);
803 arg += i;
804 s += i;
805 } else {
806 *s++ = *arg++;
807 }
808 }
809 *s = NUL'\000';
810
811 *argp = arg;
812 return newval;
813}
814
815/// Expand environment variables and ~ in string option value 'newval'.
816static char *stropt_expand_envvar(OptIndex opt_idx, char *origval, char *newval, set_op_T op)
817{
818 char *s = option_expand(opt_idx, newval);
819 if (s == NULL((void*)0)) {
820 return newval;
821 }
822
823 xfree(newval);
824 uint32_t newlen = (unsigned)strlen(s) + 1;
825 if (op != OP_NONE) {
826 newlen += (unsigned)strlen(origval) + 1;
827 }
828 newval = xmalloc(newlen);
829 STRCPY(newval, s)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(s));
830
831 return newval;
832}
833
834/// Concatenate the original and new values of a string option, adding a "," if
835/// needed.
836static void stropt_concat_with_comma(char *origval, char *newval, set_op_T op, uint32_t flags)
837{
838 int len = 0;
839 int comma = ((flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) && *origval != NUL'\000' && *newval != NUL'\000');
840 if (op == OP_ADDING) {
841 len = (int)strlen(origval);
842 // Strip a trailing comma, would get 2.
843 if (comma && len > 1
844 && (flags & P_ONECOMMA0x3000U) == P_ONECOMMA0x3000U
845 && origval[len - 1] == ','
846 && origval[len - 2] != '\\') {
847 len--;
848 }
849 memmove(newval + len + comma, newval, strlen(newval) + 1);
850 memmove(newval, origval, (size_t)len);
851 } else {
852 len = (int)strlen(newval);
853 STRMOVE(newval + len + comma, origval)memmove((newval + len + comma), (origval), strlen(origval) + 1
);
854 }
855 if (comma) {
856 newval[len] = ',';
857 }
858}
859
860/// Remove a value from a string option. Copy string option value in "origval"
861/// to "newval" and then remove the string "strval" of length "len".
862static void stropt_remove_val(char *origval, char *newval, uint32_t flags, char *strval, int len)
863{
864 // Remove newval[] from origval[]. (Note: "len" has been set above
865 // and is used here).
866 STRCPY(newval, origval)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(origval));
867 if (*strval) {
868 // may need to remove a comma
869 if (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) {
870 if (strval == origval) {
871 // include comma after string
872 if (strval[len] == ',') {
873 len++;
874 }
875 } else {
876 // include comma before string
877 strval--;
878 len++;
879 }
880 }
881 STRMOVE(newval + (strval - origval), strval + len)memmove((newval + (strval - origval)), (strval + len), strlen
(strval + len) + 1);
882 }
883}
884
885/// Remove flags that appear twice in the string option value 'newval'.
886static void stropt_remove_dupflags(char *newval, uint32_t flags)
887{
888 char *s = newval;
889 // Remove flags that appear twice.
890 for (s = newval; *s;) {
891 // if options have P_FLAGLIST and P_ONECOMMA such as 'whichwrap'
892 if (flags & P_ONECOMMA0x3000U) {
893 if (*s != ',' && *(s + 1) == ','
894 && vim_strchr(s + 2, (uint8_t)(*s)) != NULL((void*)0)) {
895 // Remove the duplicated value and the next comma.
896 STRMOVE(s, s + 2)memmove((s), (s + 2), strlen(s + 2) + 1);
897 continue;
898 }
899 } else {
900 if ((!(flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) || *s != ',')
901 && vim_strchr(s + 1, (uint8_t)(*s)) != NULL((void*)0)) {
902 STRMOVE(s, s + 1)memmove((s), (s + 1), strlen(s + 1) + 1);
903 continue;
904 }
905 }
906 s++;
907 }
908}
909
910/// Get the string value specified for a ":set" command. The following set
911/// options are supported:
912/// set {opt}&
913/// set {opt}<
914/// set {opt}={val}
915/// set {opt}:{val}
916static char *stropt_get_newval(int nextchar, OptIndex opt_idx, char **argp, void *varp,
917 char *origval, set_op_T *op_arg, uint32_t flags)
918{
919 char *arg = *argp;
920 set_op_T op = *op_arg;
921 char *save_arg = NULL((void*)0);
922 char *newval;
923 char *s = NULL((void*)0);
924 if (nextchar == '&') { // set to default val
925 newval = stropt_get_default_val(opt_idx, flags);
926 } else if (nextchar == '<') { // set to global val
927 newval = xstrdup(*(char **)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL));
928 } else {
929 arg++; // jump to after the '=' or ':'
930
931 // Set 'keywordprg' to ":help" if an empty
932 // value was passed to :set by the user.
933 if (varp == &p_kp && (*arg == NUL'\000' || *arg == ' ')) {
934 save_arg = arg;
935 arg = ":help";
936 }
937
938 // Copy the new string into allocated memory.
939 newval = stropt_copy_value(origval, &arg, op, flags);
940
941 // Expand environment variables and ~.
942 // Don't do it when adding without inserting a comma.
943 if (op == OP_NONE || (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U)) {
944 newval = stropt_expand_envvar(opt_idx, origval, newval, op);
945 }
946
947 // locate newval[] in origval[] when removing it
948 // and when adding to avoid duplicates
949 int len = 0;
950 if (op == OP_REMOVING || (flags & P_NODUP0x4000U)) {
951 len = (int)strlen(newval);
952 s = find_dup_item(origval, newval, flags);
953
954 // do not add if already there
955 if ((op == OP_ADDING || op == OP_PREPENDING) && s != NULL((void*)0)) {
956 op = OP_NONE;
957 STRCPY(newval, origval)strcpy((char *)(newval), (char *)(origval));
958 }
959
960 // if no duplicate, move pointer to end of original value
961 if (s == NULL((void*)0)) {
962 s = origval + (int)strlen(origval);
963 }
964 }
965
966 // concatenate the two strings; add a ',' if needed
967 if (op == OP_ADDING || op == OP_PREPENDING) {
968 stropt_concat_with_comma(origval, newval, op, flags);
969 } else if (op == OP_REMOVING) {
970 // Remove newval[] from origval[]. (Note: "len" has been set above
971 // and is used here).
972 stropt_remove_val(origval, newval, flags, s, len);
973 }
974
975 if (flags & P_FLAGLIST0x8000U) {
976 // Remove flags that appear twice.
977 stropt_remove_dupflags(newval, flags);
978 }
979 }
980
981 if (save_arg != NULL((void*)0)) {
982 arg = save_arg; // arg was temporarily changed, restore it
983 }
984 *argp = arg;
985 *op_arg = op;
986
987 return newval;
988}
989
990static set_op_T get_op(const char *arg)
991{
992 set_op_T op = OP_NONE;
993 if (*arg != NUL'\000' && *(arg + 1) == '=') {
994 if (*arg == '+') {
995 op = OP_ADDING; // "+="
996 } else if (*arg == '^') {
997 op = OP_PREPENDING; // "^="
998 } else if (*arg == '-') {
999 op = OP_REMOVING; // "-="
1000 }
1001 }
1002 return op;
1003}
1004
1005static set_prefix_T get_option_prefix(char **argp)
1006{
1007 if (strncmp(*argp, "no", 2) == 0) {
1008 *argp += 2;
1009 return PREFIX_NO;
1010 } else if (strncmp(*argp, "inv", 3) == 0) {
1011 *argp += 3;
1012 return PREFIX_INV;
1013 }
1014
1015 return PREFIX_NONE;
1016}
1017
1018static int validate_opt_idx(win_T *win, OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags, uint32_t flags,
1019 set_prefix_T prefix, const char **errmsg)
1020{
1021 // Only bools can have a prefix of 'inv' or 'no'
1022 if (!option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean) && prefix != PREFIX_NONE) {
1023 *errmsg = e_invarg;
1024 return FAIL0;
1025 }
1026
1027 // Skip all options that are not window-local (used when showing
1028 // an already loaded buffer in a window).
1029 if ((opt_flags & OPT_WINONLY) && (opt_idx == kOptInvalid || options[opt_idx].var != VAR_WIN((char *)-1))) {
1030 return FAIL0;
1031 }
1032
1033 // Skip all options that are window-local (used for :vimgrep).
1034 if ((opt_flags & OPT_NOWIN) && opt_idx != kOptInvalid && options[opt_idx].var == VAR_WIN((char *)-1)) {
1035 return FAIL0;
1036 }
1037
1038 // Disallow changing some options from modelines.
1039 if (opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE) {
1040 if (flags & (P_SECURE0x10000U | P_NO_ML0x400000U)) {
1041 *errmsg = e_not_allowed_in_modeline;
1042 return FAIL0;
1043 }
1044 if ((flags & P_MLE0x4000000U) && !p_mle) {
1045 *errmsg = e_not_allowed_in_modeline_when_modelineexpr_is_off;
1046 return FAIL0;
1047 }
1048 // In diff mode some options are overruled. This avoids that
1049 // 'foldmethod' becomes "marker" instead of "diff" and that
1050 // "wrap" gets set.
1051 if (win->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff
1052 && opt_idx != kOptInvalid // shut up coverity warning
1053 && (options[opt_idx].indir == PV_FDM(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDM))
1054 || options[opt_idx].indir == PV_WRAP(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WRAP)))) {
1055 return FAIL0;
1056 }
1057 }
1058
1059 // Disallow changing some options in the sandbox
1060 if (sandbox != 0 && (flags & P_SECURE0x10000U)) {
1061 *errmsg = e_sandbox;
1062 return FAIL0;
1063 }
1064
1065 return OK1;
1066}
1067
1068/// Skip over the name of a TTY option or keycode option.
1069///
1070/// @param[in] arg Start of TTY or keycode option name.
1071///
1072/// @return NULL when option isn't a TTY or keycode option. Otherwise pointer to the char after the
1073/// option name.
1074static const char *find_tty_option_end(const char *arg)
1075{
1076 if (strequal(arg, "term")) {
1077 return arg + sizeof("term") - 1;
1078 } else if (strequal(arg, "ttytype")) {
1079 return arg + sizeof("ttytype") - 1;
1080 }
1081
1082 const char *p = arg;
1083 bool_Bool delimit = false0; // whether to delimit <
1084
1085 if (arg[0] == '<') {
1086 // look out for <t_>;>
1087 delimit = true1;
1088 p++;
1089 }
1090 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_' && p[2] && p[3]) {
1091 p += 4;
1092 } else if (delimit) {
1093 // Search for delimiting >.
1094 while (*p != NUL'\000' && *p != '>') {
1095 p++;
1096 }
1097 }
1098 // Return NULL when delimiting > is not found.
1099 if (delimit) {
1100 if (*p != '>') {
1101 return NULL((void*)0);
1102 }
1103 p++;
1104 }
1105
1106 return arg == p ? NULL((void*)0) : p;
1107}
1108
1109/// Skip over the name of an option.
1110///
1111/// @param[in] arg Start of option name.
1112/// @param[out] opt_idxp Set to option index in options[] table.
1113///
1114/// @return NULL when no option name found. Otherwise pointer to the char after the option name.
1115const char *find_option_end(const char *arg, OptIndex *opt_idxp)
1116{
1117 const char *p;
1118
1119 // Handle TTY and keycode options separately.
1120 if ((p = find_tty_option_end(arg)) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1121 *opt_idxp = kOptInvalid;
1122 return p;
1123 } else {
1124 p = arg;
1125 }
1126
1127 if (!ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z'))) {
1128 *opt_idxp = kOptInvalid;
1129 return NULL((void*)0);
1130 }
1131 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z'))) {
1132 p++;
1133 }
1134
1135 *opt_idxp = find_option_len(arg, (size_t)(p - arg));
1136 return p;
1137}
1138
1139/// Get new option value from argp. Allocated OptVal must be freed by caller.
1140static OptVal get_option_newval(OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags, set_prefix_T prefix, char **argp,
1141 int nextchar, set_op_T op, uint32_t flags, void *varp, char *errbuf,
1142 const size_t errbuflen, const char **errmsg)
1143 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
1144{
1145 assert(varp != NULL)((void) sizeof ((varp != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ (
{ if (varp != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("varp != NULL"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 1145,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1146
1147 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
1148 char *arg = *argp;
1149 // When setting the local value of a global option, the old value may be the global value.
1150 const bool_Bool oldval_is_global = ((int)opt->indir & PV_BOTH) && (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL);
1151 OptVal oldval = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, oldval_is_global ? get_varp(opt) : varp);
1152 OptVal newval = NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
1153
1154 switch (oldval.type) {
1155 case kOptValTypeNil:
1156 abort();
1157 case kOptValTypeBoolean: {
1158 TriState newval_bool;
1159
1160 // ":set opt!": invert
1161 // ":set opt&": reset to default value
1162 // ":set opt<": reset to global value
1163 if (nextchar == '!') {
1164 switch (oldval.data.boolean) {
1165 case kNone:
1166 newval_bool = kNone;
1167 break;
1168 case kTrue:
1169 newval_bool = kFalse;
1170 break;
1171 case kFalse:
1172 newval_bool = kTrue;
1173 break;
1174 }
1175 } else if (nextchar == '&') {
1176 newval_bool = TRISTATE_FROM_INT(options[opt_idx].def_val.boolean)((options[opt_idx].def_val.boolean) == 0 ? kFalse : ((options
[opt_idx].def_val.boolean) >= 1 ? kTrue : kNone));
1177 } else if (nextchar == '<') {
1178 // For 'autoread', kNone means to use global value.
1179 if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ar && opt_flags == OPT_LOCAL) {
1180 newval_bool = kNone;
1181 } else {
1182 newval_bool = TRISTATE_FROM_INT(*(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL))((*(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL)
) == 0 ? kFalse : ((*(int *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx
]), OPT_GLOBAL)) >= 1 ? kTrue : kNone));
1183 }
1184 } else {
1185 // ":set invopt": invert
1186 // ":set opt" or ":set noopt": set or reset
1187 if (prefix == PREFIX_INV) {
1188 newval_bool = *(int *)varp ^ 1;
1189 } else {
1190 newval_bool = prefix == PREFIX_NO ? 0 : 1;
1191 }
1192 }
1193
1194 newval = BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(newval_bool)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = newval_bool
});
1195 break;
1196 }
1197 case kOptValTypeNumber: {
1198 OptInt oldval_num = oldval.data.number;
1199 OptInt newval_num;
1200
1201 // Different ways to set a number option:
1202 // & set to default value
1203 // < set to global value
1204 // <xx> accept special key codes for 'wildchar'
1205 // c accept any non-digit for 'wildchar'
1206 // [-]0-9 set number
1207 // other error
1208 arg++;
1209 if (nextchar == '&') {
1210 newval_num = options[opt_idx].def_val.number;
1211 } else if (nextchar == '<') {
1212 if ((OptInt *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ul && opt_flags == OPT_LOCAL) {
1213 // for 'undolevels' NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL means using the global newval_num
1214 newval_num = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL(-123456);
1215 } else if (opt_flags == OPT_LOCAL
1216 && ((OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso || (OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so)) {
1217 // for 'scrolloff'/'sidescrolloff' -1 means using the global newval_num
1218 newval_num = -1;
1219 } else {
1220 newval_num = *(OptInt *)get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), OPT_GLOBAL);
1221 }
1222 } else if (((OptInt *)varp == &p_wc || (OptInt *)varp == &p_wcm)
1223 && (*arg == '<' || *arg == '^'
1224 || (*arg != NUL'\000' && (!arg[1] || ascii_iswhite(arg[1]))
1225 && !ascii_isdigit(*arg)))) {
1226 newval_num = string_to_key(arg);
1227 if (newval_num == 0 && (OptInt *)varp != &p_wcm) {
1228 *errmsg = e_invarg;
1229 return newval;
1230 }
1231 } else if (*arg == '-' || ascii_isdigit(*arg)) {
1232 int i;
1233 // Allow negative, octal and hex numbers.
1234 vim_str2nr(arg, NULL((void*)0), &i, STR2NR_ALL, &newval_num, NULL((void*)0), 0, true1, NULL((void*)0));
1235 if (i == 0 || (arg[i] != NUL'\000' && !ascii_iswhite(arg[i]))) {
1236 *errmsg = e_number_required_after_equal;
1237 return newval;
1238 }
1239 } else {
1240 *errmsg = e_number_required_after_equal;
1241 return newval;
1242 }
1243
1244 if (op == OP_ADDING) {
1245 newval_num = oldval_num + newval_num;
1246 }
1247 if (op == OP_PREPENDING) {
1248 newval_num = oldval_num * newval_num;
1249 }
1250 if (op == OP_REMOVING) {
1251 newval_num = oldval_num - newval_num;
1252 }
1253
1254 newval = NUMBER_OPTVAL(newval_num)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data.number = newval_num
});
1255 break;
1256 }
1257 case kOptValTypeString: {
1258 char *oldval_str = oldval.data.string.data;
1259 // Get the new value for the option
1260 char *newval_str = stropt_get_newval(nextchar, opt_idx, argp, varp, oldval_str, &op, flags);
1261 newval = CSTR_AS_OPTVAL(newval_str)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = cstr_as_string
(newval_str) });
1262 break;
1263 }
1264 }
1265
1266 return newval;
1267}
1268
1269static void do_one_set_option(int opt_flags, char **argp, bool_Bool *did_show, char *errbuf,
1270 size_t errbuflen, const char **errmsg)
1271{
1272 // 1: nothing, 0: "no", 2: "inv" in front of name
1273 set_prefix_T prefix = get_option_prefix(argp);
1274
1275 char *arg = *argp;
1276
1277 // find end of name
1278 OptIndex opt_idx;
1279 const char *const option_end = find_option_end(arg, &opt_idx);
1280
1281 if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) {
1282 assert(option_end >= arg)((void) sizeof ((option_end >= arg) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (option_end >= arg) ; else __assert_fail ("option_end >= arg"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 1282,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1283 } else if (is_tty_option(arg)) { // Silently ignore TTY options.
1284 return;
1285 } else { // Invalid option name, skip.
1286 *errmsg = e_unknown_option;
1287 return;
1288 }
1289
1290 // Remember character after option name.
1291 uint8_t afterchar = (uint8_t)(*option_end);
1292 char *p = (char *)option_end;
1293
1294 // Skip white space, allow ":set ai ?".
1295 while (ascii_iswhite(*p)) {
1296 p++;
1297 }
1298
1299 set_op_T op = get_op(p);
1300 if (op != OP_NONE) {
1301 p++;
1302 }
1303
1304 uint8_t nextchar = (uint8_t)(*p); // next non-white char after option name
1305 uint32_t flags = 0; // flags for current option
1306 void *varp = NULL((void*)0); // pointer to variable for current option
1307
1308 if (options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) { // hidden option: skip
1309 // Only give an error message when requesting the value of
1310 // a hidden option, ignore setting it.
1311 if (vim_strchr("=:!&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)
1312 && (!option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean) || nextchar == '?')) {
1313 *errmsg = e_unsupportedoption;
1314 }
1315 return;
1316 }
1317
1318 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
1319 varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), opt_flags);
1320
1321 if (validate_opt_idx(curwin, opt_idx, opt_flags, flags, prefix, errmsg) == FAIL0) {
1322 return;
1323 }
1324
1325 if (vim_strchr("?=:!&<", nextchar) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1326 *argp = p;
1327
1328 if (nextchar == '&' && (*argp)[1] == 'v' && (*argp)[2] == 'i') {
1329 if ((*argp)[3] == 'm') { // "opt&vim": set to Vim default
1330 *argp += 3;
1331 } else { // "opt&vi": set to Vi default
1332 *argp += 2;
1333 }
1334 }
1335 if (vim_strchr("?!&<", nextchar) != NULL((void*)0)
1336 && (*argp)[1] != NUL'\000' && !ascii_iswhite((*argp)[1])) {
1337 *errmsg = e_trailing;
1338 return;
1339 }
1340 }
1341
1342 // Allow '=' and ':' as MS-DOS command.com allows only one '=' character per "set" command line.
1343 if (nextchar == '?'
1344 || (prefix == PREFIX_NONE && vim_strchr("=:&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)
1345 && !option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean))) {
1346 // print value
1347 if (*did_show) {
1348 msg_putchar('\n'); // cursor below last one
1349 } else {
1350 gotocmdline(true1); // cursor at status line
1351 *did_show = true1; // remember that we did a line
1352 }
1353 showoneopt(&options[opt_idx], opt_flags);
1354
1355 if (p_verbose > 0) {
1356 // Mention where the option was last set.
1357 if (varp == options[opt_idx].var) {
1358 option_last_set_msg(options[opt_idx].last_set);
1359 } else if ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_WIN) {
1360 option_last_set_msg(curwin->w_p_script_ctxw_onebuf_opt.wo_script_ctx[(int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_MASK]);
1361 } else if ((int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_BUF) {
1362 option_last_set_msg(curbuf->b_p_script_ctx[(int)options[opt_idx].indir & PV_MASK]);
1363 }
1364 }
1365
1366 if (nextchar != '?' && nextchar != NUL'\000' && !ascii_iswhite(afterchar)) {
1367 *errmsg = e_trailing;
1368 }
1369 return;
1370 }
1371
1372 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean)) {
1373 if (vim_strchr("=:", nextchar) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1374 *errmsg = e_invarg;
1375 return;
1376 }
1377
1378 if (vim_strchr("!&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0) && nextchar != NUL'\000' && !ascii_iswhite(afterchar)) {
1379 *errmsg = e_trailing;
1380 return;
1381 }
1382 } else {
1383 if (vim_strchr("=:&<", nextchar) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1384 *errmsg = e_invarg;
1385 return;
1386 }
1387 }
1388
1389 // Don't try to change hidden option.
1390 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) {
1391 return;
1392 }
1393
1394 OptVal newval = get_option_newval(opt_idx, opt_flags, prefix, argp, nextchar, op, flags, varp,
1395 errbuf, errbuflen, errmsg);
1396
1397 if (newval.type == kOptValTypeNil || *errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
1398 return;
1399 }
1400
1401 *errmsg = set_option(opt_idx, varp, newval, opt_flags, op == OP_NONE, errbuf, errbuflen);
1402}
1403
1404/// Parse 'arg' for option settings.
1405///
1406/// 'arg' may be IObuff, but only when no errors can be present and option
1407/// does not need to be expanded with option_expand().
1408/// "opt_flags":
1409/// 0 for ":set"
1410/// OPT_GLOBAL for ":setglobal"
1411/// OPT_LOCAL for ":setlocal" and a modeline
1412/// OPT_MODELINE for a modeline
1413/// OPT_WINONLY to only set window-local options
1414/// OPT_NOWIN to skip setting window-local options
1415///
1416/// @param arg option string (may be written to!)
1417///
1418/// @return FAIL if an error is detected, OK otherwise
1419int do_set(char *arg, int opt_flags)
1420{
1421 bool_Bool did_show = false0; // already showed one value
1422
1423 if (*arg == NUL'\000') {
1424 showoptions(false0, opt_flags);
1425 did_show = true1;
1426 } else {
1427 while (*arg != NUL'\000') { // loop to process all options
1428 if (strncmp(arg, "all", 3) == 0 && !ASCII_ISALPHA(arg[3])(((unsigned)(arg[3]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(arg[3]) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(arg[3]) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(
arg[3]) <= 'z'))
1429 && !(opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE)) {
1430 // ":set all" show all options.
1431 // ":set all&" set all options to their default value.
1432 arg += 3;
1433 if (*arg == '&') {
1434 arg++;
1435 // Only for :set command set global value of local options.
1436 set_options_default(opt_flags);
1437 didset_options();
1438 didset_options2();
1439 ui_refresh_options();
1440 redraw_all_later(UPD_CLEAR);
1441 } else {
1442 showoptions(true1, opt_flags);
1443 did_show = true1;
1444 }
1445 } else {
1446 char *startarg = arg; // remember for error message
1447 const char *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
1448 char errbuf[ERR_BUFLEN80];
1449
1450 do_one_set_option(opt_flags, &arg, &did_show, errbuf, sizeof(errbuf), &errmsg);
1451
1452 // Advance to next argument.
1453 // - skip until a blank found, taking care of backslashes
1454 // - skip blanks
1455 // - skip one "=val" argument (for hidden options ":set gfn =xx")
1456 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
1457 arg = skiptowhite_esc(arg);
1458 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1459 if (*arg != '=') {
1460 break;
1461 }
1462 }
1463
1464 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
1465 xstrlcpy(IObuff, _(errmsg)gettext(errmsg), IOSIZE(1024 + 1));
1466 int i = (int)strlen(IObuff) + 2;
1467 if (i + (arg - startarg) < IOSIZE(1024 + 1)) {
1468 // append the argument with the error
1469 xstrlcat(IObuff, ": ", IOSIZE(1024 + 1));
1470 assert(arg >= startarg)((void) sizeof ((arg >= startarg) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ (
{ if (arg >= startarg) ; else __assert_fail ("arg >= startarg"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 1470,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1471 memmove(IObuff + i, startarg, (size_t)(arg - startarg));
1472 IObuff[i + (arg - startarg)] = NUL'\000';
1473 }
1474 // make sure all characters are printable
1475 trans_characters(IObuff, IOSIZE(1024 + 1));
1476
1477 no_wait_return++; // wait_return() done later
1478 emsg(IObuff); // show error highlighted
1479 no_wait_return--;
1480
1481 return FAIL0;
1482 }
1483 }
1484
1485 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1486 }
1487 }
1488
1489 if (silent_mode && did_show) {
1490 // After displaying option values in silent mode.
1491 silent_mode = false0;
1492 info_message = true1; // use stdout, not stderr
1493 msg_putchar('\n');
1494 silent_mode = true1;
1495 info_message = false0; // use stdout, not stderr
1496 }
1497
1498 return OK1;
1499}
1500
1501// Translate a string like "t_xx", "<t_xx>" or "<S-Tab>" to a key number.
1502// When "has_lt" is true there is a '<' before "*arg_arg".
1503// Returns 0 when the key is not recognized.
1504static int find_key_len(const char *arg_arg, size_t len, bool_Bool has_lt)
1505{
1506 int key = 0;
1507 const char *arg = arg_arg;
1508
1509 // Don't use get_special_key_code() for t_xx, we don't want it to call
1510 // add_termcap_entry().
1511 if (len >= 4 && arg[0] == 't' && arg[1] == '_') {
1512 key = TERMCAP2KEY((uint8_t)arg[2], (uint8_t)arg[3])(-(((uint8_t)arg[2]) + ((int)((uint8_t)arg[3]) << 8)));
1513 } else if (has_lt) {
1514 arg--; // put arg at the '<'
1515 int modifiers = 0;
1516 key = find_special_key(&arg, len + 1, &modifiers, FSK_KEYCODE | FSK_KEEP_X_KEY | FSK_SIMPLIFY,
1517 NULL((void*)0));
1518 if (modifiers) { // can't handle modifiers here
1519 key = 0;
1520 }
1521 }
1522 return key;
1523}
1524
1525/// Convert a key name or string into a key value.
1526/// Used for 'wildchar' and 'cedit' options.
1527int string_to_key(char *arg)
1528{
1529 if (*arg == '<') {
1530 return find_key_len(arg + 1, strlen(arg), true1);
1531 }
1532 if (*arg == '^') {
1533 return CTRL_CHR((uint8_t)arg[1])(((((uint8_t)arg[1]) < 'a' || ((uint8_t)arg[1]) > 'z') ?
((uint8_t)arg[1]) : ((uint8_t)arg[1]) - ('a' - 'A')) ^ 0x40);
1534 }
1535 return (uint8_t)(*arg);
1536}
1537
1538// When changing 'title', 'titlestring', 'icon' or 'iconstring', call
1539// maketitle() to create and display it.
1540// When switching the title or icon off, call ui_set_{icon,title}(NULL) to get
1541// the old value back.
1542void did_set_title(void)
1543{
1544 if (starting != NO_SCREEN2) {
1545 maketitle();
1546 }
1547}
1548
1549/// set_options_bin - called when 'bin' changes value.
1550///
1551/// @param opt_flags OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL
1552void set_options_bin(int oldval, int newval, int opt_flags)
1553{
1554 // The option values that are changed when 'bin' changes are
1555 // copied when 'bin is set and restored when 'bin' is reset.
1556 if (newval) {
1557 if (!oldval) { // switched on
1558 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL)) {
1559 curbuf->b_p_tw_nobin = curbuf->b_p_tw;
1560 curbuf->b_p_wm_nobin = curbuf->b_p_wm;
1561 curbuf->b_p_ml_nobin = curbuf->b_p_ml;
1562 curbuf->b_p_et_nobin = curbuf->b_p_et;
1563 }
1564 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL)) {
1565 p_tw_nobin = p_tw;
1566 p_wm_nobin = p_wm;
1567 p_ml_nobin = p_ml;
1568 p_et_nobin = p_et;
1569 }
1570 }
1571
1572 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL)) {
1573 curbuf->b_p_tw = 0; // no automatic line wrap
1574 curbuf->b_p_wm = 0; // no automatic line wrap
1575 curbuf->b_p_ml = 0; // no modelines
1576 curbuf->b_p_et = 0; // no expandtab
1577 }
1578 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL)) {
1579 p_tw = 0;
1580 p_wm = 0;
1581 p_ml = false0;
1582 p_et = false0;
1583 p_bin = true1; // needed when called for the "-b" argument
1584 }
1585 } else if (oldval) { // switched off
1586 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL)) {
1587 curbuf->b_p_tw = curbuf->b_p_tw_nobin;
1588 curbuf->b_p_wm = curbuf->b_p_wm_nobin;
1589 curbuf->b_p_ml = curbuf->b_p_ml_nobin;
1590 curbuf->b_p_et = curbuf->b_p_et_nobin;
1591 }
1592 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL)) {
1593 p_tw = p_tw_nobin;
1594 p_wm = p_wm_nobin;
1595 p_ml = p_ml_nobin;
1596 p_et = p_et_nobin;
1597 }
1598 }
1599
1600 // Remember where the dependent option were reset
1601 didset_options_sctx(opt_flags, p_bin_dep_opts);
1602}
1603
1604/// Find the parameter represented by the given character (eg ', :, ", or /),
1605/// and return its associated value in the 'shada' string.
1606/// Only works for number parameters, not for 'r' or 'n'.
1607/// If the parameter is not specified in the string or there is no following
1608/// number, return -1.
1609int get_shada_parameter(int type)
1610{
1611 char *p = find_shada_parameter(type);
1612 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && ascii_isdigit(*p)) {
1613 return atoi(p);
1614 }
1615 return -1;
1616}
1617
1618/// Find the parameter represented by the given character (eg ''', ':', '"', or
1619/// '/') in the 'shada' option and return a pointer to the string after it.
1620/// Return NULL if the parameter is not specified in the string.
1621char *find_shada_parameter(int type)
1622{
1623 for (char *p = p_shada; *p; p++) {
1624 if (*p == type) {
1625 return p + 1;
1626 }
1627 if (*p == 'n') { // 'n' is always the last one
1628 break;
1629 }
1630 p = vim_strchr(p, ','); // skip until next ','
1631 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) { // hit the end without finding parameter
1632 break;
1633 }
1634 }
1635 return NULL((void*)0);
1636}
1637
1638/// Expand environment variables for some string options.
1639/// These string options cannot be indirect!
1640/// If "val" is NULL expand the current value of the option.
1641/// Return pointer to NameBuff, or NULL when not expanded.
1642static char *option_expand(OptIndex opt_idx, char *val)
1643{
1644 // if option doesn't need expansion nothing to do
1645 if (!(options[opt_idx].flags & P_EXPAND0x02U) || options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) {
1646 return NULL((void*)0);
1647 }
1648
1649 if (val == NULL((void*)0)) {
1650 val = *(char **)options[opt_idx].var;
1651 }
1652
1653 // If val is longer than MAXPATHL no meaningful expansion can be done,
1654 // expand_env() would truncate the string.
1655 if (val == NULL((void*)0) || strlen(val) > MAXPATHL4096) {
1656 return NULL((void*)0);
1657 }
1658
1659 // Expanding this with NameBuff, expand_env() must not be passed IObuff.
1660 // Escape spaces when expanding 'tags', they are used to separate file
1661 // names.
1662 // For 'spellsuggest' expand after "file:".
1663 expand_env_esc(val, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096,
1664 (char **)options[opt_idx].var == &p_tags, false0,
1665 (char **)options[opt_idx].var == &p_sps ? "file:"
1666 : NULL((void*)0));
1667 if (strcmp(NameBuff, val) == 0) { // they are the same
1668 return NULL((void*)0);
1669 }
1670
1671 return NameBuff;
1672}
1673
1674/// After setting various option values: recompute variables that depend on
1675/// option values.
1676static void didset_options(void)
1677{
1678 // initialize the table for 'iskeyword' et.al.
1679 init_chartab();
1680
1681 didset_string_options();
1682
1683 spell_check_msm();
1684 spell_check_sps();
1685 compile_cap_prog(curwin->w_s);
1686 did_set_spell_option(true1);
1687 // set cedit_key
1688 did_set_cedit(NULL((void*)0));
1689 // initialize the table for 'breakat'.
1690 did_set_breakat(NULL((void*)0));
1691 didset_window_options(curwin, true1);
1692}
1693
1694// More side effects of setting options.
1695static void didset_options2(void)
1696{
1697 // Initialize the highlight_attr[] table.
1698 highlight_changed();
1699
1700 // Parse default for 'fillchars'.
1701 set_chars_option(curwin, curwin->w_p_fcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_fcs, kFillchars, true1, NULL((void*)0), 0);
1702
1703 // Parse default for 'listchars'.
1704 set_chars_option(curwin, curwin->w_p_lcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_lcs, kListchars, true1, NULL((void*)0), 0);
1705
1706 // Parse default for 'wildmode'.
1707 check_opt_wim();
1708 xfree(curbuf->b_p_vsts_array);
1709 tabstop_set(curbuf->b_p_vsts, &curbuf->b_p_vsts_array);
1710 xfree(curbuf->b_p_vts_array);
1711 tabstop_set(curbuf->b_p_vts, &curbuf->b_p_vts_array);
1712}
1713
1714/// Check for string options that are NULL (normally only termcap options).
1715void check_options(void)
1716{
1717 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
1718 if ((option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeString)) && options[opt_idx].var != NULL((void*)0)) {
1719 check_string_option((char **)get_varp(&(options[opt_idx])));
1720 }
1721 }
1722}
1723
1724/// Check if option was set insecurely.
1725///
1726/// @param wp Window.
1727/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
1728/// @param opt_flags Option flags.
1729///
1730/// @return True if option was set from a modeline or in secure mode, false if it wasn't.
1731int was_set_insecurely(win_T *const wp, OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags)
1732{
1733 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 1733,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1734
1735 uint32_t *flagp = insecure_flag(wp, opt_idx, opt_flags);
1736 return (*flagp & P_INSECURE0x100000U) != 0;
1737}
1738
1739/// Get a pointer to the flags used for the P_INSECURE flag of option
1740/// "opt_idx". For some local options a local flags field is used.
1741/// NOTE: Caller must make sure that "wp" is set to the window from which
1742/// the option is used.
1743uint32_t *insecure_flag(win_T *const wp, OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags)
1744{
1745 if (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL) {
1746 assert(wp != NULL)((void) sizeof ((wp != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({
if (wp != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("wp != NULL", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c"
, 1746, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1747 switch ((int)options[opt_idx].indir) {
1748 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_STL)))):
1749 return &wp->w_p_stl_flags;
1750 case PV_WBR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WBR)))):
1751 return &wp->w_p_wbr_flags;
1752 case PV_FDE(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDE)):
1753 return &wp->w_p_fde_flags;
1754 case PV_FDT(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDT)):
1755 return &wp->w_p_fdt_flags;
1756 case PV_INDE(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INDE)):
1757 return &wp->w_buffer->b_p_inde_flags;
1758 case PV_FEX(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FEX)):
1759 return &wp->w_buffer->b_p_fex_flags;
1760 case PV_INEX(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INEX)):
1761 return &wp->w_buffer->b_p_inex_flags;
1762 }
1763 }
1764
1765 // Nothing special, return global flags field.
1766 return &options[opt_idx].flags;
1767}
1768
1769/// Redraw the window title and/or tab page text later.
1770void redraw_titles(void)
1771{
1772 need_maketitle = true1;
1773 redraw_tabline = true1;
1774}
1775
1776/// Return true if "val" is a valid name: only consists of alphanumeric ASCII
1777/// characters or characters in "allowed".
1778bool_Bool valid_name(const char *val, const char *allowed)
1779 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
1780{
1781 for (const char *s = val; *s != NUL'\000'; s++) {
1782 if (!ASCII_ISALNUM(*s)((((unsigned)(*s) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*s) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*s) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*s) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*s))
1783 && vim_strchr(allowed, (uint8_t)(*s)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1784 return false0;
1785 }
1786 }
1787 return true1;
1788}
1789
1790void check_blending(win_T *wp)
1791{
1792 wp->w_grid_alloc.blending =
1793 wp->w_p_winblw_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl > 0 || (wp->w_floating && wp->w_config.shadow);
1794}
1795
1796/// Handle setting `winhighlight' in window "wp"
1797bool_Bool parse_winhl_opt(win_T *wp)
1798{
1799 const char *p = wp->w_p_winhlw_onebuf_opt.wo_winhl;
1800
1801 if (!*p) {
1802 if (wp->w_ns_hl_winhl && wp->w_ns_hl == wp->w_ns_hl_winhl) {
1803 wp->w_ns_hl = 0;
1804 wp->w_hl_needs_update = true1;
1805 }
1806
1807 return true1;
1808 }
1809
1810 if (wp->w_ns_hl_winhl == 0) {
1811 wp->w_ns_hl_winhl = (int)nvim_create_namespace(NULL_STRING((String){ .data = ((void*)0), .size = 0 }));
1812 } else {
1813 // namespace already exist. invalidate existing items
1814 DecorProvider *dp = get_decor_provider(wp->w_ns_hl_winhl, true1);
1815 dp->hl_valid++;
1816 }
1817 wp->w_ns_hl = wp->w_ns_hl_winhl;
1818 int ns_hl = wp->w_ns_hl;
1819
1820 while (*p) {
1821 char *colon = strchr(p, ':');
1822 if (!colon) {
1823 return false0;
1824 }
1825 size_t nlen = (size_t)(colon - p);
1826 char *hi = colon + 1;
1827 char *commap = xstrchrnul(hi, ',');
1828 size_t len = (size_t)(commap - hi);
1829 int hl_id = len ? syn_check_group(hi, len) : -1;
1830 if (hl_id == 0) {
1831 return false0;
1832 }
1833 int hl_id_link = nlen ? syn_check_group(p, nlen) : 0;
1834
1835 HlAttrs attrs = HLATTRS_INIT(HlAttrs) { .rgb_ae_attr = 0, .cterm_ae_attr = 0, .rgb_fg_color
= -1, .rgb_bg_color = -1, .rgb_sp_color = -1, .cterm_fg_color
= 0, .cterm_bg_color = 0, .hl_blend = -1, .url = -1, };
1836 attrs.rgb_ae_attr |= HL_GLOBAL;
1837 ns_hl_def(ns_hl, hl_id_link, attrs, hl_id, NULL((void*)0));
1838
1839 p = *commap ? commap + 1 : "";
1840 }
1841
1842 wp->w_hl_needs_update = true1;
1843 return true1;
1844}
1845
1846/// Get the script context of global option at index opt_idx.
1847sctx_T *get_option_sctx(OptIndex opt_idx)
1848{
1849 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 1849,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1850 return &options[opt_idx].last_set.script_ctx;
1851}
1852
1853/// Set the script_ctx for an option, taking care of setting the buffer- or
1854/// window-local value.
1855void set_option_sctx(OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags, sctx_T script_ctx)
1856{
1857 bool_Bool both = (opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0;
1858 int indir = (int)options[opt_idx].indir;
1859 nlua_set_sctx(&script_ctx);
1860 LastSet last_set = {
1861 .script_ctx = script_ctx,
1862 .channel_id = current_channel_id,
1863 };
1864
1865 // Modeline already has the line number set.
1866 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE)) {
1867 last_set.script_ctx.sc_lnum += SOURCING_LNUM(((estack_T *)exestack.ga_data)[exestack.ga_len - 1].es_lnum);
1868 }
1869
1870 // Remember where the option was set. For local options need to do that
1871 // in the buffer or window structure.
1872 if (both || (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) || (indir & (PV_BUF|PV_WIN)) == 0) {
1873 options[opt_idx].last_set = last_set;
1874 }
1875 if (both || (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL)) {
1876 if (indir & PV_BUF) {
1877 curbuf->b_p_script_ctx[indir & PV_MASK] = last_set;
1878 } else if (indir & PV_WIN) {
1879 curwin->w_p_script_ctxw_onebuf_opt.wo_script_ctx[indir & PV_MASK] = last_set;
1880 if (both) {
1881 // also setting the "all buffers" value
1882 curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_script_ctx[indir & PV_MASK] = last_set;
1883 }
1884 }
1885 }
1886}
1887
1888/// Apply the OptionSet autocommand.
1889static void apply_optionset_autocmd(OptIndex opt_idx, int opt_flags, OptVal oldval, OptVal oldval_g,
1890 OptVal oldval_l, OptVal newval, const char *errmsg)
1891{
1892 // Don't do this while starting up, failure or recursively.
1893 if (starting || errmsg != NULL((void*)0) || *get_vim_var_str(VV_OPTION_TYPE) != NUL'\000') {
1894 return;
1895 }
1896
1897 char buf_type[7];
1898 typval_T oldval_tv = optval_as_tv(oldval, false0);
1899 typval_T oldval_g_tv = optval_as_tv(oldval_g, false0);
1900 typval_T oldval_l_tv = optval_as_tv(oldval_l, false0);
1901 typval_T newval_tv = optval_as_tv(newval, false0);
1902
1903 vim_snprintf(buf_type, sizeof(buf_type), "%s", (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL) ? "local" : "global");
1904 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_NEW, &newval_tv);
1905 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLD, &oldval_tv);
1906 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_TYPE, buf_type, -1);
1907 if (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL) {
1908 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_COMMAND, "setlocal", -1);
1909 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLDLOCAL, &oldval_tv);
1910 }
1911 if (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) {
1912 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_COMMAND, "setglobal", -1);
1913 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLDGLOBAL, &oldval_tv);
1914 }
1915 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0) {
1916 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_COMMAND, "set", -1);
1917 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLDLOCAL, &oldval_l_tv);
1918 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLDGLOBAL, &oldval_g_tv);
1919 }
1920 if (opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE) {
1921 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_COMMAND, "modeline", -1);
1922 set_vim_var_tv(VV_OPTION_OLDLOCAL, &oldval_tv);
1923 }
1924 apply_autocmds(EVENT_OPTIONSET, options[opt_idx].fullname, NULL((void*)0), false0, NULL((void*)0));
1925 reset_v_option_vars();
1926}
1927
1928/// Process the updated 'arabic' option value.
1929static const char *did_set_arabic(optset_T *args)
1930{
1931 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
1932 const char *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
1933
1934 if (win->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab) {
1935 // 'arabic' is set, handle various sub-settings.
1936 if (!p_tbidi) {
1937 // set rightleft mode
1938 if (!win->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1939 win->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl = true1;
1940 changed_window_setting(curwin);
1941 }
1942
1943 // Enable Arabic shaping (major part of what Arabic requires)
1944 if (!p_arshape) {
1945 p_arshape = true1;
1946 redraw_all_later(UPD_NOT_VALID);
1947 }
1948 }
1949
1950 // Arabic requires a utf-8 encoding, inform the user if it's not
1951 // set.
1952 if (strcmp(p_enc, "utf-8") != 0) {
1953 static char *w_arabic = N_("W17: Arabic requires UTF-8, do ':set encoding=utf-8'")"W17: Arabic requires UTF-8, do ':set encoding=utf-8'";
1954
1955 msg_source(HL_ATTR(HLF_W)hl_attr_active[(int)(HLF_W)]);
1956 msg(_(w_arabic)gettext(w_arabic), HL_ATTR(HLF_W)hl_attr_active[(int)(HLF_W)]);
1957 set_vim_var_string(VV_WARNINGMSG, _(w_arabic)gettext(w_arabic), -1);
1958 }
1959
1960 // set 'delcombine'
1961 p_deco = true1;
1962
1963 // Force-set the necessary keymap for arabic.
1964 errmsg = set_option_value(kOptKeymap, STATIC_CSTR_AS_OPTVAL("arabic")((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = ((String
) { .data = "arabic", .size = sizeof("" "arabic") - 1 }) }), OPT_LOCAL);
1965 } else {
1966 // 'arabic' is reset, handle various sub-settings.
1967 if (!p_tbidi) {
1968 // reset rightleft mode
1969 if (win->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl) {
1970 win->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl = false0;
1971 changed_window_setting(curwin);
1972 }
1973
1974 // 'arabicshape' isn't reset, it is a global option and
1975 // another window may still need it "on".
1976 }
1977
1978 // 'delcombine' isn't reset, it is a global option and another
1979 // window may still want it "on".
1980
1981 // Revert to the default keymap
1982 curbuf->b_p_iminsert = B_IMODE_NONE0;
1983 curbuf->b_p_imsearch = B_IMODE_USE_INSERT(-1);
1984 }
1985
1986 return errmsg;
1987}
1988
1989/// Process the updated 'autochdir' option value.
1990static const char *did_set_autochdir(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
1991{
1992 // Change directories when the 'acd' option is set now.
1993 do_autochdir();
1994 return NULL((void*)0);
1995}
1996
1997/// Process the updated 'binary' option value.
1998static const char *did_set_binary(optset_T *args)
1999{
2000 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2001
2002 // when 'bin' is set also set some other options
2003 set_options_bin((int)args->os_oldval.boolean, buf->b_p_bin, args->os_flags);
2004 redraw_titles();
2005
2006 return NULL((void*)0);
2007}
2008
2009/// Process the updated 'buflisted' option value.
2010static const char *did_set_buflisted(optset_T *args)
2011{
2012 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2013
2014 // when 'buflisted' changes, trigger autocommands
2015 if (args->os_oldval.boolean != buf->b_p_bl) {
2016 apply_autocmds(buf->b_p_bl ? EVENT_BUFADD : EVENT_BUFDELETE,
2017 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), true1, buf);
2018 }
2019 return NULL((void*)0);
2020}
2021
2022/// Process the new 'cmdheight' option value.
2023static const char *did_set_cmdheight(optset_T *args)
2024{
2025 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2026
2027 if (p_ch > Rows - min_rows() + 1) {
2028 p_ch = Rows - min_rows() + 1;
2029 }
2030
2031 // if p_ch changed value, change the command line height
2032 // Only compute the new window layout when startup has been
2033 // completed. Otherwise the frame sizes may be wrong.
2034 if ((p_ch != old_value
2035 || tabline_height() + global_stl_height() + topframe->fr_height != Rows - p_ch)
2036 && full_screen) {
2037 command_height();
2038 }
2039
2040 return NULL((void*)0);
2041}
2042
2043/// Process the updated 'diff' option value.
2044static const char *did_set_diff(optset_T *args)
2045{
2046 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2047 // May add or remove the buffer from the list of diff buffers.
2048 diff_buf_adjust(win);
2049 if (foldmethodIsDiff(win)) {
2050 foldUpdateAll(win);
2051 }
2052 return NULL((void*)0);
2053}
2054
2055/// Process the updated 'endoffile' or 'endofline' or 'fixendofline' or 'bomb'
2056/// option value.
2057static const char *did_set_eof_eol_fixeol_bomb(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2058{
2059 // redraw the window title and tab page text
2060 redraw_titles();
2061 return NULL((void*)0);
2062}
2063
2064/// Process the updated 'equalalways' option value.
2065static const char *did_set_equalalways(optset_T *args)
2066{
2067 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2068 if (p_ea && !args->os_oldval.boolean) {
2069 win_equal(win, false0, 0);
2070 }
2071
2072 return NULL((void*)0);
2073}

2077{
2078 newFoldLevel();
2079 return NULL((void*)0);
2080}

2084{
2085 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2086 foldUpdateAll(win);
2087 return NULL((void*)0);
2088}
2089
2090/// Process the new 'foldnestmax' option value.
2091static const char *did_set_foldnestmax(optset_T *args)
2092{
2093 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2094 if (foldmethodIsSyntax(win) || foldmethodIsIndent(win)) {
2095 foldUpdateAll(win);
2096 }
2097 return NULL((void*)0);
2098}
2099
2100/// Process the new 'helpheight' option value.
2101static const char *did_set_helpheight(optset_T *args)
2102{
2103 // Change window height NOW
2104 if (!ONE_WINDOW(firstwin == lastwin)) {
2105 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2106 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2107 if (buf->b_help && win->w_height < p_hh) {
2108 win_setheight((int)p_hh);
2109 }
2110 }
2111
2112 return NULL((void*)0);
2113}

2116static const char *did_set_hlsearch(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2117{
2118 // when 'hlsearch' is set or reset: reset no_hlsearch
2119 set_no_hlsearch(false0);
2120 return NULL((void*)0);
2121}
2122
2123/// Process the updated 'ignorecase' option value.
2124static const char *did_set_ignorecase(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2125{
2126 // when 'ignorecase' is set or reset and 'hlsearch' is set, redraw
2127 if (p_hls) {
2128 redraw_all_later(UPD_SOME_VALID);
2129 }
2130 return NULL((void*)0);
2131}
2132
2133/// Process the new 'iminset' option value.
2134static const char *did_set_iminsert(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2135{
2136 showmode();
2137 // Show/unshow value of 'keymap' in status lines.
2138 status_redraw_curbuf();
2139
2140 return NULL((void*)0);
2141}
2142
2143/// Process the updated 'langnoremap' option value.
2144static const char *did_set_langnoremap(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2145{
2146 // 'langnoremap' -> !'langremap'
2147 p_lrm = !p_lnr;
2148 return NULL((void*)0);
2149}
2150
2151/// Process the updated 'langremap' option value.
2152static const char *did_set_langremap(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2153{
2154 // 'langremap' -> !'langnoremap'
2155 p_lnr = !p_lrm;
2156 return NULL((void*)0);
2157}
2158
2159/// Process the new 'laststatus' option value.
2160static const char *did_set_laststatus(optset_T *args)
2161{
2162 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2163 OptInt value = args->os_newval.number;
2164
2165 // When switching to global statusline, decrease topframe height
2166 // Also clear the cmdline to remove the ruler if there is one
2167 if (value == 3 && old_value != 3) {
2168 frame_new_height(topframe, topframe->fr_height - STATUS_HEIGHT, false0, false0);
2169 win_comp_pos();
2170 clear_cmdline = true1;
2171 }
2172 // When switching from global statusline, increase height of topframe by STATUS_HEIGHT
2173 // in order to to re-add the space that was previously taken by the global statusline
2174 if (old_value == 3 && value != 3) {
2175 frame_new_height(topframe, topframe->fr_height + STATUS_HEIGHT, false0, false0);
2176 win_comp_pos();
2177 }
2178
2179 last_status(false0); // (re)set last window status line.
2180 return NULL((void*)0);
2181}
2182
2183/// Process the updated 'lines' or 'columns' option value.
2184static const char *did_set_lines_or_columns(optset_T *args)
2185{
2186 // If the screen (shell) height has been changed, assume it is the
2187 // physical screenheight.
2188 if (p_lines != Rows || p_columns != Columns) {
2189 // Changing the screen size is not allowed while updating the screen.
2190 if (updating_screen) {
2191 OptVal oldval = (OptVal){ .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data = args->os_oldval };
2192 set_option_varp(args->os_idx, args->os_varp, oldval, false0);
2193 } else if (full_screen) {
2194 screen_resize((int)p_columns, (int)p_lines);
2195 } else {
2196 // TODO(bfredl): is this branch ever needed?
2197 // Postpone the resizing; check the size and cmdline position for
2198 // messages.
2199 Rows = (int)p_lines;
2200 Columns = (int)p_columns;
2201 check_screensize();
2202 int new_row = (int)(Rows - MAX(p_ch, 1)(((p_ch)>(1))?(p_ch):(1)));
2203 if (cmdline_row > new_row && Rows > p_ch) {
2204 assert(p_ch >= 0 && new_row <= INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((p_ch >= 0 && new_row <= 2147483647
) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (p_ch >= 0 && new_row
<= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("p_ch >= 0 && new_row <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 2204,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
2205 cmdline_row = new_row;
2206 }
2207 }
2208 if (p_window >= Rows || !option_was_set(kOptWindow)) {
2209 p_window = Rows - 1;
2210 }
2211 }
2212
2213 // Adjust 'scrolljump' if needed.
2214 if (p_sj >= Rows && full_screen) {
2215 p_sj = Rows / 2;
2216 }
2217
2218 return NULL((void*)0);
2219}
2220
2221/// Process the updated 'lisp' option value.
2222static const char *did_set_lisp(optset_T *args)
2223{
2224 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2225 // When 'lisp' option changes include/exclude '-' in keyword characters.
2226 buf_init_chartab(buf, false0); // ignore errors
2227 return NULL((void*)0);
2228}
2229
2230/// Process the updated 'modifiable' option value.
2231static const char *did_set_modifiable(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2232{
2233 // when 'modifiable' is changed, redraw the window title
2234 redraw_titles();
2235
2236 return NULL((void*)0);
2237}
2238
2239/// Process the updated 'modified' option value.
2240static const char *did_set_modified(optset_T *args)
2241{
2242 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2243 if (!args->os_newval.boolean) {
2244 save_file_ff(buf); // Buffer is unchanged
2245 }
2246 redraw_titles();
2247 modified_was_set = (int)args->os_newval.boolean;
2248 return NULL((void*)0);
2249}
2250
2251/// Process the updated 'number' or 'relativenumber' option value.
2252static const char *did_set_number_relativenumber(optset_T *args)
2253{
2254 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2255 if (*win->w_p_stcw_onebuf_opt.wo_stc != NUL'\000') {
2256 // When 'relativenumber'/'number' is changed and 'statuscolumn' is set, reset width.
2257 win->w_nrwidth_line_count = 0;
2258 }
2259 check_signcolumn(win);
2260 return NULL((void*)0);
2261}
2262
2263/// Process the new 'numberwidth' option value.
2264static const char *did_set_numberwidth(optset_T *args)
2265{
2266 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2267 win->w_nrwidth_line_count = 0; // trigger a redraw
2268
2269 return NULL((void*)0);
2270}
2271
2272/// Process the updated 'paste' option value.
2273static const char *did_set_paste(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2274{
2275 static int old_p_paste = false0;
2276 static int save_sm = 0;
2277 static int save_sta = 0;
2278 static int save_ru = 0;
2279 static int save_ri = 0;
2280
2281 if (p_paste) {
2282 // Paste switched from off to on.
2283 // Save the current values, so they can be restored later.
2284 if (!old_p_paste) {
2285 // save options for each buffer
2286 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
2287 buf->b_p_tw_nopaste = buf->b_p_tw;
2288 buf->b_p_wm_nopaste = buf->b_p_wm;
2289 buf->b_p_sts_nopaste = buf->b_p_sts;
2290 buf->b_p_ai_nopaste = buf->b_p_ai;
2291 buf->b_p_et_nopaste = buf->b_p_et;
2292 if (buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste) {
2293 xfree(buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste);
2294 }
2295 buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste = buf->b_p_vsts && buf->b_p_vsts != empty_string_option
2296 ? xstrdup(buf->b_p_vsts)
2297 : NULL((void*)0);
2298 }
2299
2300 // save global options
2301 save_sm = p_sm;
2302 save_sta = p_sta;
2303 save_ru = p_ru;
2304 save_ri = p_ri;
2305 // save global values for local buffer options
2306 p_ai_nopaste = p_ai;
2307 p_et_nopaste = p_et;
2308 p_sts_nopaste = p_sts;
2309 p_tw_nopaste = p_tw;
2310 p_wm_nopaste = p_wm;
2311 if (p_vsts_nopaste) {
2312 xfree(p_vsts_nopaste);
2313 }
2314 p_vsts_nopaste = p_vsts && p_vsts != empty_string_option ? xstrdup(p_vsts) : NULL((void*)0);
2315 }
2316
2317 // Always set the option values, also when 'paste' is set when it is
2318 // already on.
2319 // set options for each buffer
2320 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
2321 buf->b_p_tw = 0; // textwidth is 0
2322 buf->b_p_wm = 0; // wrapmargin is 0
2323 buf->b_p_sts = 0; // softtabstop is 0
2324 buf->b_p_ai = 0; // no auto-indent
2325 buf->b_p_et = 0; // no expandtab
2326 if (buf->b_p_vsts) {
2327 free_string_option(buf->b_p_vsts);
2328 }
2329 buf->b_p_vsts = empty_string_option;
2330 XFREE_CLEAR(buf->b_p_vsts_array)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(buf->b_p_vsts_array); xfree
(*ptr_); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
2331 }
2332
2333 // set global options
2334 p_sm = 0; // no showmatch
2335 p_sta = 0; // no smarttab
2336 if (p_ru) {
2337 status_redraw_all(); // redraw to remove the ruler
2338 }
2339 p_ru = 0; // no ruler
2340 p_ri = 0; // no reverse insert
2341 // set global values for local buffer options
2342 p_tw = 0;
2343 p_wm = 0;
2344 p_sts = 0;
2345 p_ai = 0;
2346 p_et = 0;
2347 if (p_vsts) {
2348 free_string_option(p_vsts);
2349 }
2350 p_vsts = empty_string_option;
2351 } else if (old_p_paste) {
2352 // Paste switched from on to off: Restore saved values.
2353
2354 // restore options for each buffer
2355 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
2356 buf->b_p_tw = buf->b_p_tw_nopaste;
2357 buf->b_p_wm = buf->b_p_wm_nopaste;
2358 buf->b_p_sts = buf->b_p_sts_nopaste;
2359 buf->b_p_ai = buf->b_p_ai_nopaste;
2360 buf->b_p_et = buf->b_p_et_nopaste;
2361 if (buf->b_p_vsts) {
2362 free_string_option(buf->b_p_vsts);
2363 }
2364 buf->b_p_vsts = buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste ? xstrdup(buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste) : empty_string_option;
2365 xfree(buf->b_p_vsts_array);
2366 if (buf->b_p_vsts && buf->b_p_vsts != empty_string_option) {
2367 tabstop_set(buf->b_p_vsts, &buf->b_p_vsts_array);
2368 } else {
2369 buf->b_p_vsts_array = NULL((void*)0);
2370 }
2371 }
2372
2373 // restore global options
2374 p_sm = save_sm;
2375 p_sta = save_sta;
2376 if (p_ru != save_ru) {
2377 status_redraw_all(); // redraw to draw the ruler
2378 }
2379 p_ru = save_ru;
2380 p_ri = save_ri;
2381 // set global values for local buffer options
2382 p_ai = p_ai_nopaste;
2383 p_et = p_et_nopaste;
2384 p_sts = p_sts_nopaste;
2385 p_tw = p_tw_nopaste;
2386 p_wm = p_wm_nopaste;
2387 if (p_vsts) {
2388 free_string_option(p_vsts);
2389 }
2390 p_vsts = p_vsts_nopaste ? xstrdup(p_vsts_nopaste) : empty_string_option;
2391 }
2392
2393 old_p_paste = p_paste;
2394
2395 // Remember where the dependent options were reset
2396 didset_options_sctx((OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL), p_paste_dep_opts);
2397
2398 return NULL((void*)0);
2399}
2400
2401/// Process the updated 'previewwindow' option value.
2402static const char *did_set_previewwindow(optset_T *args)
2403{
2404 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2405
2406 if (!win->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw) {
2407 return NULL((void*)0);
2408 }
2409
2410 // There can be only one window with 'previewwindow' set.
2411 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, curtab)for (win_T *wp = ((curtab) == curtab) ? firstwin : (curtab)->
tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
2412 if (wp->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw && wp != win) {
2413 win->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw = false0;
2414 return e_preview_window_already_exists;
2415 }
2416 }
2417
2418 return NULL((void*)0);
2419}
2420
2421/// Process the new 'pumblend' option value.
2422static const char *did_set_pumblend(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2423{
2424 hl_invalidate_blends();
2425 pum_grid.blending = (p_pb > 0);
2426 if (pum_drawn()) {
2427 pum_redraw();
2428 }
2429
2430 return NULL((void*)0);
2431}
2432
2433/// Process the updated 'readonly' option value.
2434static const char *did_set_readonly(optset_T *args)
2435{
2436 // when 'readonly' is reset globally, also reset readonlymode
2437 if (!curbuf->b_p_ro && (args->os_flags & OPT_LOCAL) == 0) {
2438 readonlymode = false0;
2439 }
2440
2441 // when 'readonly' is set may give W10 again
2442 if (curbuf->b_p_ro) {
2443 curbuf->b_did_warn = false0;
2444 }
2445
2446 redraw_titles();
2447
2448 return NULL((void*)0);
2449}
2450
2451/// Process the new 'scrollback' option value.
2452static const char *did_set_scrollback(optset_T *args)
2453{
2454 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2455 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2456 OptInt value = args->os_newval.number;
2457
2458 if (buf->terminal && value < old_value) {
2459 // Force the scrollback to take immediate effect only when decreasing it.
2460 on_scrollback_option_changed(buf->terminal);
2461 }
2462 return NULL((void*)0);
2463}
2464
2465/// Process the updated 'scrollbind' option value.
2466static const char *did_set_scrollbind(optset_T *args)
2467{
2468 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2469
2470 // when 'scrollbind' is set: snapshot the current position to avoid a jump
2471 // at the end of normal_cmd()
2472 if (!win->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb) {
2473 return NULL((void*)0);
2474 }
2475 do_check_scrollbind(false0);
2476 win->w_scbind_pos = win->w_topline;
2477 return NULL((void*)0);
2478}
2479
2480#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
2481/// Process the updated 'shellslash' option value.
