2482static const char *did_set_shellslash(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2483{
2484 if (p_ssl) {
2485 psepc = '/';
2486 psepcN = '\\';
2487 pseps[0] = '/';
2488 } else {
2489 psepc = '\\';
2490 psepcN = '/';
2491 pseps[0] = '\\';
2492 }
2493
2494 // need to adjust the file name arguments and buffer names.
2495 buflist_slash_adjust();
2496 alist_slash_adjust();
2497 scriptnames_slash_adjust();
2498 return NULL((void*)0);
2499}
2500#endif
2501
2502/// Process the new 'shiftwidth' or the 'tabstop' option value.
2503static const char *did_set_shiftwidth_tabstop(optset_T *args)
2504{
2505 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2506 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2507 OptInt *pp = (OptInt *)args->os_varp;
2508
2509 if (foldmethodIsIndent(win)) {
2510 foldUpdateAll(win);
2511 }
2512 // When 'shiftwidth' changes, or it's zero and 'tabstop' changes:
2513 // parse 'cinoptions'.
2514 if (pp == &buf->b_p_sw || buf->b_p_sw == 0) {
2515 parse_cino(buf);
2516 }
2517
2518 return NULL((void*)0);
2519}
2520
2521/// Process the new 'showtabline' option value.
2522static const char *did_set_showtabline(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2523{
2524 // (re)set tab page line
2525 win_new_screen_rows(); // recompute window positions and heights
2526 return NULL((void*)0);
2527}
2528
2529/// Process the updated 'smoothscroll' option value.
2530static const char *did_set_smoothscroll(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2531{
2532 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2533 if (!win->w_p_smsw_onebuf_opt.wo_sms) {
2534 win->w_skipcol = 0;
2535 }
2536
2537 return NULL((void*)0);
2538}
2539
2540/// Process the updated 'spell' option value.
2541static const char *did_set_spell(optset_T *args)
2542{
2543 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2544 if (win->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell) {
2545 return parse_spelllang(win);
2546 }
2547
2548 return NULL((void*)0);
2549}
2550
2551/// Process the updated 'swapfile' option value.
2552static const char *did_set_swapfile(optset_T *args)
2553{
2554 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2555 // when 'swf' is set, create swapfile, when reset remove swapfile
2556 if (buf->b_p_swf && p_uc) {
2557 ml_open_file(buf); // create the swap file
2558 } else {
2559 // no need to reset curbuf->b_may_swap, ml_open_file() will check
2560 // buf->b_p_swf
2561 mf_close_file(buf, true1); // remove the swap file
2562 }
2563 return NULL((void*)0);
2564}
2565
2566/// Process the new 'textwidth' option value.
2567static const char *did_set_textwidth(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2568{
2569 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *(tp) = first_tabpage; (tp) != ((void*)0); (tp
) = (tp)->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin
: (tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next
) {
2570 check_colorcolumn(wp);
2571 }
2572
2573 return NULL((void*)0);
2574}
2575
2576/// Process the updated 'title' or the 'icon' option value.
2577static const char *did_set_title_icon(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2578{
2579 // when 'title' changed, may need to change the title; same for 'icon'
2580 did_set_title();
2581 return NULL((void*)0);
2582}
2583
2584/// Process the new 'titlelen' option value.
2585static const char *did_set_titlelen(optset_T *args)
2586{
2587 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2588
2589 // if 'titlelen' has changed, redraw the title
2590 if (starting != NO_SCREEN2 && old_value != p_titlelen) {
2591 need_maketitle = true1;
2592 }
2593
2594 return NULL((void*)0);
2595}
2596
2597/// Process the updated 'undofile' option value.
2598static const char *did_set_undofile(optset_T *args)
2599{
2600 // Only take action when the option was set.
2601 if (!curbuf->b_p_udf && !p_udf) {
2602 return NULL((void*)0);
2603 }
2604
2605 // When reset we do not delete the undo file, the option may be set again
2606 // without making any changes in between.
2607 uint8_t hash[UNDO_HASH_SIZE];
2608
2609 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(bp)for (buf_T *bp = firstbuf; bp != ((void*)0); bp = bp->b_next
) {
2610 // When 'undofile' is set globally: for every buffer, otherwise
2611 // only for the current buffer: Try to read in the undofile,
2612 // if one exists, the buffer wasn't changed and the buffer was
2613 // loaded
2614 if ((curbuf == bp
2615 || (args->os_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) || args->os_flags == 0)
2616 && !bufIsChanged(bp) && bp->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0)) {
2617 u_compute_hash(bp, hash);
2618 u_read_undo(NULL((void*)0), hash, bp->b_fname);
2619 }
2620 }
2621
2622 return NULL((void*)0);
2623}
2624
2625/// Process the new global 'undolevels' option value.
2626const char *did_set_global_undolevels(OptInt value, OptInt old_value)
2627{
2628 // sync undo before 'undolevels' changes
2629 // use the old value, otherwise u_sync() may not work properly
2630 p_ul = old_value;
2631 u_sync(true1);
2632 p_ul = value;
2633 return NULL((void*)0);
2634}
2635
2636/// Process the new buffer local 'undolevels' option value.
2637const char *did_set_buflocal_undolevels(buf_T *buf, OptInt value, OptInt old_value)
2638{
2639 // use the old value, otherwise u_sync() may not work properly
2640 buf->b_p_ul = old_value;
2641 u_sync(true1);
2642 buf->b_p_ul = value;
2643 return NULL((void*)0);
2644}
2645
2646/// Process the new 'undolevels' option value.
2647static const char *did_set_undolevels(optset_T *args)
2648{
2649 buf_T *buf = (buf_T *)args->os_buf;
2650 OptInt *pp = (OptInt *)args->os_varp;
2651
2652 if (pp == &p_ul) { // global 'undolevels'
2653 did_set_global_undolevels(args->os_newval.number, args->os_oldval.number);
2654 } else if (pp == &curbuf->b_p_ul) { // buffer local 'undolevels'
2655 did_set_buflocal_undolevels(buf, args->os_newval.number, args->os_oldval.number);
2656 }
2657
2658 return NULL((void*)0);
2659}
2660
2661/// Process the new 'updatecount' option value.
2662static const char *did_set_updatecount(optset_T *args)
2663{
2664 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2665
2666 // when 'updatecount' changes from zero to non-zero, open swap files
2667 if (p_uc && !old_value) {
2668 ml_open_files();
2669 }
2670
2671 return NULL((void*)0);
2672}
2673
2674/// Process the new 'wildchar' / 'wildcharm' option value.
2675static const char *did_set_wildchar(optset_T *args)
2676{
2677 OptInt c = *(OptInt *)args->os_varp;
2678
2679 // Don't allow key values that wouldn't work as wildchar.
2680 if (c == Ctrl_C3 || c == '\n' || c == '\r' || c == K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8)))) {
2681 return e_invarg;
2682 }
2683
2684 return NULL((void*)0);
2685}
2686
2687/// Process the new 'winblend' option value.
2688static const char *did_set_winblend(optset_T *args)
2689{
2690 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2691 OptInt old_value = args->os_oldval.number;
2692 OptInt value = args->os_newval.number;
2693
2694 if (value != old_value) {
2695 win->w_p_winblw_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl = MAX(MIN(win->w_p_winbl, 100), 0)((((((win->w_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl)<(100))?(win->w_onebuf_opt
.wo_winbl):(100)))>(0))?((((win->w_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl)
<(100))?(win->w_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl):(100))):(0));
2696 win->w_hl_needs_update = true1;
2697 check_blending(win);
2698 }
2699
2700 return NULL((void*)0);
2701}
2702
2703/// Process the new 'window' option value.
2704static const char *did_set_window(optset_T *args FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2705{
2706 if (p_window < 1) {
2707 p_window = Rows - 1;
2708 } else if (p_window >= Rows) {
2709 p_window = Rows - 1;
2710 }
2711 return NULL((void*)0);
2712}
2713
2714/// Process the new 'winheight' value.
2715static const char *did_set_winheight(optset_T *args)
2716{
2717 // Change window height NOW
2718 if (!ONE_WINDOW(firstwin == lastwin)) {
2719 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2720 if (win->w_height < p_wh) {
2721 win_setheight((int)p_wh);
2722 }
2723 }
2724
2725 return NULL((void*)0);
2726}
2727
2728/// Process the new 'winwidth' option value.
2729static const char *did_set_winwidth(optset_T *args)
2730{
2731 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2732
2733 if (!ONE_WINDOW(firstwin == lastwin) && win->w_width < p_wiw) {
2734 win_setwidth((int)p_wiw);
2735 }
2736 return NULL((void*)0);
2737}
2738
2739/// Process the updated 'wrap' option value.
2740static const char *did_set_wrap(optset_T *args)
2741{
2742 win_T *win = (win_T *)args->os_win;
2743 // Set w_leftcol or w_skipcol to zero.
2744 if (win->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap) {
2745 win->w_leftcol = 0;
2746 } else {
2747 win->w_skipcol = 0;
2748 }
2749
2750 return NULL((void*)0);
2751}
2752
2753// When 'syntax' is set, load the syntax of that name
2754static void do_syntax_autocmd(buf_T *buf, bool_Bool value_changed)
2755{
2756 static int syn_recursive = 0;
2757
2758 syn_recursive++;
2759 // Only pass true for "force" when the value changed or not used
2760 // recursively, to avoid endless recurrence.
2761 apply_autocmds(EVENT_SYNTAX, buf->b_p_syn, buf->b_fname,
2762 value_changed || syn_recursive == 1, buf);
2763 buf->b_flags |= BF_SYN_SET0x200;
2764 syn_recursive--;
2765}
2766
2767static void do_spelllang_source(win_T *win)
2768{
2769 char fname[200];
2770 char *q = win->w_s->b_p_spl;
2771
2772 // Skip the first name if it is "cjk".
2773 if (strncmp(q, "cjk,", 4) == 0) {
2774 q += 4;
2775 }
2776
2777 // Source the spell/LANG.{vim,lua} in 'runtimepath'.
2778 // They could set 'spellcapcheck' depending on the language.
2779 // Use the first name in 'spelllang' up to '_region' or
2780 // '.encoding'.
2781 char *p;
2782 for (p = q; *p != NUL'\000'; p++) {
2783 if (!ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*p)) && *p != '-') {
2784 break;
2785 }
2786 }
2787 if (p > q) {
2788 vim_snprintf(fname, sizeof(fname), "spell/%.*s.*", (int)(p - q), q);
2789 source_runtime_vim_lua(fname, DIP_ALL);
2790 }
2791}
2792
2793/// Check the bounds of numeric options.
2794///
2795/// @param opt_idx Index in options[] table. Must not be kOptInvalid.
2796/// @param[in] varp Pointer to option variable.
2797/// @param[in,out] newval Pointer to new option value. Will be set to bound checked value.
2798/// @param[out] errbuf Buffer for error message. Cannot be NULL.
2799/// @param errbuflen Length of error buffer.
2800///
2801/// @return Error message, if any.
2802static const char *check_num_option_bounds(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp, OptInt *newval,
2803 char *errbuf, size_t errbuflen)
2804 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(4)
2805{
2806 const char *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
2807
2808 switch (opt_idx) {
2809 case kOptLines:
2810 if (*newval < min_rows() && full_screen) {
2811 vim_snprintf(errbuf, errbuflen, _("E593: Need at least %d lines")gettext("E593: Need at least %d lines"), min_rows());
2812 errmsg = errbuf;
2813 *newval = min_rows();
2814 }
2815 // True max size is defined by check_screensize().
2816 *newval = MIN(*newval, INT_MAX)(((*newval)<(2147483647))?(*newval):(2147483647));
2817 break;
2818 case kOptColumns:
2819 if (*newval < MIN_COLUMNS && full_screen) {
2820 vim_snprintf(errbuf, errbuflen, _("E594: Need at least %d columns")gettext("E594: Need at least %d columns"), MIN_COLUMNS);
2821 errmsg = errbuf;
2822 *newval = MIN_COLUMNS;
2823 }
2824 // True max size is defined by check_screensize().
2825 *newval = MIN(*newval, INT_MAX)(((*newval)<(2147483647))?(*newval):(2147483647));
2826 break;
2827 case kOptPumblend:
2828 *newval = MAX(MIN(*newval, 100), 0)((((((*newval)<(100))?(*newval):(100)))>(0))?((((*newval
)<(100))?(*newval):(100))):(0));
2829 break;
2830 case kOptScrolljump:
2831 if ((*newval < -100 || *newval >= Rows) && full_screen) {
2832 errmsg = e_scroll;
2833 *newval = 1;
2834 }
2835 break;
2836 case kOptScroll:
2837 if (varp == &(curwin->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr)
2838 && (*newval <= 0
2839 || (*newval > curwin->w_height_inner && curwin->w_height_inner > 0))
2840 && full_screen) {
2841 if (*newval != 0) {
2842 errmsg = e_scroll;
2843 }
2844 *newval = win_default_scroll(curwin);
2845 }
2846 break;
2847 default:
2848 break;
2849 }
2850
2851 return errmsg;
2852}
2853
2854/// Validate and bound check option value.
2855///
2856/// @param opt_idx Index in options[] table. Must not be kOptInvalid.
2857/// @param[in] varp Pointer to option variable.
2858/// @param[in,out] newval Pointer to new option value. Will be set to bound checked value.
2859/// @param[out] errbuf Buffer for error message. Cannot be NULL.
2860/// @param errbuflen Length of error buffer.
2861///
2862/// @return Error message, if any.
2863static const char *validate_num_option(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp, OptInt *newval, char *errbuf,
2864 size_t errbuflen)
2865{
2866 OptInt value = *newval;
2867
2868 // Many number options assume their value is in the signed int range.
2869 if (value < INT_MIN(-2147483647 -1) || value > INT_MAX2147483647) {
2870 return e_invarg;
2871 }
2872
2873 if (varp == &p_wh) {
2874 if (value < 1) {
2875 return e_positive;
2876 } else if (p_wmh > value) {
2877 return e_winheight;
2878 }
2879 } else if (varp == &p_hh) {
2880 if (value < 0) {
2881 return e_positive;
2882 }
2883 } else if (varp == &p_wmh) {
2884 if (value < 0) {
2885 return e_positive;
2886 } else if (value > p_wh) {
2887 return e_winheight;
2888 }
2889 } else if (varp == &p_wiw) {
2890 if (value < 1) {
2891 return e_positive;
2892 } else if (p_wmw > value) {
2893 return e_winwidth;
2894 }
2895 } else if (varp == &p_wmw) {
2896 if (value < 0) {
2897 return e_positive;
2898 } else if (value > p_wiw) {
2899 return e_winwidth;
2900 }
2901 } else if (varp == &p_mco) {
2902 *newval = MAX_MCO6;
2903 } else if (varp == &p_titlelen) {
2904 if (value < 0) {
2905 return e_positive;
2906 }
2907 } else if (varp == &p_uc) {
2908 if (value < 0) {
2909 return e_positive;
2910 }
2911 } else if (varp == &p_ch) {
2912 if (value < 0) {
2913 return e_positive;
2914 } else {
2915 p_ch_was_zero = value == 0;
2916 }
2917 } else if (varp == &p_tm) {
2918 if (value < 0) {
2919 return e_positive;
2920 }
2921 } else if (varp == &p_hi) {
2922 if (value < 0) {
2923 return e_positive;
2924 } else if (value > 10000) {
2925 return e_invarg;
2926 }
2927 } else if (varp == &p_pyx) {
2928 if (value == 0) {
2929 *newval = 3;
2930 } else if (value != 3) {
2931 return e_invarg;
2932 }
2933 } else if (varp == &p_re) {
2934 if (value < 0 || value > 2) {
2935 return e_invarg;
2936 }
2937 } else if (varp == &p_report) {
2938 if (value < 0) {
2939 return e_positive;
2940 }
2941 } else if (varp == &p_so) {
2942 if (value < 0 && full_screen) {
2943 return e_positive;
2944 }
2945 } else if (varp == &p_siso) {
2946 if (value < 0 && full_screen) {
2947 return e_positive;
2948 }
2949 } else if (varp == &p_cwh) {
2950 if (value < 1) {
2951 return e_positive;
2952 }
2953 } else if (varp == &p_ut) {
2954 if (value < 0) {
2955 return e_positive;
2956 }
2957 } else if (varp == &p_ss) {
2958 if (value < 0) {
2959 return e_positive;
2960 }
2961 } else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl || varp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_fdl) {
2962 if (value < 0) {
2963 return e_positive;
2964 }
2965 } else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole || varp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_cole) {
2966 if (value < 0) {
2967 return e_positive;
2968 } else if (value > 3) {
2969 return e_invarg;
2970 }
2971 } else if (varp == &curwin->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw || varp == &curwin->w_allbuf_opt.wo_nuw) {
2972 if (value < 1) {
2973 return e_positive;
2974 } else if (value > MAX_NUMBERWIDTH20) {
2975 return e_invarg;
2976 }
2977 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_iminsert || varp == &p_iminsert) {
2978 if (value < 0 || value > B_IMODE_LAST1) {
2979 return e_invarg;
2980 }
2981 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_imsearch || varp == &p_imsearch) {
2982 if (value < -1 || value > B_IMODE_LAST1) {
2983 return e_invarg;
2984 }
2985 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_channel || varp == &p_channel) {
2986 return e_invarg;
2987 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_scbk || varp == &p_scbk) {
2988 if (value < -1 || value > SB_MAX100000) {
2989 return e_invarg;
2990 }
2991 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_sw || varp == &p_sw) {
2992 if (value < 0) {
2993 return e_positive;
2994 }
2995 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_ts || varp == &p_ts) {
2996 if (value < 1) {
2997 return e_positive;
2998 } else if (value > TABSTOP_MAX9999) {
2999 return e_invarg;
3000 }
3001 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_tw || varp == &p_tw) {
3002 if (value < 0) {
3003 return e_positive;
3004 }
3005 } else if (varp == &p_wd) {
3006 if (value < 0) {
3007 return e_positive;
3008 }
3009 }
3010
3011 return check_num_option_bounds(opt_idx, varp, newval, errbuf, errbuflen);
3012}
3013
3014/// Called after an option changed: check if something needs to be redrawn.
3015void check_redraw_for(buf_T *buf, win_T *win, uint32_t flags)
3016{
3017 // Careful: P_RALL is a combination of other P_ flags
3018 bool_Bool all = (flags & P_RALL0xC00U) == P_RALL0xC00U;
3019
3020 if ((flags & P_RSTAT0x200U) || all) { // mark all status lines and window bars dirty
3021 status_redraw_all();
3022 }
3023
3024 if ((flags & P_RTABL0x100U) || all) { // mark tablines dirty
3025 redraw_tabline = true1;
3026 }
3027
3028 if ((flags & P_RBUF0x800U) || (flags & P_RWIN0x400U) || all) {
3029 if (flags & P_HLONLY0x2000000U) {
3030 redraw_later(win, UPD_NOT_VALID);
3031 } else {
3032 changed_window_setting(win);
3033 }
3034 }
3035 if (flags & P_RBUF0x800U) {
3036 redraw_buf_later(buf, UPD_NOT_VALID);
3037 }
3038 if (all) {
3039 redraw_all_later(UPD_NOT_VALID);
3040 }
3041}
3042
3043void check_redraw(uint32_t flags)
3044{
3045 check_redraw_for(curbuf, curwin, flags);
3046}
3047
3048bool_Bool is_tty_option(const char *name)
3049 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
3050{
3051 return find_tty_option_end(name) != NULL((void*)0);
3052}
3053
3054#define TCO_BUFFER_SIZE8 8
3055
3056/// Get value of TTY option.
3057///
3058/// @param name Name of TTY option.
3059///
3060/// @return [allocated] TTY option value. Returns NIL_OPTVAL if option isn't a TTY option.
3061OptVal get_tty_option(const char *name)
3062{
3063 char *value = NULL((void*)0);
3064
3065 if (strequal(name, "t_Co")) {
3066 if (t_colors <= 1) {
3067 value = xstrdup("");
3068 } else {
3069 value = xmalloc(TCO_BUFFER_SIZE8);
3070 snprintf(value, TCO_BUFFER_SIZE8, "%d", t_colors);
3071 }
3072 } else if (strequal(name, "term")) {
3073 value = p_term ? xstrdup(p_term) : xstrdup("nvim");
3074 } else if (strequal(name, "ttytype")) {
3075 value = p_ttytype ? xstrdup(p_ttytype) : xstrdup("nvim");
3076 } else if (is_tty_option(name)) {
3077 // XXX: All other t_* options were removed in 3baba1e7.
3078 value = xstrdup("");
3079 }
3080
3081 return value == NULL((void*)0) ? NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil }) : CSTR_AS_OPTVAL(value)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = cstr_as_string
(value) });
3082}
3083
3084bool_Bool set_tty_option(const char *name, char *value)
3085{
3086 if (strequal(name, "term")) {
3087 if (p_term) {
3088 xfree(p_term);
3089 }
3090 p_term = value;
3091 return true1;
3092 }
3093
3094 if (strequal(name, "ttytype")) {
3095 if (p_ttytype) {
3096 xfree(p_ttytype);
3097 }
3098 p_ttytype = value;
3099 return true1;
3100 }
3101
3102 return false0;
3103}
3104
3105/// Find index for an option. Don't go beyond `len` length.
3106///
3107/// @param[in] name Option name.
3108/// @param len Option name length.
3109///
3110/// @return Option index or kOptInvalid if option was not found.
3111OptIndex find_option_len(const char *const name, size_t len)
3112 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
3113{
3114 int index = find_option_hash(name, len);
3115 return index >= 0 ? option_hash_elems[index].opt_idx : kOptInvalid;
3116}
3117
3118/// Find index for an option.
3119///
3120/// @param[in] name Option name.
3121///
3122/// @return Option index or kOptInvalid if option was not found.
3123OptIndex find_option(const char *const name)
3124 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
3125{
3126 return find_option_len(name, strlen(name));
3127}
3128
3129/// Free an allocated OptVal.
3130void optval_free(OptVal o)
3131{
3132 switch (o.type) {
3133 case kOptValTypeNil:
3134 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3135 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3136 break;
3137 case kOptValTypeString:
3138 // Don't free empty string option
3139 if (o.data.string.data != empty_string_option) {
3140 api_free_string(o.data.string);
3141 }
3142 break;
3143 }
3144}
3145
3146/// Copy an OptVal.
3147OptVal optval_copy(OptVal o)
3148{
3149 switch (o.type) {
3150 case kOptValTypeNil:
3151 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3152 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3153 return o;
3154 case kOptValTypeString:
3155 return STRING_OPTVAL(copy_string(o.data.string, NULL))((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = copy_string
(o.data.string, ((void*)0)) });
3156 }
3157 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3158}
3159
3160/// Check if two option values are equal.
3161bool_Bool optval_equal(OptVal o1, OptVal o2)
3162{
3163 if (o1.type != o2.type) {
3164 return false0;
3165 }
3166
3167 switch (o1.type) {
3168 case kOptValTypeNil:
3169 return true1;
3170 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3171 return o1.data.boolean == o2.data.boolean;
3172 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3173 return o1.data.number == o2.data.number;
3174 case kOptValTypeString:
3175 return o1.data.string.size == o2.data.string.size
3176 && strnequal(o1.data.string.data, o2.data.string.data, o1.data.string.size);
3177 }
3178 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3179}
3180
3181/// Create OptVal from var pointer.
3182///
3183/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3184/// @param[out] varp Pointer to option variable.
3185///
3186/// @return Option value stored in varp.
3187OptVal optval_from_varp(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp)
3188{
3189 // Special case: 'modified' is b_changed, but we also want to consider it set when 'ff' or 'fenc'
3190 // changed.
3191 if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_changed) {
3192 return BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(curbufIsChanged())((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = curbufIsChanged
() });
3193 }
3194
3195 if (option_is_multitype(opt_idx)) {
3196 // Multitype options are stored as OptVal.
3197 return varp == NULL((void*)0) ? NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil }) : *(OptVal *)varp;
3198 }
3199
3200 // If the option only supports a single type, it means that the index of the option's type flag
3201 // corresponds to the value of the type enum. So get the index of the type flag using xctz() and
3202 // use that as the option's type.
3203 OptValType type = xctz(options[opt_idx].type_flags);
3204 assert(type > kOptValTypeNil && type < kOptValTypeSize)((void) sizeof ((type > kOptValTypeNil && type <
(kOptValTypeString + 1)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (type
> kOptValTypeNil && type < (kOptValTypeString +
1)) ; else __assert_fail ("type > kOptValTypeNil && type < kOptValTypeSize"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 3204,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3205
3206 switch (type) {
3207 case kOptValTypeNil:
3208 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3209 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3210 return BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(varp == NULL ? false : TRISTATE_FROM_INT(*(int *)varp))((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = varp ==
((void*)0) ? 0 : ((*(int *)varp) == 0 ? kFalse : ((*(int *)varp
) >= 1 ? kTrue : kNone)) });
3211 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3212 return NUMBER_OPTVAL(varp == NULL ? 0 : *(OptInt *)varp)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data.number = varp ==
((void*)0) ? 0 : *(OptInt *)varp });
3213 case kOptValTypeString:
3214 return STRING_OPTVAL(varp == NULL ? (String)STRING_INIT : cstr_as_string(*(char **)varp))((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = varp ==
((void*)0) ? (String){ .data = ((void*)0), .size = 0 } : cstr_as_string
(*(char **)varp) });
3215 }
3216 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3217}
3218
3219/// Set option var pointer value from OptVal.
3220///
3221/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3222/// @param[out] varp Pointer to option variable.
3223/// @param[in] value New option value.
3224/// @param free_oldval Free old value.
3225static void set_option_varp(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp, OptVal value, bool_Bool free_oldval)
3226 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2)
3227{
3228 assert(option_has_type(opt_idx, value.type))((void) sizeof ((option_has_type(opt_idx, value.type)) ? 1 : 0
), __extension__ ({ if (option_has_type(opt_idx, value.type))
; else __assert_fail ("option_has_type(opt_idx, value.type)"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 3228,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3229
3230 if (free_oldval) {
3231 optval_free(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp));
3232 }
3233
3234 switch (value.type) {
3235 case kOptValTypeNil:
3236 abort();
3237 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3238 *(int *)varp = value.data.boolean;
3239 return;
3240 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3241 *(OptInt *)varp = value.data.number;
3242 return;
3243 case kOptValTypeString:
3244 *(char **)varp = value.data.string.data;
3245 return;
3246 }
3247 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3248}
3249
3250/// Return C-string representation of OptVal. Caller must free the returned C-string.
3251static char *optval_to_cstr(OptVal o)
3252{
3253 switch (o.type) {
3254 case kOptValTypeNil:
3255 return xstrdup("");
3256 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3257 return xstrdup(o.data.boolean ? "true" : "false");
3258 case kOptValTypeNumber: {
3259 char *buf = xmalloc(NUMBUFLEN);
3260 snprintf(buf, NUMBUFLEN, "%" PRId64"l" "d", o.data.number);
3261 return buf;
3262 }
3263 case kOptValTypeString: {
3264 char *buf = xmalloc(o.data.string.size + 3);
3265 snprintf(buf, o.data.string.size + 3, "\"%s\"", o.data.string.data);
3266 return buf;
3267 }
3268 }
3269 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3270}
3271
3272/// Convert an OptVal to an API Object.
3273Object optval_as_object(OptVal o)
3274{
3275 switch (o.type) {
3276 case kOptValTypeNil:
3277 return NIL((Object){ .type = kObjectTypeNil });
3278 case kOptValTypeBoolean:
3279 switch (o.data.boolean) {
3280 case kFalse:
3281 case kTrue:
3282 return BOOLEAN_OBJ(o.data.boolean)((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = o.data
.boolean });
3283 case kNone:
3284 return NIL((Object){ .type = kObjectTypeNil });
3285 }
3286 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3287 case kOptValTypeNumber:
3288 return INTEGER_OBJ(o.data.number)((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = o.data
.number });
3289 case kOptValTypeString:
3290 return STRING_OBJ(o.data.string)((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeString, .data.string = o.data.
string });
3291 }
3292 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3293}
3294
3295/// Convert an API Object to an OptVal.
3296OptVal object_as_optval(Object o, bool_Bool *error)
3297{
3298 switch (o.type) {
3299 case kObjectTypeNil:
3300 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3301 case kObjectTypeBoolean:
3302 return BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(o.data.boolean)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = o.data
.boolean });
3303 case kObjectTypeInteger:
3304 return NUMBER_OPTVAL((OptInt)o.data.integer)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data.number = (OptInt
)o.data.integer });
3305 case kObjectTypeString:
3306 return STRING_OPTVAL(o.data.string)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = o.data.
string });
3307 default:
3308 *error = true1;
3309 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3310 }
3311 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3312}
3313
3314/// Unset the local value of an option. The exact semantics of this depend on the option.
3315/// TODO(famiu): Remove this once we have a dedicated OptVal type for unset local options.
3316///
3317/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3318/// @param[in] varp Pointer to option variable.
3319///
3320/// @return [allocated] Option value equal to the unset value for the option.
3321static OptVal optval_unset_local(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp)
3322{
3323 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
3324 // For global-local options, use the unset value of the local value.
3325 if (opt->indir & PV_BOTH) {
3326 // String global-local options always use an empty string for the unset value.
3327 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeString)) {
3328 return STATIC_CSTR_TO_OPTVAL("")((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeString, .data.string = ((String
){ .data = xmemdupz("", sizeof("") - 1), .size = sizeof("") -
1 }) });
3329 }
3330
3331 if ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ar) {
3332 return BOOLEAN_OPTVAL(kNone)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = kNone
});
3333 } else if ((OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so || (OptInt *)varp == &curwin->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso) {
3334 return NUMBER_OPTVAL(-1)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data.number = -1 });
3335 } else if ((OptInt *)varp == &curbuf->b_p_ul) {
3336 return NUMBER_OPTVAL(NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL)((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNumber, .data.number = (-123456
) });
3337 } else {
3338 // This should never happen.
3339 abort();
3340 }
3341 }
3342 // For options that aren't global-local, just set the local value to the global value.
3343 return get_option_value(opt_idx, OPT_GLOBAL);
3344}
3345
3346/// Get an allocated string containing a list of valid types for an option.
3347/// For options with a singular type, it returns the name of the type. For options with multiple
3348/// possible types, it returns a slash separated list of types. For example, if an option can be a
3349/// number, boolean or string, the function returns "Number/Boolean/String"
3350static char *option_get_valid_types(OptIndex opt_idx)
3351{
3352 StringBuilder str = KV_INITIAL_VALUE{ .size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0) };
3353 kv_resize(str, 32)((str).capacity = (32), (str).items = xrealloc((str).items, sizeof
((str).items[0]) * (str).capacity));
3354
3355 // Iterate through every valid option value type and check if the option supports that type
3356 for (OptValType type = 0; type < kOptValTypeSize(kOptValTypeString + 1); type++) {
3357 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, type)) {
3358 const char *typename = optval_type_get_name(type);
3359
3360 if (str.size == 0) {
3361 kv_concat(str, typename)if (strlen(typename) > 0) { do { if ((str).capacity < (
str).size + strlen(typename)) { (str).capacity = (str).size +
strlen(typename); ((--((str).capacity)), (((str).capacity)|=
((str).capacity)>>1, ((str).capacity)|=((str).capacity)
>>2, ((str).capacity)|=((str).capacity)>>4, ((str
).capacity)|=((str).capacity)>>8, ((str).capacity)|=((str
).capacity)>>16), (++((str).capacity))); (((str)).capacity
= ((str).capacity), ((str)).items = xrealloc(((str)).items, sizeof
(((str)).items[0]) * ((str)).capacity)); } } while (0); ((void
) sizeof (((str).items) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if ((str).
items) ; else __assert_fail ("(str).items", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c"
, 3361, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); })); memcpy((str)
.items + (str).size, typename, sizeof((str).items[0]) * strlen
(typename)); (str).size = (str).size + strlen(typename); };
3362 } else {
3363 kv_printf(str, "/%s", typename)kv_do_printf(&(str), "/%s", typename);
3364 }
3365 }
3366 }
3367
3368 // Ensure that the string is NUL-terminated.
3369 kv_push(str, NUL)(*((((str).size == (str).capacity) ? (((str).capacity = ((str
).capacity ? (str).capacity << 1 : 8), (str).items = xrealloc
((str).items, sizeof((str).items[0]) * (str).capacity)), 0) :
0), ((str).items + ((str).size++))) = ('\000'));
3370 return str.items;
3371
3372#undef OPTION_ADD_TYPE
3373}
3374
3375/// Check if option is hidden.
3376///
3377/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3378///
3379/// @return True if option is hidden, false otherwise. Returns false if option name is invalid.
3380bool_Bool is_option_hidden(OptIndex opt_idx)
3381{
3382 return opt_idx == kOptInvalid ? false0 : get_varp(&options[opt_idx]) == NULL((void*)0);
3383}
3384
3385/// Get option flags.
3386///
3387/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3388///
3389/// @return Option flags. Returns 0 for invalid option name.
3390uint32_t get_option_flags(OptIndex opt_idx)
3391{
3392 return opt_idx == kOptInvalid ? 0 : options[opt_idx].flags;
3393}
3394
3395/// Gets the value for an option.
3396///
3397/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3398/// @param[in] scope Option scope (can be OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL or a combination).
3399///
3400/// @return [allocated] Option value. Returns NIL_OPTVAL for invalid option index.
3401OptVal get_option_value(OptIndex opt_idx, int scope)
3402{
3403 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid) { // option not in the options[] table.
3404 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3405 }
3406
3407 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
3408 void *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, scope);
3409
3410 return optval_copy(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp));
3411}
3412
3413/// Return information for option at 'opt_idx'
3414vimoption_T *get_option(OptIndex opt_idx)
3415{
3416 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 3416,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3417 return &options[opt_idx];
3418}
3419
3420/// Check if local value of global-local option is unset for current buffer / window.
3421/// Always returns false for options that aren't global-local.
3422///
3423/// TODO(famiu): Remove this once we have an OptVal type to indicate an unset local value.
3424static bool_Bool is_option_local_value_unset(vimoption_T *opt, buf_T *buf, win_T *win)
3425{
3426 // Local value of option that isn't global-local is always considered set.
3427 if (!((int)opt->indir & PV_BOTH)) {
3428 return false0;
3429 }
3430
3431 // Get pointer to local value in varp_local, and a pointer to the currently used value in varp.
3432 // If the local value is the one currently being used, that indicates that it's set.
3433 // Otherwise it indicates the local value is unset.
3434 void *varp = get_varp_from(opt, buf, win);
3435 void *varp_local = get_varp_scope_from(opt, OPT_LOCAL, buf, win);
3436
3437 return varp != varp_local;
3438}
3439
3440/// Handle side-effects of setting an option.
3441///
3442/// @param opt_idx Index in options[] table. Must not be kOptInvalid.
3443/// @param[in] varp Option variable pointer, cannot be NULL.
3444/// @param old_value Old option value.
3445/// @param new_value New option value.
3446/// @param opt_flags Option flags.
3447/// @param[out] value_checked Value was checked to be safe, no need to set P_INSECURE.
3448/// @param value_replaced Value was replaced completely.
3449/// @param[out] errbuf Buffer for error message.
3450/// @param errbuflen Length of error buffer.
3451///
3452/// @return NULL on success, an untranslated error message on error.
3453static const char *did_set_option(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp, OptVal old_value, OptVal new_value,
3454 int opt_flags, bool_Bool *value_checked, bool_Bool value_replaced,
3455 char *errbuf, // NOLINT(readability-non-const-parameter)
3456 size_t errbuflen)
3457{
3458 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
3459 const char *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
3460 bool_Bool restore_chartab = false0;
3461 bool_Bool free_oldval = (opt->flags & P_ALLOCED0x01U);
3462 bool_Bool value_changed = false0;
3463
3464 optset_T did_set_cb_args = {
3465 .os_varp = varp,
3466 .os_idx = opt_idx,
3467 .os_flags = opt_flags,
3468 .os_oldval = old_value.data,
3469 .os_newval = new_value.data,
3470 .os_value_checked = false0,
3471 .os_value_changed = false0,
3472 .os_restore_chartab = false0,
3473 .os_errbuf = errbuf,
3474 .os_errbuflen = errbuflen,
3475 .os_buf = curbuf,
3476 .os_win = curwin
3477 };
3478
3479 // Disallow changing immutable options.
3480 if (opt->immutable && !optval_equal(old_value, new_value)) {
3481 errmsg = e_unsupportedoption;
3482 }
3483 // Disallow changing some options from secure mode.
3484 else if ((secure || sandbox != 0) && (opt->flags & P_SECURE0x10000U)) {
3485 errmsg = e_secure;
3486 }
3487 // Check for a "normal" directory or file name in some string options.
3488 else if (new_value.type == kOptValTypeString
3489 && check_illegal_path_names(*(char **)varp, opt->flags)) {
3490 errmsg = e_invarg;
3491 } else if (opt->opt_did_set_cb != NULL((void*)0)) {
3492 // Invoke the option specific callback function to validate and apply the new value.
3493 errmsg = opt->opt_did_set_cb(&did_set_cb_args);
3494 // The 'filetype' and 'syntax' option callback functions may change the os_value_changed field.
3495 value_changed = did_set_cb_args.os_value_changed;
3496 // The 'keymap', 'filetype' and 'syntax' option callback functions may change the
3497 // os_value_checked field.
3498 *value_checked = did_set_cb_args.os_value_checked;
3499 // The 'isident', 'iskeyword', 'isprint' and 'isfname' options may change the character table.
3500 // On failure, this needs to be restored.
3501 restore_chartab = did_set_cb_args.os_restore_chartab;
3502 }
3503
3504 // If an error is detected, restore the previous value and don't do any further processing.
3505 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
3506 set_option_varp(opt_idx, varp, old_value, true1);
3507 // When resetting some values, need to act on it.
3508 if (restore_chartab) {
3509 buf_init_chartab(curbuf, true1);
3510 }
3511
3512 // Unset new_value as it is no longer valid.
3513 new_value = NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil }); // NOLINT(clang-analyzer-deadcode.DeadStores)
Value stored to 'new_value' is never read
3514 return errmsg;
3515 }
3516
3517 // Re-assign the new value as its value may get freed or modified by the option callback.
3518 new_value = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp);
3519
3520 // Remember where the option was set.
3521 set_option_sctx(opt_idx, opt_flags, current_sctx);
3522 // Free options that are in allocated memory.
3523 // Use "free_oldval", because recursiveness may change the flags (esp. init_highlight()).
3524 if (free_oldval) {
3525 optval_free(old_value);
3526 }
3527 opt->flags |= P_ALLOCED0x01U;
3528
3529 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0 && (opt->indir & PV_BOTH)) {
3530 // Global option with local value set to use global value.
3531 // Free the local value and clear it.
3532 void *varp_local = get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_LOCAL);
3533 OptVal local_unset_value = optval_unset_local(opt_idx, varp_local);
3534 set_option_varp(opt_idx, varp_local, local_unset_value, true1);
3535 } else if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0) {
3536 // May set global value for local option.
3537 void *varp_global = get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_GLOBAL);
3538 set_option_varp(opt_idx, varp_global, optval_copy(new_value), true1);
3539 }
3540
3541 // Trigger the autocommand only after setting the flags.
3542 if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_syn) {
3543 do_syntax_autocmd(curbuf, value_changed);
3544 } else if (varp == &curbuf->b_p_ft) {
3545 // 'filetype' is set, trigger the FileType autocommand
3546 // Skip this when called from a modeline
3547 // Force autocmd when the filetype was changed
3548 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE) || value_changed) {
3549 do_filetype_autocmd(curbuf, value_changed);
3550 }
3551 } else if (varp == &curwin->w_s->b_p_spl) {
3552 do_spelllang_source(curwin);
3553 }
3554
3555 // In case 'ruler' or 'showcmd' or 'columns' or 'ls' changed.
3556 comp_col();
3557
3558 if (varp == &p_mouse) {
3559 setmouse(); // in case 'mouse' changed
3560 } else if ((varp == &p_flp || varp == &(curbuf->b_p_flp)) && curwin->w_briopt_list) {
3561 // Changing Formatlistpattern when briopt includes the list setting:
3562 // redraw
3563 redraw_all_later(UPD_NOT_VALID);
3564 } else if (varp == &p_wbr || varp == &(curwin->w_p_wbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wbr)) {
3565 // add / remove window bars for 'winbar'
3566 set_winbar(true1);
3567 }
3568
3569 if (curwin->w_curswant != MAXCOL
3570 && (opt->flags & (P_CURSWANT0x800000U | P_RALL0xC00U)) != 0 && (opt->flags & P_HLONLY0x2000000U) == 0) {
3571 curwin->w_set_curswant = true1;
3572 }
3573
3574 check_redraw(opt->flags);
3575
3576 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
3577 uint32_t *p = insecure_flag(curwin, opt_idx, opt_flags);
3578 opt->flags |= P_WAS_SET0x20U;
3579
3580 // When an option is set in the sandbox, from a modeline or in secure mode set the P_INSECURE
3581 // flag. Otherwise, if a new value is stored reset the flag.
3582 if (!value_checked && (secure || sandbox != 0 || (opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE))) {
3583 *p |= P_INSECURE0x100000U;
3584 } else if (value_replaced) {
3585 *p &= ~P_INSECURE0x100000U;
3586 }
3587 }
3588
3589 return errmsg;
3590}
3591
3592/// Set the value of an option using an OptVal.
3593///
3594/// @param opt_idx Index in options[] table. Must not be kOptInvalid.
3595/// @param[in] varp Option variable pointer, cannot be NULL.
3596/// @param value New option value. Might get freed.
3597/// @param opt_flags Option flags.
3598/// @param value_replaced Value was replaced completely.
3599/// @param[out] errbuf Buffer for error message.
3600/// @param errbuflen Length of error buffer.
3601///
3602/// @return NULL on success, an untranslated error message on error.
3603static const char *set_option(const OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp, OptVal value, int opt_flags,
3604 const bool_Bool value_replaced, char *errbuf, size_t errbuflen)
3605{
3606 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid && varp != NULL)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid && varp != ((
void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid
&& varp != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid && varp != NULL"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 3606,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3607
3608 const char *errmsg = NULL((void*)0);
3609 bool_Bool value_checked = false0;
3610
3611 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
3612
3613 if (value.type == kOptValTypeNil) {
3614 // Don't try to unset local value if scope is global.
3615 // TODO(famiu): Change this to forbid changing all non-local scopes when the API scope bug is
3616 // fixed.
3617 if (opt_flags == OPT_GLOBAL) {
3618 errmsg = _("Cannot unset global option value")gettext("Cannot unset global option value");
3619 } else {
3620 optval_free(value);
3621 value = optval_unset_local(opt_idx, varp);
3622 }
3623 } else if (!option_has_type(opt_idx, value.type)) {
3624 char *rep = optval_to_cstr(value);
3625 char *valid_types = option_get_valid_types(opt_idx);
3626 snprintf(errbuf, IOSIZE(1024 + 1), _("Invalid value for option '%s': expected %s, got %s %s")gettext("Invalid value for option '%s': expected %s, got %s %s"
),
3627 opt->fullname, valid_types, optval_type_get_name(value.type), rep);
3628 xfree(rep);
3629 xfree(valid_types);
3630 errmsg = errbuf;
3631 }
3632
3633 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
3634 goto err;
3635 }
3636
3637 // When using ":set opt=val" for a global option with a local value the local value will be reset,
3638 // use the global value here.
3639 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0 && ((int)opt->indir & PV_BOTH)) {
3640 varp = opt->var;
3641 }
3642
3643 OptVal old_value = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp);
3644 OptVal old_global_value = NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3645 OptVal old_local_value = NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3646
3647 // Save the local and global values before changing anything. This is needed as for a global-only
3648 // option setting the "local value" in fact sets the global value (since there is only one value).
3649 //
3650 // TODO(famiu): This needs to be changed to use the current type of the old value instead of
3651 // value.type, when multi-type options are added.
3652 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) == 0) {
3653 old_global_value = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_GLOBAL));
3654 old_local_value = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_LOCAL));
3655
3656 // If local value of global-local option is unset, use global value as local value.
3657 if (is_option_local_value_unset(opt, curbuf, curwin)) {
3658 old_local_value = old_global_value;
3659 }
3660 }
3661
3662 // Value that's actually being used.
3663 // For local scope of a global-local option, it is equal to the global value.
3664 // In every other case, it is the same as old_value.
3665 const bool_Bool oldval_is_global = ((int)opt->indir & PV_BOTH) && (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL);
3666 OptVal used_old_value = oldval_is_global ? optval_from_varp(opt_idx, get_varp(opt)) : old_value;
3667
3668 if (value.type == kOptValTypeNumber) {
3669 errmsg = validate_num_option(opt_idx, varp, &value.data.number, errbuf, errbuflen);
3670 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
3671 goto err;
3672 }
3673 }
3674
3675 set_option_varp(opt_idx, varp, value, false0);
3676
3677 OptVal saved_used_value = optval_copy(used_old_value);
3678 OptVal saved_old_global_value = optval_copy(old_global_value);
3679 OptVal saved_old_local_value = optval_copy(old_local_value);
3680 // New value (and varp) may become invalid if the buffer is closed by autocommands.
3681 OptVal saved_new_value = optval_copy(value);
3682
3683 uint32_t *p = insecure_flag(curwin, opt_idx, opt_flags);
3684 const int secure_saved = secure;
3685
3686 // When an option is set in the sandbox, from a modeline or in secure mode, then deal with side
3687 // effects in secure mode. Also when the value was set with the P_INSECURE flag and is not
3688 // completely replaced.
3689 if ((opt_flags & OPT_MODELINE) || sandbox != 0 || (!value_replaced && (*p & P_INSECURE0x100000U))) {
3690 secure = 1;
3691 }
3692
3693 errmsg = did_set_option(opt_idx, varp, old_value, value, opt_flags, &value_checked,
3694 value_replaced, errbuf, errbuflen);
3695
3696 secure = secure_saved;
3697
3698 if (errmsg == NULL((void*)0)) {
3699 if (!starting) {
3700 apply_optionset_autocmd(opt_idx, opt_flags, saved_used_value, saved_old_global_value,
3701 saved_old_local_value, saved_new_value, errmsg);
3702 }
3703 if (opt->flags & P_UI_OPTION0x80U) {
3704 // Calculate saved_new_value again as its value might be changed by bound checks.
3705 // NOTE: Currently there are no buffer/window local UI options, but if there ever are buffer
3706 // or window local UI options added in the future, varp might become invalid if the buffer or
3707 // window is closed during an autocommand, and a check would have to be added for it.
3708 optval_free(saved_new_value);
3709 saved_new_value = optval_copy(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp));
3710 ui_call_option_set(cstr_as_string(opt->fullname), optval_as_object(saved_new_value));
3711 }
3712 }
3713
3714 // Free copied values as they are not needed anymore
3715 optval_free(saved_used_value);
3716 optval_free(saved_old_local_value);
3717 optval_free(saved_old_global_value);
3718 optval_free(saved_new_value);
3719 return errmsg;
3720err:
3721 optval_free(value);
3722 return errmsg;
3723}
3724
3725/// Set the value of an option.
3726///
3727/// @param opt_idx Index in options[] table. Must not be kOptInvalid.
3728/// @param[in] value Option value. If NIL_OPTVAL, the option value is cleared.
3729/// @param[in] opt_flags Flags: OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL, or 0 (both).
3730///
3731/// @return NULL on success, an untranslated error message on error.
3732const char *set_option_value(const OptIndex opt_idx, const OptVal value, int opt_flags)
3733{
3734 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 3734,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
3735
3736 static char errbuf[IOSIZE(1024 + 1)];
3737 uint32_t flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
3738
3739 // Disallow changing some options in the sandbox
3740 if (sandbox > 0 && (flags & P_SECURE0x10000U)) {
3741 return _(e_sandbox)gettext(e_sandbox);
3742 }
3743
3744 void *varp = get_varp_scope(&(options[opt_idx]), opt_flags);
3745 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) {
3746 // hidden option is not changed
3747 return NULL((void*)0);
3748 }
3749
3750 return set_option(opt_idx, varp, optval_copy(value), opt_flags, true1, errbuf, sizeof(errbuf));
3751}
3752
3753/// Set the value of an option. Supports TTY options, unlike set_option_value().
3754///
3755/// @param name Option name. Used for error messages and for setting TTY options.
3756/// @param opt_idx Option indx in options[] table. If kOptInvalid, `name` is used to
3757/// check if the option is a TTY option, and an error is shown if it's not.
3758/// If the option is a TTY option, the function fails silently.
3759/// @param value Option value. If NIL_OPTVAL, the option value is cleared.
3760/// @param[in] opt_flags Flags: OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL, or 0 (both).
3761///
3762/// @return NULL on success, an untranslated error message on error.
3763const char *set_option_value_handle_tty(const char *name, OptIndex opt_idx, const OptVal value,
3764 int opt_flags)
3765 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
3766{
3767 static char errbuf[IOSIZE(1024 + 1)];
3768
3769 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid) {
3770 if (is_tty_option(name)) {
3771 return NULL((void*)0); // Fail silently; many old vimrcs set t_xx options.
3772 }
3773
3774 snprintf(errbuf, sizeof(errbuf), _(e_unknown_option2)gettext(e_unknown_option2), name);
3775 return errbuf;
3776 }
3777
3778 return set_option_value(opt_idx, value, opt_flags);
3779}
3780
3781/// Call set_option_value() and when an error is returned, report it.
3782///
3783/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3784/// @param value Option value. If NIL_OPTVAL, the option value is cleared.
3785/// @param opt_flags OPT_LOCAL or 0 (both)
3786void set_option_value_give_err(const OptIndex opt_idx, OptVal value, int opt_flags)
3787{
3788 const char *errmsg = set_option_value(opt_idx, value, opt_flags);
3789
3790 if (errmsg != NULL((void*)0)) {
3791 emsg(_(errmsg)gettext(errmsg));
3792 }
3793}
3794
3795/// Switch current context to get/set option value for window/buffer.
3796///
3797/// @param[out] ctx Current context. switchwin_T for window and aco_save_T for buffer.
3798/// @param req_scope Requested option scope. See OptReqScope in option.h.
3799/// @param[in] from Target buffer/window.
3800/// @param[out] err Error message, if any.
3801///
3802/// @return true if context was switched, false otherwise.
3803static bool_Bool switch_option_context(void *const ctx, OptReqScope req_scope, void *const from,
3804 Error *err)
3805{
3806 switch (req_scope) {
3807 case kOptReqWin: {
3808 win_T *const win = (win_T *)from;
3809 switchwin_T *const switchwin = (switchwin_T *)ctx;
3810
3811 if (win == curwin) {
3812 return false0;
3813 }
3814
3815 if (switch_win_noblock(switchwin, win, win_find_tabpage(win), true1)
3816 == FAIL0) {
3817 restore_win_noblock(switchwin, true1);
3818
3819 if (try_end(err)) {
3820 return false0;
3821 }
3822 api_set_error(err, kErrorTypeException, "Problem while switching windows");
3823 return false0;
3824 }
3825 return true1;
3826 }
3827 case kOptReqBuf: {
3828 buf_T *const buf = (buf_T *)from;
3829 aco_save_T *const aco = (aco_save_T *)ctx;
3830
3831 if (buf == curbuf) {
3832 return false0;
3833 }
3834 aucmd_prepbuf(aco, buf);
3835 return true1;
3836 }
3837 case kOptReqGlobal:
3838 return false0;
3839 }
3840 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3841}
3842
3843/// Restore context after getting/setting option for window/buffer. See switch_option_context() for
3844/// params.
3845static void restore_option_context(void *const ctx, OptReqScope req_scope)
3846{
3847 switch (req_scope) {
3848 case kOptReqWin:
3849 restore_win_noblock((switchwin_T *)ctx, true1);
3850 break;
3851 case kOptReqBuf:
3852 aucmd_restbuf((aco_save_T *)ctx);
3853 break;
3854 case kOptReqGlobal:
3855 break;
3856 }
3857}
3858
3859/// Get attributes for an option.
3860///
3861/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3862///
3863/// @return Option attributes.
3864/// 0 for hidden or unknown option.
3865/// See SOPT_* in option_defs.h for other flags.
3866int get_option_attrs(OptIndex opt_idx)
3867{
3868 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid) {
3869 return 0;
3870 }
3871
3872 vimoption_T *opt = get_option(opt_idx);
3873
3874 // Hidden option
3875 if (opt->var == NULL((void*)0)) {
3876 return 0;
3877 }
3878
3879 int attrs = 0;
3880
3881 if (opt->indir == PV_NONE || (opt->indir & PV_BOTH)) {
3882 attrs |= SOPT_GLOBAL;
3883 }
3884 if (opt->indir & PV_WIN) {
3885 attrs |= SOPT_WIN;
3886 } else if (opt->indir & PV_BUF) {
3887 attrs |= SOPT_BUF;
3888 }
3889
3890 return attrs;
3891}
3892
3893/// Check if option has a value in the requested scope.
3894///
3895/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3896/// @param req_scope Requested option scope. See OptReqScope in option.h.
3897///
3898/// @return true if option has a value in the requested scope, false otherwise.
3899static bool_Bool option_has_scope(OptIndex opt_idx, OptReqScope req_scope)
3900{
3901 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid) {
3902 return false0;
3903 }
3904
3905 vimoption_T *opt = get_option(opt_idx);
3906
3907 // Hidden option.
3908 if (opt->var == NULL((void*)0)) {
3909 return false0;
3910 }
3911 // TTY option.
3912 if (is_tty_option(opt->fullname)) {
3913 return req_scope == kOptReqGlobal;
3914 }
3915
3916 switch (req_scope) {
3917 case kOptReqGlobal:
3918 return opt->var != VAR_WIN((char *)-1);
3919 case kOptReqBuf:
3920 return opt->indir & PV_BUF;
3921 case kOptReqWin:
3922 return opt->indir & PV_WIN;
3923 }
3924 UNREACHABLE__builtin_unreachable();
3925}
3926
3927/// Get the option value in the requested scope.
3928///
3929/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3930/// @param req_scope Requested option scope. See OptReqScope in option.h.
3931/// @param[in] from Pointer to buffer or window for local option value.
3932/// @param[out] err Error message, if any.
3933///
3934/// @return Option value in the requested scope. Returns a Nil option value if option is not found,
3935/// hidden or if it isn't present in the requested scope. (i.e. has no global, window-local or
3936/// buffer-local value depending on opt_scope).
3937OptVal get_option_value_strict(OptIndex opt_idx, OptReqScope req_scope, void *from, Error *err)
3938{
3939 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid || !option_has_scope(opt_idx, req_scope)) {
3940 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3941 }
3942
3943 vimoption_T *opt = get_option(opt_idx);
3944 switchwin_T switchwin;
3945 aco_save_T aco;
3946 void *ctx = req_scope == kOptReqWin ? (void *)&switchwin
3947 : (req_scope == kOptReqBuf ? (void *)&aco : NULL((void*)0));
3948 bool_Bool switched = switch_option_context(ctx, req_scope, from, err);
3949 if (ERROR_SET(err)((err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
3950 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3951 }
3952
3953 char *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, req_scope == kOptReqGlobal ? OPT_GLOBAL : OPT_LOCAL);
3954 OptVal retv = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp);
3955
3956 if (switched) {
3957 restore_option_context(ctx, req_scope);
3958 }
3959
3960 return retv;
3961}
3962
3963/// Get option value for buffer / window.
3964///
3965/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
3966/// @param[out] flagsp Set to the option flags (P_xxxx) (if not NULL).
3967/// @param[in] scope Option scope (can be OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL or a combination).
3968/// @param[out] hidden Whether option is hidden.
3969/// @param req_scope Requested option scope. See OptReqScope in option.h.
3970/// @param[in] from Target buffer/window.
3971/// @param[out] err Error message, if any.
3972///
3973/// @return Option value. Must be freed by caller.
3974OptVal get_option_value_for(OptIndex opt_idx, int scope, const OptReqScope req_scope,
3975 void *const from, Error *err)
3976{
3977 switchwin_T switchwin;
3978 aco_save_T aco;
3979 void *ctx = req_scope == kOptReqWin ? (void *)&switchwin
3980 : (req_scope == kOptReqBuf ? (void *)&aco : NULL((void*)0));
3981
3982 bool_Bool switched = switch_option_context(ctx, req_scope, from, err);
3983 if (ERROR_SET(err)((err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
3984 return NIL_OPTVAL((OptVal) { .type = kOptValTypeNil });
3985 }
3986
3987 OptVal retv = get_option_value(opt_idx, scope);
3988
3989 if (switched) {
3990 restore_option_context(ctx, req_scope);
3991 }
3992
3993 return retv;
3994}
3995
3996/// Set option value for buffer / window.
3997///
3998/// @param name Option name.
3999/// @param opt_idx Option index in options[] table.
4000/// @param[in] value Option value.
4001/// @param[in] opt_flags Flags: OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL, or 0 (both).
4002/// @param req_scope Requested option scope. See OptReqScope in option.h.
4003/// @param[in] from Target buffer/window.
4004/// @param[out] err Error message, if any.
4005void set_option_value_for(const char *name, OptIndex opt_idx, OptVal value, const int opt_flags,
4006 const OptReqScope req_scope, void *const from, Error *err)
4007 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
4008{
4009 switchwin_T switchwin;
4010 aco_save_T aco;
4011 void *ctx = req_scope == kOptReqWin ? (void *)&switchwin
4012 : (req_scope == kOptReqBuf ? (void *)&aco : NULL((void*)0));
4013
4014 bool_Bool switched = switch_option_context(ctx, req_scope, from, err);
4015 if (ERROR_SET(err)((err)->type != kErrorTypeNone)) {
4016 return;
4017 }
4018
4019 const char *const errmsg = set_option_value_handle_tty(name, opt_idx, value, opt_flags);
4020 if (errmsg) {
4021 api_set_error(err, kErrorTypeException, "%s", errmsg);
4022 }
4023
4024 if (switched) {
4025 restore_option_context(ctx, req_scope);
4026 }
4027}
4028
4029/// if 'all' == false: show changed options
4030/// if 'all' == true: show all normal options
4031///
4032/// @param opt_flags OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL
4033static void showoptions(bool_Bool all, int opt_flags)
4034{
4035#define INC20 20
4036#define GAP3 3
4037
4038 vimoption_T **items = xmalloc(sizeof(vimoption_T *) * OPTION_COUNT((sizeof(options)/sizeof((options)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
options) % sizeof((options)[0]))))));
4039
4040 // Highlight title
4041 if (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) {
4042 msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Global option values ---")gettext("\n--- Global option values ---"));
4043 } else if (opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL) {
4044 msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Local option values ---")gettext("\n--- Local option values ---"));
4045 } else {
4046 msg_puts_title(_("\n--- Options ---")gettext("\n--- Options ---"));
4047 }
4048
4049 // Do the loop two times:
4050 // 1. display the short items
4051 // 2. display the long items (only strings and numbers)
4052 // When "opt_flags" has OPT_ONECOLUMN do everything in run 2.
4053 for (int run = 1; run <= 2 && !got_int; run++) {
4054 // collect the items in items[]
4055 int item_count = 0;
4056 vimoption_T *opt;
4057 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
4058 opt = &options[opt_idx];
4059 // apply :filter /pat/
4060 if (message_filtered(opt->fullname)) {
4061 continue;
4062 }
4063
4064 void *varp = NULL((void*)0);
4065 if ((opt_flags & (OPT_LOCAL | OPT_GLOBAL)) != 0) {
4066 if (opt->indir != PV_NONE) {
4067 varp = get_varp_scope(opt, opt_flags);
4068 }
4069 } else {
4070 varp = get_varp(opt);
4071 }
4072 if (varp != NULL((void*)0) && (all || !optval_default(opt_idx, varp))) {
4073 int len;
4074 if (opt_flags & OPT_ONECOLUMN) {
4075 len = Columns;
4076 } else if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean)) {
4077 len = 1; // a toggle option fits always
4078 } else {
4079 option_value2string(opt, opt_flags);
4080 len = (int)strlen(opt->fullname) + vim_strsize(NameBuff) + 1;
4081 }
4082 if ((len <= INC20 - GAP3 && run == 1)
4083 || (len > INC20 - GAP3 && run == 2)) {
4084 items[item_count++] = opt;
4085 }
4086 }
4087 }
4088
4089 int rows;
4090
4091 // display the items
4092 if (run == 1) {
4093 assert(Columns <= INT_MAX - GAP((void) sizeof ((Columns <= 2147483647 - 3 && Columns
+ 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 && (Columns + 3 - 3) /
20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 <=
2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (Columns <= 2147483647
- 3 && Columns + 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 &&
(Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns
+ 3 - 3) / 20 <= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("Columns <= INT_MAX - GAP && Columns + GAP >= INT_MIN + 3 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC >= INT_MIN && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 4096,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }))
4094 && Columns + GAP >= INT_MIN + 3((void) sizeof ((Columns <= 2147483647 - 3 && Columns
+ 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 && (Columns + 3 - 3) /
20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 <=
2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (Columns <= 2147483647
- 3 && Columns + 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 &&
(Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns
+ 3 - 3) / 20 <= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("Columns <= INT_MAX - GAP && Columns + GAP >= INT_MIN + 3 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC >= INT_MIN && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 4096,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }))
4095 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC >= INT_MIN((void) sizeof ((Columns <= 2147483647 - 3 && Columns
+ 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 && (Columns + 3 - 3) /
20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 <=
2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (Columns <= 2147483647
- 3 && Columns + 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 &&
(Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns
+ 3 - 3) / 20 <= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("Columns <= INT_MAX - GAP && Columns + GAP >= INT_MIN + 3 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC >= INT_MIN && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 4096,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }))
4096 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC <= INT_MAX)((void) sizeof ((Columns <= 2147483647 - 3 && Columns
+ 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 && (Columns + 3 - 3) /
20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 <=
2147483647) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (Columns <= 2147483647
- 3 && Columns + 3 >= (-2147483647 -1) + 3 &&
(Columns + 3 - 3) / 20 >= (-2147483647 -1) && (Columns
+ 3 - 3) / 20 <= 2147483647) ; else __assert_fail ("Columns <= INT_MAX - GAP && Columns + GAP >= INT_MIN + 3 && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC >= INT_MIN && (Columns + GAP - 3) / INC <= INT_MAX"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 4096,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
4097 int cols = (Columns + GAP3 - 3) / INC20;
4098 if (cols == 0) {
4099 cols = 1;
4100 }
4101 rows = (item_count + cols - 1) / cols;
4102 } else { // run == 2
4103 rows = item_count;
4104 }
4105 for (int row = 0; row < rows && !got_int; row++) {
4106 msg_putchar('\n'); // go to next line
4107 if (got_int) { // 'q' typed in more
4108 break;
4109 }
4110 int col = 0;
4111 for (int i = row; i < item_count; i += rows) {
4112 msg_col = col; // make columns
4113 showoneopt(items[i], opt_flags);
4114 col += INC20;
4115 }
4116 os_breakcheck();
4117 }
4118 }
4119 xfree(items);
4120}
4121
4122/// Return true if option "p" has its default value.
4123static int optval_default(OptIndex opt_idx, void *varp)
4124{
4125 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
4126
4127 // Hidden or immutable options always use their default value.
4128 if (varp == NULL((void*)0) || opt->immutable) {
4129 return true1;
4130 }
4131
4132 OptVal current_val = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp);
4133 OptVal default_val = optval_from_varp(opt_idx, &opt->def_val);
4134
4135 return optval_equal(current_val, default_val);
4136}
4137
4138/// Send update to UIs with values of UI relevant options
4139void ui_refresh_options(void)
4140{
4141 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
4142 uint32_t flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
4143 if (!(flags & P_UI_OPTION0x80U)) {
4144 continue;
4145 }
4146 String name = cstr_as_string(options[opt_idx].fullname);
4147 Object value = optval_as_object(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, options[opt_idx].var));
4148 ui_call_option_set(name, value);
4149 }
4150 if (p_mouse != NULL((void*)0)) {
4151 setmouse();
4152 }
4153}
4154
4155/// showoneopt: show the value of one option
4156/// must not be called with a hidden option!
4157///
4158/// @param opt_flags OPT_LOCAL or OPT_GLOBAL
4159static void showoneopt(vimoption_T *opt, int opt_flags)
4160{
4161 int save_silent = silent_mode;
4162
4163 silent_mode = false0;
4164 info_message = true1; // use stdout, not stderr
4165
4166 OptIndex opt_idx = get_opt_idx(opt);
4167 void *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, opt_flags);
4168
4169 // for 'modified' we also need to check if 'ff' or 'fenc' changed.
4170 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean)
4171 && ((int *)varp == &curbuf->b_changed ? !curbufIsChanged() : !*(int *)varp)) {
4172 msg_puts("no");
4173 } else if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean) && *(int *)varp < 0) {
4174 msg_puts("--");
4175 } else {
4176 msg_puts(" ");
4177 }
4178 msg_puts(opt->fullname);
4179 if (!(option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean))) {
4180 msg_putchar('=');
4181 // put value string in NameBuff
4182 option_value2string(opt, opt_flags);
4183 msg_outtrans(NameBuff, 0);
4184 }
4185
4186 silent_mode = save_silent;
4187 info_message = false0;
4188}
4189
4190/// Write modified options as ":set" commands to a file.
4191///
4192/// There are three values for "opt_flags":
4193/// OPT_GLOBAL: Write global option values and fresh values of
4194/// buffer-local options (used for start of a session
4195/// file).
4196/// OPT_GLOBAL + OPT_LOCAL: Idem, add fresh values of window-local options for
4197/// curwin (used for a vimrc file).
4198/// OPT_LOCAL: Write buffer-local option values for curbuf, fresh
4199/// and local values for window-local options of
4200/// curwin. Local values are also written when at the
4201/// default value, because a modeline or autocommand
4202/// may have set them when doing ":edit file" and the
4203/// user has set them back at the default or fresh
4204/// value.
4205/// When "local_only" is true, don't write fresh
4206/// values, only local values (for ":mkview").
4207/// (fresh value = value used for a new buffer or window for a local option).
4208///
4209/// Return FAIL on error, OK otherwise.
4210int makeset(FILE *fd, int opt_flags, int local_only)
4211{
4212 // Some options are never written:
4213 // - Options that don't have a default (terminal name, columns, lines).
4214 // - Terminal options.
4215 // - Hidden options.
4216 //
4217 // Do the loop over "options[]" twice: once for options with the
4218 // P_PRI_MKRC flag and once without.
4219 for (int pri = 1; pri >= 0; pri--) {
4220 vimoption_T *opt;
4221 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
4222 opt = &options[opt_idx];
4223
4224 if (!(opt->flags & P_NO_MKRC0x40U)
4225 && ((pri == 1) == ((opt->flags & P_PRI_MKRC0x200000U) != 0))) {
4226 // skip global option when only doing locals
4227 if (opt->indir == PV_NONE && !(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL)) {
4228 continue;
4229 }
4230
4231 // Do not store options like 'bufhidden' and 'syntax' in a vimrc
4232 // file, they are always buffer-specific.
4233 if ((opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) && (opt->flags & P_NOGLOB0x40000U)) {
4234 continue;
4235 }
4236
4237 void *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, opt_flags); // currently used value
4238 // Hidden options are never written.
4239 if (!varp) {
4240 continue;
4241 }
4242 // Global values are only written when not at the default value.
4243 if ((opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) && optval_default(opt_idx, varp)) {
4244 continue;
4245 }
4246
4247 if ((opt_flags & OPT_SKIPRTP)
4248 && (opt->var == &p_rtp || opt->var == &p_pp)) {
4249 continue;
4250 }
4251
4252 int round = 2;
4253 void *varp_local = NULL((void*)0); // fresh value
4254 if (opt->indir != PV_NONE) {
4255 if (opt->var == VAR_WIN((char *)-1)) {
4256 // skip window-local option when only doing globals
4257 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_LOCAL)) {
4258 continue;
4259 }
4260 // When fresh value of window-local option is not at the
4261 // default, need to write it too.
4262 if (!(opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL) && !local_only) {
4263 void *varp_fresh = get_varp_scope(opt, OPT_GLOBAL); // local value
4264 if (!optval_default(opt_idx, varp_fresh)) {
4265 round = 1;
4266 varp_local = varp;
4267 varp = varp_fresh;
4268 }
4269 }
4270 }
4271 }
4272
4273 // Round 1: fresh value for window-local options.
4274 // Round 2: other values
4275 for (; round <= 2; varp = varp_local, round++) {
4276 char *cmd;
4277 if (round == 1 || (opt_flags & OPT_GLOBAL)) {
4278 cmd = "set";
4279 } else {
4280 cmd = "setlocal";
4281 }
4282
4283 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean)) {
4284 if (put_setbool(fd, cmd, opt->fullname, *(int *)varp) == FAIL0) {
4285 return FAIL0;
4286 }
4287 } else if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeNumber)) {
4288 if (put_setnum(fd, cmd, opt->fullname, (OptInt *)varp) == FAIL0) {
4289 return FAIL0;
4290 }
4291 } else { // string
4292 bool_Bool do_endif = false0;
4293
4294 // Don't set 'syntax' and 'filetype' again if the value is
4295 // already right, avoids reloading the syntax file.
4296 if (opt->indir == PV_SYN(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SYN)) || opt->indir == PV_FT(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FT))) {
4297 if (fprintf(fd, "if &%s != '%s'", opt->fullname,
4298 *(char **)(varp)) < 0
4299 || put_eol(fd) < 0) {
4300 return FAIL0;
4301 }
4302 do_endif = true1;
4303 }
4304 if (put_setstring(fd, cmd, opt->fullname, (char **)varp, opt->flags) == FAIL0) {
4305 return FAIL0;
4306 }
4307 if (do_endif) {
4308 if (put_line(fd, "endif") == FAIL0) {
4309 return FAIL0;
4310 }
4311 }
4312 }
4313 }
4314 }
4315 }
4316 }
4317 return OK1;
4318}
4319
4320/// Generate set commands for the local fold options only. Used when
4321/// 'sessionoptions' or 'viewoptions' contains "folds" but not "options".
4322int makefoldset(FILE *fd)
4323{
4324 if (put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fdm", &curwin->w_p_fdmw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdm, 0) == FAIL0
4325 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fde", &curwin->w_p_fdew_onebuf_opt.wo_fde, 0) == FAIL0
4326 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fmr", &curwin->w_p_fmrw_onebuf_opt.wo_fmr, 0) == FAIL0
4327 || put_setstring(fd, "setlocal", "fdi", &curwin->w_p_fdiw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdi, 0) == FAIL0
4328 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fdl", &curwin->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl) == FAIL0
4329 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fml", &curwin->w_p_fmlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fml) == FAIL0
4330 || put_setnum(fd, "setlocal", "fdn", &curwin->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn) == FAIL0
4331 || put_setbool(fd, "setlocal", "fen", curwin->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen) == FAIL0) {
4332 return FAIL0;
4333 }
4334
4335 return OK1;
4336}
4337
4338static int put_setstring(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, char **valuep, uint64_t flags)
4339{
4340 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s=", cmd, name) < 0) {
4341 return FAIL0;
4342 }
4343
4344 char *buf = NULL((void*)0);
4345 char *part = NULL((void*)0);
4346
4347 if (*valuep != NULL((void*)0)) {
4348 if ((flags & P_EXPAND0x02U) != 0) {
4349 size_t size = (size_t)strlen(*valuep) + 1;
4350
4351 // replace home directory in the whole option value into "buf"
4352 buf = xmalloc(size);
4353 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), *valuep, buf, size, false0);
4354
4355 // If the option value is longer than MAXPATHL, we need to append
4356 // each comma separated part of the option separately, so that it
4357 // can be expanded when read back.
4358 if (size >= MAXPATHL4096 && (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) != 0
4359 && vim_strchr(*valuep, ',') != NULL((void*)0)) {
4360 part = xmalloc(size);
4361
4362 // write line break to clear the option, e.g. ':set rtp='
4363 if (put_eol(fd) == FAIL0) {
4364 goto fail;
4365 }
4366 char *p = buf;
4367 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
4368 // for each comma separated option part, append value to
4369 // the option, :set rtp+=value
4370 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s+=", cmd, name) < 0) {
4371 goto fail;
4372 }
4373 copy_option_part(&p, part, size, ",");
4374 if (put_escstr(fd, part, 2) == FAIL0 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL0) {
4375 goto fail;
4376 }
4377 }
4378 xfree(buf);
4379 xfree(part);
4380 return OK1;
4381 }
4382 if (put_escstr(fd, buf, 2) == FAIL0) {
4383 xfree(buf);
4384 return FAIL0;
4385 }
4386 xfree(buf);
4387 } else if (put_escstr(fd, *valuep, 2) == FAIL0) {
4388 return FAIL0;
4389 }
4390 }
4391 if (put_eol(fd) < 0) {
4392 return FAIL0;
4393 }
4394 return OK1;
4395fail:
4396 xfree(buf);
4397 xfree(part);
4398 return FAIL0;
4399}
4400
4401static int put_setnum(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, OptInt *valuep)
4402{
4403 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s=", cmd, name) < 0) {
4404 return FAIL0;
4405 }
4406 OptInt wc;
4407 if (wc_use_keyname(valuep, &wc)) {
4408 // print 'wildchar' and 'wildcharm' as a key name
4409 if (fputs(get_special_key_name((int)wc, 0), fd) < 0) {
4410 return FAIL0;
4411 }
4412 } else if (fprintf(fd, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)(*valuep)) < 0) {
4413 return FAIL0;
4414 }
4415 if (put_eol(fd) < 0) {
4416 return FAIL0;
4417 }
4418 return OK1;
4419}
4420
4421static int put_setbool(FILE *fd, char *cmd, char *name, int value)
4422{
4423 if (value < 0) { // global/local option using global value
4424 return OK1;
4425 }
4426 if (fprintf(fd, "%s %s%s", cmd, value ? "" : "no", name) < 0
4427 || put_eol(fd) < 0) {
4428 return FAIL0;
4429 }
4430 return OK1;
4431}
4432
4433void *get_varp_scope_from(vimoption_T *p, int scope, buf_T *buf, win_T *win)
4434{
4435 if ((scope & OPT_GLOBAL) && p->indir != PV_NONE) {
4436 if (p->var == VAR_WIN((char *)-1)) {
4437 return GLOBAL_WO(get_varp_from(p, buf, win))((char *)(get_varp_from(p, buf, win)) + sizeof(winopt_T));
4438 }
4439 return p->var;
4440 }
4441 if ((scope & OPT_LOCAL) && ((int)p->indir & PV_BOTH)) {
4442 switch ((int)p->indir) {
4443 case PV_FP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FP)))):
4444 return &(buf->b_p_fp);
4445 case PV_EFM(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EFM)))):
4446 return &(buf->b_p_efm);
4447 case PV_GP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_GP)))):
4448 return &(buf->b_p_gp);
4449 case PV_MP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MP)))):
4450 return &(buf->b_p_mp);
4451 case PV_EP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EP)))):
4452 return &(buf->b_p_ep);
4453 case PV_KP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_KP)))):
4454 return &(buf->b_p_kp);
4455 case PV_PATH(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_PATH)))
):
4456 return &(buf->b_p_path);
4457 case PV_AR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_AR)))):
4458 return &(buf->b_p_ar);
4459 case PV_TAGS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TAGS)))
):
4460 return &(buf->b_p_tags);
4461 case PV_TC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TC)))):
4462 return &(buf->b_p_tc);
4463 case PV_SISO(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SISO)))
):
4464 return &(win->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso);
4465 case PV_SO(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SO)))):
4466 return &(win->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so);
4467 case PV_DEF(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_DEF)))):
4468 return &(buf->b_p_def);
4469 case PV_INC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INC)))):
4470 return &(buf->b_p_inc);
4471 case PV_DICT(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_DICT)))
):
4472 return &(buf->b_p_dict);
4473 case PV_TSR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TSR)))):
4474 return &(buf->b_p_tsr);
4475 case PV_TSRFU(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TSRFU))
)):
4476 return &(buf->b_p_tsrfu);
4477 case PV_TFU(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TFU)):
4478 return &(buf->b_p_tfu);
4479 case PV_SBR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SBR)))):
4480 return &(win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr);
4481 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_STL)))):
4482 return &(win->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl);
4483 case PV_WBR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WBR)))):
4484 return &(win->w_p_wbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wbr);
4485 case PV_UL(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_UL)))):
4486 return &(buf->b_p_ul);
4487 case PV_LW(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_LW)))):
4488 return &(buf->b_p_lw);
4489 case PV_BKC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BKC)))):
4490 return &(buf->b_p_bkc);
4491 case PV_MENC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MENC)))
):
4492 return &(buf->b_p_menc);
4493 case PV_FCS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FCS)))):
4494 return &(win->w_p_fcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_fcs);
4495 case PV_LCS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_LCS)))):
4496 return &(win->w_p_lcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_lcs);
4497 case PV_VE(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_VE)))):
4498 return &(win->w_p_vew_onebuf_opt.wo_ve);
4499 }
4500 return NULL((void*)0); // "cannot happen"
4501 }
4502 return get_varp_from(p, buf, win);
4503}
4504
4505/// Get pointer to option variable, depending on local or global scope.
4506///
4507/// @param scope can be OPT_LOCAL, OPT_GLOBAL or a combination.
4508void *get_varp_scope(vimoption_T *p, int scope)
4509{
4510 return get_varp_scope_from(p, scope, curbuf, curwin);
4511}
4512
4513/// Get pointer to option variable at 'opt_idx', depending on local or global
4514/// scope.
4515void *get_option_varp_scope_from(OptIndex opt_idx, int scope, buf_T *buf, win_T *win)
4516{
4517 return get_varp_scope_from(&(options[opt_idx]), scope, buf, win);
4518}
4519
4520void *get_varp_from(vimoption_T *p, buf_T *buf, win_T *win)
4521{
4522 // hidden option, always return NULL
4523 if (p->var == NULL((void*)0)) {
4524 return NULL((void*)0);
4525 }
4526
4527 switch ((int)p->indir) {
4528 case PV_NONE:
4529 return p->var;
4530
4531 // global option with local value: use local value if it's been set
4532 case PV_EP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EP)))):
4533 return *buf->b_p_ep != NUL'\000' ? &buf->b_p_ep : p->var;
4534 case PV_KP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_KP)))):
4535 return *buf->b_p_kp != NUL'\000' ? &buf->b_p_kp : p->var;
4536 case PV_PATH(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_PATH)))
):
4537 return *buf->b_p_path != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_path) : p->var;
4538 case PV_AR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_AR)))):
4539 return buf->b_p_ar >= 0 ? &(buf->b_p_ar) : p->var;
4540 case PV_TAGS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TAGS)))
):
4541 return *buf->b_p_tags != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_tags) : p->var;
4542 case PV_TC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TC)))):
4543 return *buf->b_p_tc != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_tc) : p->var;
4544 case PV_SISO(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SISO)))
):
4545 return win->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso >= 0 ? &(win->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso) : p->var;
4546 case PV_SO(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SO)))):
4547 return win->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so >= 0 ? &(win->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so) : p->var;
4548 case PV_BKC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BKC)))):
4549 return *buf->b_p_bkc != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_bkc) : p->var;
4550 case PV_DEF(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_DEF)))):
4551 return *buf->b_p_def != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_def) : p->var;
4552 case PV_INC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INC)))):
4553 return *buf->b_p_inc != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_inc) : p->var;
4554 case PV_DICT(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_DICT)))
):
4555 return *buf->b_p_dict != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_dict) : p->var;
4556 case PV_TSR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TSR)))):
4557 return *buf->b_p_tsr != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_tsr) : p->var;
4558 case PV_TSRFU(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TSRFU))
)):
4559 return *buf->b_p_tsrfu != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_tsrfu) : p->var;
4560 case PV_FP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FP)))):
4561 return *buf->b_p_fp != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_fp) : p->var;
4562 case PV_EFM(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EFM)))):
4563 return *buf->b_p_efm != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_efm) : p->var;
4564 case PV_GP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_GP)))):
4565 return *buf->b_p_gp != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_gp) : p->var;
4566 case PV_MP(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MP)))):
4567 return *buf->b_p_mp != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_mp) : p->var;
4568 case PV_SBR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SBR)))):
