4569 return *win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr != NUL'\000' ? &(win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr) : p->var;
4570 case PV_STL(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_STL)))):
4571 return *win->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl != NUL'\000' ? &(win->w_p_stlw_onebuf_opt.wo_stl) : p->var;
4572 case PV_WBR(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WBR)))):
4573 return *win->w_p_wbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wbr != NUL'\000' ? &(win->w_p_wbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wbr) : p->var;
4574 case PV_UL(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_UL)))):
4575 return buf->b_p_ul != NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL(-123456) ? &(buf->b_p_ul) : p->var;
4576 case PV_LW(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_LW)))):
4577 return *buf->b_p_lw != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_lw) : p->var;
4578 case PV_MENC(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MENC)))
):
4579 return *buf->b_p_menc != NUL'\000' ? &(buf->b_p_menc) : p->var;
4580 case PV_FCS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FCS)))):
4581 return *win->w_p_fcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_fcs != NUL'\000' ? &(win->w_p_fcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_fcs) : p->var;
4582 case PV_LCS(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_LCS)))):
4583 return *win->w_p_lcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_lcs != NUL'\000' ? &(win->w_p_lcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_lcs) : p->var;
4584 case PV_VE(idopt_T)(PV_BOTH + (int)((idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_VE)))):
4585 return *win->w_p_vew_onebuf_opt.wo_ve != NUL'\000' ? &win->w_p_vew_onebuf_opt.wo_ve : p->var;
4586
4587 case PV_ARAB(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_ARAB)):
4588 return &(win->w_p_arabw_onebuf_opt.wo_arab);
4589 case PV_LIST(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_LIST)):
4590 return &(win->w_p_listw_onebuf_opt.wo_list);
4591 case PV_SPELL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SPELL)):
4592 return &(win->w_p_spellw_onebuf_opt.wo_spell);
4593 case PV_CUC(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_CUC)):
4594 return &(win->w_p_cucw_onebuf_opt.wo_cuc);
4595 case PV_CUL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_CUL)):
4596 return &(win->w_p_culw_onebuf_opt.wo_cul);
4597 case PV_CULOPT(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_CULOPT)):
4598 return &(win->w_p_culoptw_onebuf_opt.wo_culopt);
4599 case PV_CC(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_CC)):
4600 return &(win->w_p_ccw_onebuf_opt.wo_cc);
4601 case PV_DIFF(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_DIFF)):
4602 return &(win->w_p_diffw_onebuf_opt.wo_diff);
4603 case PV_FDC(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDC)):
4604 return &(win->w_p_fdcw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdc);
4605 case PV_FEN(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FEN)):
4606 return &(win->w_p_fenw_onebuf_opt.wo_fen);
4607 case PV_FDI(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDI)):
4608 return &(win->w_p_fdiw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdi);
4609 case PV_FDL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDL)):
4610 return &(win->w_p_fdlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdl);
4611 case PV_FDM(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDM)):
4612 return &(win->w_p_fdmw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdm);
4613 case PV_FML(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FML)):
4614 return &(win->w_p_fmlw_onebuf_opt.wo_fml);
4615 case PV_FDN(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDN)):
4616 return &(win->w_p_fdnw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdn);
4617 case PV_FDE(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDE)):
4618 return &(win->w_p_fdew_onebuf_opt.wo_fde);
4619 case PV_FDT(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FDT)):
4620 return &(win->w_p_fdtw_onebuf_opt.wo_fdt);
4621 case PV_FMR(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_FMR)):
4622 return &(win->w_p_fmrw_onebuf_opt.wo_fmr);
4623 case PV_NU(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_NU)):
4624 return &(win->w_p_nuw_onebuf_opt.wo_nu);
4625 case PV_RNU(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_RNU)):
4626 return &(win->w_p_rnuw_onebuf_opt.wo_rnu);
4627 case PV_NUW(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_NUW)):
4628 return &(win->w_p_nuww_onebuf_opt.wo_nuw);
4629 case PV_WFB(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WFB)):
4630 return &(win->w_p_wfbw_onebuf_opt.wo_wfb);
4631 case PV_WFH(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WFH)):
4632 return &(win->w_p_wfhw_onebuf_opt.wo_wfh);
4633 case PV_WFW(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WFW)):
4634 return &(win->w_p_wfww_onebuf_opt.wo_wfw);
4635 case PV_PVW(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_PVW)):
4636 return &(win->w_p_pvww_onebuf_opt.wo_pvw);
4637 case PV_RL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_RL)):
4638 return &(win->w_p_rlw_onebuf_opt.wo_rl);
4639 case PV_RLC(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_RLC)):
4640 return &(win->w_p_rlcw_onebuf_opt.wo_rlc);
4641 case PV_SCROLL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SCROLL)):
4642 return &(win->w_p_scrw_onebuf_opt.wo_scr);
4643 case PV_SMS(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SMS)):
4644 return &(win->w_p_smsw_onebuf_opt.wo_sms);
4645 case PV_WRAP(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WRAP)):
4646 return &(win->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap);
4647 case PV_LBR(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_LBR)):
4648 return &(win->w_p_lbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_lbr);
4649 case PV_BRI(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_BRI)):
4650 return &(win->w_p_briw_onebuf_opt.wo_bri);
4651 case PV_BRIOPT(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_BRIOPT)):
4652 return &(win->w_p_brioptw_onebuf_opt.wo_briopt);
4653 case PV_SCBIND(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SCBIND)):
4654 return &(win->w_p_scbw_onebuf_opt.wo_scb);
4655 case PV_CRBIND(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_CRBIND)):
4656 return &(win->w_p_crbw_onebuf_opt.wo_crb);
4657 case PV_COCU(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_COCU)):
4658 return &(win->w_p_cocuw_onebuf_opt.wo_cocu);
4659 case PV_COLE(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_COLE)):
4660 return &(win->w_p_colew_onebuf_opt.wo_cole);
4661
4662 case PV_AI(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_AI)):
4663 return &(buf->b_p_ai);
4664 case PV_BIN(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BIN)):
4665 return &(buf->b_p_bin);
4666 case PV_BOMB(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BOMB)):
4667 return &(buf->b_p_bomb);
4668 case PV_BH(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BH)):
4669 return &(buf->b_p_bh);
4670 case PV_BT(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BT)):
4671 return &(buf->b_p_bt);
4672 case PV_BL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_BL)):
4673 return &(buf->b_p_bl);
4674 case PV_CHANNEL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CHANNEL)):
4675 return &(buf->b_p_channel);
4676 case PV_CI(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CI)):
4677 return &(buf->b_p_ci);
4678 case PV_CIN(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CIN)):
4679 return &(buf->b_p_cin);
4680 case PV_CINK(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CINK)):
4681 return &(buf->b_p_cink);
4682 case PV_CINO(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CINO)):
4683 return &(buf->b_p_cino);
4684 case PV_CINSD(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CINSD)):
4685 return &(buf->b_p_cinsd);
4686 case PV_CINW(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CINW)):
4687 return &(buf->b_p_cinw);
4688 case PV_COM(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_COM)):
4689 return &(buf->b_p_com);
4690 case PV_CMS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CMS)):
4691 return &(buf->b_p_cms);
4692 case PV_CPT(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CPT)):
4693 return &(buf->b_p_cpt);
4694#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
4695 case PV_CSL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CSL)):
4696 return &(buf->b_p_csl);
4697#endif
4698 case PV_CFU(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_CFU)):
4699 return &(buf->b_p_cfu);
4700 case PV_OFU(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_OFU)):
4701 return &(buf->b_p_ofu);
4702 case PV_EOF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EOF)):
4703 return &(buf->b_p_eof);
4704 case PV_EOL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_EOL)):
4705 return &(buf->b_p_eol);
4706 case PV_FIXEOL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FIXEOL)):
4707 return &(buf->b_p_fixeol);
4708 case PV_ET(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_ET)):
4709 return &(buf->b_p_et);
4710 case PV_FENC(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FENC)):
4711 return &(buf->b_p_fenc);
4712 case PV_FF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FF)):
4713 return &(buf->b_p_ff);
4714 case PV_FT(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FT)):
4715 return &(buf->b_p_ft);
4716 case PV_FO(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FO)):
4717 return &(buf->b_p_fo);
4718 case PV_FLP(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FLP)):
4719 return &(buf->b_p_flp);
4720 case PV_IMI(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_IMI)):
4721 return &(buf->b_p_iminsert);
4722 case PV_IMS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_IMS)):
4723 return &(buf->b_p_imsearch);
4724 case PV_INF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INF)):
4725 return &(buf->b_p_inf);
4726 case PV_ISK(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_ISK)):
4727 return &(buf->b_p_isk);
4728 case PV_INEX(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INEX)):
4729 return &(buf->b_p_inex);
4730 case PV_INDE(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INDE)):
4731 return &(buf->b_p_inde);
4732 case PV_INDK(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_INDK)):
4733 return &(buf->b_p_indk);
4734 case PV_FEX(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_FEX)):
4735 return &(buf->b_p_fex);
4736 case PV_LISP(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_LISP)):
4737 return &(buf->b_p_lisp);
4738 case PV_LOP(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_LOP)):
4739 return &(buf->b_p_lop);
4740 case PV_ML(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_ML)):
4741 return &(buf->b_p_ml);
4742 case PV_MPS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MPS)):
4743 return &(buf->b_p_mps);
4744 case PV_MA(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MA)):
4745 return &(buf->b_p_ma);
4746 case PV_MOD(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_MOD)):
4747 return &(buf->b_changed);
4748 case PV_NF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_NF)):
4749 return &(buf->b_p_nf);
4750 case PV_PI(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_PI)):
4751 return &(buf->b_p_pi);
4752 case PV_QE(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_QE)):
4753 return &(buf->b_p_qe);
4754 case PV_RO(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_RO)):
4755 return &(buf->b_p_ro);
4756 case PV_SCBK(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SCBK)):
4757 return &(buf->b_p_scbk);
4758 case PV_SI(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SI)):
4759 return &(buf->b_p_si);
4760 case PV_STS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_STS)):
4761 return &(buf->b_p_sts);
4762 case PV_SUA(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SUA)):
4763 return &(buf->b_p_sua);
4764 case PV_SWF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SWF)):
4765 return &(buf->b_p_swf);
4766 case PV_SMC(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SMC)):
4767 return &(buf->b_p_smc);
4768 case PV_SYN(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SYN)):
4769 return &(buf->b_p_syn);
4770 case PV_SPC(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SPC)):
4771 return &(win->w_s->b_p_spc);
4772 case PV_SPF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SPF)):
4773 return &(win->w_s->b_p_spf);
4774 case PV_SPL(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SPL)):
4775 return &(win->w_s->b_p_spl);
4776 case PV_SPO(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SPO)):
4777 return &(win->w_s->b_p_spo);
4778 case PV_SW(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_SW)):
4779 return &(buf->b_p_sw);
4780 case PV_TFU(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TFU)):
4781 return &(buf->b_p_tfu);
4782 case PV_TS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TS)):
4783 return &(buf->b_p_ts);
4784 case PV_TW(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_TW)):
4785 return &(buf->b_p_tw);
4786 case PV_UDF(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_UDF)):
4787 return &(buf->b_p_udf);
4788 case PV_WM(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_WM)):
4789 return &(buf->b_p_wm);
4790 case PV_VSTS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_VSTS)):
4791 return &(buf->b_p_vsts);
4792 case PV_VTS(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_VTS)):
4793 return &(buf->b_p_vts);
4794 case PV_KMAP(idopt_T)(PV_BUF + (int)(BV_KMAP)):
4795 return &(buf->b_p_keymap);
4796 case PV_SCL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_SCL)):
4797 return &(win->w_p_sclw_onebuf_opt.wo_scl);
4798 case PV_WINHL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WINHL)):
4799 return &(win->w_p_winhlw_onebuf_opt.wo_winhl);
4800 case PV_WINBL(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_WINBL)):
4801 return &(win->w_p_winblw_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl);
4802 case PV_STC(idopt_T)(PV_WIN + (int)(WV_STC)):
4803 return &(win->w_p_stcw_onebuf_opt.wo_stc);
4804 default:
4805 iemsg(_("E356: get_varp ERROR")gettext("E356: get_varp ERROR"));
4806 }
4807 // always return a valid pointer to avoid a crash!
4808 return &(buf->b_p_wm);
4809}
4810
4811/// Get option index from option pointer
4812static inline OptIndex get_opt_idx(vimoption_T *opt)
4813 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_PURE
4814{
4815 return (OptIndex)(opt - options);
4816}
4817
4818/// Get pointer to option variable.
4819static inline void *get_varp(vimoption_T *p)
4820{
4821 return get_varp_from(p, curbuf, curwin);
4822}
4823
4824/// Get the value of 'equalprg', either the buffer-local one or the global one.
4825char *get_equalprg(void)
4826{
4827 if (*curbuf->b_p_ep == NUL'\000') {
4828 return p_ep;
4829 }
4830 return curbuf->b_p_ep;
4831}
4832
4833/// Copy options from one window to another.
4834/// Used when splitting a window.
4835void win_copy_options(win_T *wp_from, win_T *wp_to)
4836{
4837 copy_winopt(&wp_from->w_onebuf_opt, &wp_to->w_onebuf_opt);
4838 copy_winopt(&wp_from->w_allbuf_opt, &wp_to->w_allbuf_opt);
4839 didset_window_options(wp_to, true1);
4840}
4841
4842static char *copy_option_val(const char *val)
4843{
4844 if (val == empty_string_option) {
4845 return empty_string_option; // no need to allocate memory
4846 }
4847 return xstrdup(val);
4848}
4849
4850/// Copy the options from one winopt_T to another.
4851/// Doesn't free the old option values in "to", use clear_winopt() for that.
4852/// The 'scroll' option is not copied, because it depends on the window height.
4853/// The 'previewwindow' option is reset, there can be only one preview window.
4854void copy_winopt(winopt_T *from, winopt_T *to)
4855{
4856 to->wo_arab = from->wo_arab;
4857 to->wo_list = from->wo_list;
4858 to->wo_lcs = copy_option_val(from->wo_lcs);
4859 to->wo_fcs = copy_option_val(from->wo_fcs);
4860 to->wo_nu = from->wo_nu;
4861 to->wo_rnu = from->wo_rnu;
4862 to->wo_ve = copy_option_val(from->wo_ve);
4863 to->wo_ve_flags = from->wo_ve_flags;
4864 to->wo_nuw = from->wo_nuw;
4865 to->wo_rl = from->wo_rl;
4866 to->wo_rlc = copy_option_val(from->wo_rlc);
4867 to->wo_sbr = copy_option_val(from->wo_sbr);
4868 to->wo_stl = copy_option_val(from->wo_stl);
4869 to->wo_wbr = copy_option_val(from->wo_wbr);
4870 to->wo_wrap = from->wo_wrap;
4871 to->wo_wrap_save = from->wo_wrap_save;
4872 to->wo_lbr = from->wo_lbr;
4873 to->wo_bri = from->wo_bri;
4874 to->wo_briopt = copy_option_val(from->wo_briopt);
4875 to->wo_scb = from->wo_scb;
4876 to->wo_scb_save = from->wo_scb_save;
4877 to->wo_sms = from->wo_sms;
4878 to->wo_crb = from->wo_crb;
4879 to->wo_crb_save = from->wo_crb_save;
4880 to->wo_siso = from->wo_siso;
4881 to->wo_so = from->wo_so;
4882 to->wo_spell = from->wo_spell;
4883 to->wo_cuc = from->wo_cuc;
4884 to->wo_cul = from->wo_cul;
4885 to->wo_culopt = copy_option_val(from->wo_culopt);
4886 to->wo_cc = copy_option_val(from->wo_cc);
4887 to->wo_diff = from->wo_diff;
4888 to->wo_diff_saved = from->wo_diff_saved;
4889 to->wo_cocu = copy_option_val(from->wo_cocu);
4890 to->wo_cole = from->wo_cole;
4891 to->wo_fdc = copy_option_val(from->wo_fdc);
4892 to->wo_fdc_save = from->wo_diff_saved ? xstrdup(from->wo_fdc_save) : empty_string_option;
4893 to->wo_fen = from->wo_fen;
4894 to->wo_fen_save = from->wo_fen_save;
4895 to->wo_fdi = copy_option_val(from->wo_fdi);
4896 to->wo_fml = from->wo_fml;
4897 to->wo_fdl = from->wo_fdl;
4898 to->wo_fdl_save = from->wo_fdl_save;
4899 to->wo_fdm = copy_option_val(from->wo_fdm);
4900 to->wo_fdm_save = from->wo_diff_saved ? xstrdup(from->wo_fdm_save) : empty_string_option;
4901 to->wo_fdn = from->wo_fdn;
4902 to->wo_fde = copy_option_val(from->wo_fde);
4903 to->wo_fdt = copy_option_val(from->wo_fdt);
4904 to->wo_fmr = copy_option_val(from->wo_fmr);
4905 to->wo_scl = copy_option_val(from->wo_scl);
4906 to->wo_winhl = copy_option_val(from->wo_winhl);
4907 to->wo_winbl = from->wo_winbl;
4908 to->wo_stc = copy_option_val(from->wo_stc);
4909
4910 // Copy the script context so that we know were the value was last set.
4911 memmove(to->wo_script_ctx, from->wo_script_ctx, sizeof(to->wo_script_ctx));
4912 check_winopt(to); // don't want NULL pointers
4913}
4914
4915/// Check string options in a window for a NULL value.
4916void check_win_options(win_T *win)
4917{
4918 check_winopt(&win->w_onebuf_opt);
4919 check_winopt(&win->w_allbuf_opt);
4920}
4921
4922/// Check for NULL pointers in a winopt_T and replace them with empty_string_option.
4923static void check_winopt(winopt_T *wop)
4924{
4925 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdc);
4926 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdc_save);
4927 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdi);
4928 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm);
4929 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm_save);
4930 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fde);
4931 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fdt);
4932 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fmr);
4933 check_string_option(&wop->wo_scl);
4934 check_string_option(&wop->wo_rlc);
4935 check_string_option(&wop->wo_sbr);
4936 check_string_option(&wop->wo_stl);
4937 check_string_option(&wop->wo_culopt);
4938 check_string_option(&wop->wo_cc);
4939 check_string_option(&wop->wo_cocu);
4940 check_string_option(&wop->wo_briopt);
4941 check_string_option(&wop->wo_winhl);
4942 check_string_option(&wop->wo_lcs);
4943 check_string_option(&wop->wo_fcs);
4944 check_string_option(&wop->wo_ve);
4945 check_string_option(&wop->wo_wbr);
4946 check_string_option(&wop->wo_stc);
4947}
4948
4949/// Free the allocated memory inside a winopt_T.
4950void clear_winopt(winopt_T *wop)
4951{
4952 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdc);
4953 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdc_save);
4954 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdi);
4955 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm);
4956 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdm_save);
4957 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fde);
4958 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fdt);
4959 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fmr);
4960 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_scl);
4961 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_rlc);
4962 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_sbr);
4963 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_stl);
4964 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_culopt);
4965 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_cc);
4966 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_cocu);
4967 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_briopt);
4968 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_winhl);
4969 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_lcs);
4970 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_fcs);
4971 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_ve);
4972 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_wbr);
4973 clear_string_option(&wop->wo_stc);
4974}
4975
4976void didset_window_options(win_T *wp, bool_Bool valid_cursor)
4977{
4978 check_colorcolumn(wp);
4979 briopt_check(wp);
4980 fill_culopt_flags(NULL((void*)0), wp);
4981 set_chars_option(wp, wp->w_p_fcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_fcs, kFillchars, true1, NULL((void*)0), 0);
4982 set_chars_option(wp, wp->w_p_lcsw_onebuf_opt.wo_lcs, kListchars, true1, NULL((void*)0), 0);
4983 parse_winhl_opt(wp); // sets w_hl_needs_update also for w_p_winbl
4984 check_blending(wp);
4985 set_winbar_win(wp, false0, valid_cursor);
4986 check_signcolumn(wp);
4987 wp->w_grid_alloc.blending = wp->w_p_winblw_onebuf_opt.wo_winbl > 0;
4988}
4989
4990/// Index into the options table for a buffer-local option enum.
4991static OptIndex buf_opt_idx[BV_COUNT];
4992#define COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, bv)buf->b_p_script_ctx[bv] = options[buf_opt_idx[bv]].last_set buf->b_p_script_ctx[bv] = options[buf_opt_idx[bv]].last_set
4993
4994/// Initialize buf_opt_idx[] if not done already.
4995static void init_buf_opt_idx(void)
4996{
4997 static bool_Bool did_init_buf_opt_idx = false0;
4998
4999 if (did_init_buf_opt_idx) {
5000 return;
5001 }
5002 did_init_buf_opt_idx = true1;
5003 for (OptIndex i = 0; i < kOptIndexCount357; i++) {
5004 if (options[i].indir & PV_BUF) {
5005 buf_opt_idx[options[i].indir & PV_MASK] = i;
5006 }
5007 }
5008}
5009
5010/// Copy global option values to local options for one buffer.
5011/// Used when creating a new buffer and sometimes when entering a buffer.
5012/// flags:
5013/// BCO_ENTER We will enter the buffer "buf".
5014/// BCO_ALWAYS Always copy the options, but only set b_p_initialized when
5015/// appropriate.
5016/// BCO_NOHELP Don't copy the values to a help buffer.
5017void buf_copy_options(buf_T *buf, int flags)
5018{
5019 bool_Bool should_copy = true1;
5020 char *save_p_isk = NULL((void*)0); // init for GCC
5021 bool_Bool did_isk = false0;
5022
5023 // Skip this when the option defaults have not been set yet. Happens when
5024 // main() allocates the first buffer.
5025 if (p_cpo != NULL((void*)0)) {
5026 //
5027 // Always copy when entering and 'cpo' contains 'S'.
5028 // Don't copy when already initialized.
5029 // Don't copy when 'cpo' contains 's' and not entering.
5030 // 'S' BCO_ENTER initialized 's' should_copy
5031 // yes yes X X true
5032 // yes no yes X false
5033 // no X yes X false
5034 // X no no yes false
5035 // X no no no true
5036 // no yes no X true
5037 ///
5038 if ((vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BUFOPTGLOB'S') == NULL((void*)0) || !(flags & BCO_ENTER))
5039 && (buf->b_p_initialized
5040 || (!(flags & BCO_ENTER)
5041 && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_BUFOPT's') != NULL((void*)0)))) {
5042 should_copy = false0;
5043 }
5044
5045 if (should_copy || (flags & BCO_ALWAYS)) {
5046 CLEAR_FIELD(buf->b_p_script_ctx)memset(&(buf->b_p_script_ctx), 0, sizeof(buf->b_p_script_ctx
));
5047 init_buf_opt_idx();
5048 // Don't copy the options specific to a help buffer when
5049 // BCO_NOHELP is given or the options were initialized already
5050 // (jumping back to a help file with CTRL-T or CTRL-O)
5051 bool_Bool dont_do_help = ((flags & BCO_NOHELP) && buf->b_help) || buf->b_p_initialized;
5052 if (dont_do_help) { // don't free b_p_isk
5053 save_p_isk = buf->b_p_isk;
5054 buf->b_p_isk = NULL((void*)0);
5055 }
5056 // Always free the allocated strings. If not already initialized,
5057 // reset 'readonly' and copy 'fileformat'.
5058 if (!buf->b_p_initialized) {
5059 free_buf_options(buf, true1);
5060 buf->b_p_ro = false0; // don't copy readonly
5061 buf->b_p_fenc = xstrdup(p_fenc);
5062 switch (*p_ffs) {
5063 case 'm':
5064 buf->b_p_ff = xstrdup(FF_MAC"mac");
5065 break;
5066 case 'd':
5067 buf->b_p_ff = xstrdup(FF_DOS"dos");
5068 break;
5069 case 'u':
5070 buf->b_p_ff = xstrdup(FF_UNIX"unix");
5071 break;
5072 default:
5073 buf->b_p_ff = xstrdup(p_ff);
5074 break;
5075 }
5076 buf->b_p_bh = empty_string_option;
5077 buf->b_p_bt = empty_string_option;
5078 } else {
5079 free_buf_options(buf, false0);
5080 }
5081
5082 buf->b_p_ai = p_ai;
5083 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_AI)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_AI] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_AI]].last_set;
5084 buf->b_p_ai_nopaste = p_ai_nopaste;
5085 buf->b_p_sw = p_sw;
5086 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SW)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SW] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SW]].last_set;
5087 buf->b_p_scbk = p_scbk;
5088 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SCBK)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SCBK] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SCBK
]].last_set;
5089 buf->b_p_tw = p_tw;
5090 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_TW)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_TW] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_TW]].last_set;
5091 buf->b_p_tw_nopaste = p_tw_nopaste;
5092 buf->b_p_tw_nobin = p_tw_nobin;
5093 buf->b_p_wm = p_wm;
5094 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_WM)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_WM] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_WM]].last_set;
5095 buf->b_p_wm_nopaste = p_wm_nopaste;
5096 buf->b_p_wm_nobin = p_wm_nobin;
5097 buf->b_p_bin = p_bin;
5098 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_BIN)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_BIN] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_BIN]]
.last_set;
5099 buf->b_p_bomb = p_bomb;
5100 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_BOMB)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_BOMB] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_BOMB
]].last_set;
5101 buf->b_p_et = p_et;
5102 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_ET)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_ET] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_ET]].last_set;
5103 buf->b_p_fixeol = p_fixeol;
5104 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_FIXEOL)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_FIXEOL] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_FIXEOL
]].last_set;
5105 buf->b_p_et_nobin = p_et_nobin;
5106 buf->b_p_et_nopaste = p_et_nopaste;
5107 buf->b_p_ml = p_ml;
5108 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_ML)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_ML] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_ML]].last_set;
5109 buf->b_p_ml_nobin = p_ml_nobin;
5110 buf->b_p_inf = p_inf;
5111 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_INF)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_INF] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_INF]]
.last_set;
5112 if (cmdmod.cmod_flags & CMOD_NOSWAPFILE) {
5113 buf->b_p_swf = false0;
5114 } else {
5115 buf->b_p_swf = p_swf;
5116 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SWF)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SWF] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SWF]]
.last_set;
5117 }
5118 buf->b_p_cpt = xstrdup(p_cpt);
5119 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CPT)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CPT] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CPT]]
.last_set;
5120#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
5121 buf->b_p_csl = xstrdup(p_csl);
5122 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CSL)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CSL] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CSL]]
.last_set;
5123#endif
5124 buf->b_p_cfu = xstrdup(p_cfu);
5125 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CFU)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CFU] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CFU]]
.last_set;
5126 set_buflocal_cfu_callback(buf);
5127 buf->b_p_ofu = xstrdup(p_ofu);
5128 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_OFU)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_OFU] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_OFU]]
.last_set;
5129 set_buflocal_ofu_callback(buf);
5130 buf->b_p_tfu = xstrdup(p_tfu);
5131 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_TFU)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_TFU] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_TFU]]
.last_set;
5132 set_buflocal_tfu_callback(buf);
5133 buf->b_p_sts = p_sts;
5134 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_STS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_STS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_STS]]
.last_set;
5135 buf->b_p_sts_nopaste = p_sts_nopaste;
5136 buf->b_p_vsts = xstrdup(p_vsts);
5137 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_VSTS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_VSTS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_VSTS
]].last_set;
5138 if (p_vsts && p_vsts != empty_string_option) {
5139 tabstop_set(p_vsts, &buf->b_p_vsts_array);
5140 } else {
5141 buf->b_p_vsts_array = NULL((void*)0);
5142 }
5143 buf->b_p_vsts_nopaste = p_vsts_nopaste ? xstrdup(p_vsts_nopaste) : NULL((void*)0);
5144 buf->b_p_com = xstrdup(p_com);
5145 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_COM)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_COM] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_COM]]
.last_set;
5146 buf->b_p_cms = xstrdup(p_cms);
5147 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CMS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CMS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CMS]]
.last_set;
5148 buf->b_p_fo = xstrdup(p_fo);
5149 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_FO)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_FO] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_FO]].last_set;
5150 buf->b_p_flp = xstrdup(p_flp);
5151 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_FLP)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_FLP] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_FLP]]
.last_set;
5152 buf->b_p_nf = xstrdup(p_nf);
5153 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_NF)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_NF] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_NF]].last_set;
5154 buf->b_p_mps = xstrdup(p_mps);
5155 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_MPS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_MPS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_MPS]]
.last_set;
5156 buf->b_p_si = p_si;
5157 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SI)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SI] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SI]].last_set;
5158 buf->b_p_channel = 0;
5159 buf->b_p_ci = p_ci;
5160
5161 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CI)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CI] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CI]].last_set;
5162 buf->b_p_cin = p_cin;
5163 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CIN)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CIN] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CIN]]
.last_set;
5164 buf->b_p_cink = xstrdup(p_cink);
5165 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CINK)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CINK] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CINK
]].last_set;
5166 buf->b_p_cino = xstrdup(p_cino);
5167 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CINO)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CINO] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CINO
]].last_set;
5168 buf->b_p_cinsd = xstrdup(p_cinsd);
5169 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CINSD)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CINSD] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CINSD
]].last_set;
5170 buf->b_p_lop = xstrdup(p_lop);
5171 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_LOP)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_LOP] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_LOP]]
.last_set;
5172
5173 // Don't copy 'filetype', it must be detected
5174 buf->b_p_ft = empty_string_option;
5175 buf->b_p_pi = p_pi;
5176 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_PI)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_PI] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_PI]].last_set;
5177 buf->b_p_cinw = xstrdup(p_cinw);
5178 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_CINW)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_CINW] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_CINW
]].last_set;
5179 buf->b_p_lisp = p_lisp;
5180 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_LISP)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_LISP] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_LISP
]].last_set;
5181 // Don't copy 'syntax', it must be set
5182 buf->b_p_syn = empty_string_option;
5183 buf->b_p_smc = p_smc;
5184 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SMC)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SMC] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SMC]]
.last_set;
5185 buf->b_s.b_syn_isk = empty_string_option;
5186 buf->b_s.b_p_spc = xstrdup(p_spc);
5187 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SPC)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SPC] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SPC]]
.last_set;
5188 compile_cap_prog(&buf->b_s);
5189 buf->b_s.b_p_spf = xstrdup(p_spf);
5190 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SPF)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SPF] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SPF]]
.last_set;
5191 buf->b_s.b_p_spl = xstrdup(p_spl);
5192 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SPL)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SPL] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SPL]]
.last_set;
5193 buf->b_s.b_p_spo = xstrdup(p_spo);
5194 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SPO)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SPO] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SPO]]
.last_set;
5195 buf->b_p_inde = xstrdup(p_inde);
5196 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_INDE)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_INDE] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_INDE
]].last_set;
5197 buf->b_p_indk = xstrdup(p_indk);
5198 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_INDK)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_INDK] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_INDK
]].last_set;
5199 buf->b_p_fp = empty_string_option;
5200 buf->b_p_fex = xstrdup(p_fex);
5201 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_FEX)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_FEX] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_FEX]]
.last_set;
5202 buf->b_p_sua = xstrdup(p_sua);
5203 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_SUA)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_SUA] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_SUA]]
.last_set;
5204 buf->b_p_keymap = xstrdup(p_keymap);
5205 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_KMAP)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_KMAP] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_KMAP
]].last_set;
5206 buf->b_kmap_state |= KEYMAP_INIT1;
5207 // This isn't really an option, but copying the langmap and IME
5208 // state from the current buffer is better than resetting it.
5209 buf->b_p_iminsert = p_iminsert;
5210 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_IMI)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_IMI] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_IMI]]
.last_set;
5211 buf->b_p_imsearch = p_imsearch;
5212 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_IMS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_IMS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_IMS]]
.last_set;
5213
5214 // options that are normally global but also have a local value
5215 // are not copied, start using the global value
5216 buf->b_p_ar = -1;
5217 buf->b_p_ul = NO_LOCAL_UNDOLEVEL(-123456);
5218 buf->b_p_bkc = empty_string_option;
5219 buf->b_bkc_flags = 0;
5220 buf->b_p_gp = empty_string_option;
5221 buf->b_p_mp = empty_string_option;
5222 buf->b_p_efm = empty_string_option;
5223 buf->b_p_ep = empty_string_option;
5224 buf->b_p_kp = empty_string_option;
5225 buf->b_p_path = empty_string_option;
5226 buf->b_p_tags = empty_string_option;
5227 buf->b_p_tc = empty_string_option;
5228 buf->b_tc_flags = 0;
5229 buf->b_p_def = empty_string_option;
5230 buf->b_p_inc = empty_string_option;
5231 buf->b_p_inex = xstrdup(p_inex);
5232 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_INEX)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_INEX] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_INEX
]].last_set;
5233 buf->b_p_dict = empty_string_option;
5234 buf->b_p_tsr = empty_string_option;
5235 buf->b_p_tsrfu = empty_string_option;
5236 buf->b_p_qe = xstrdup(p_qe);
5237 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_QE)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_QE] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_QE]].last_set;
5238 buf->b_p_udf = p_udf;
5239 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_UDF)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_UDF] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_UDF]]
.last_set;
5240 buf->b_p_lw = empty_string_option;
5241 buf->b_p_menc = empty_string_option;
5242
5243 // Don't copy the options set by ex_help(), use the saved values,
5244 // when going from a help buffer to a non-help buffer.
5245 // Don't touch these at all when BCO_NOHELP is used and going from
5246 // or to a help buffer.
5247 if (dont_do_help) {
5248 buf->b_p_isk = save_p_isk;
5249 if (p_vts && p_vts != empty_string_option && !buf->b_p_vts_array) {
5250 tabstop_set(p_vts, &buf->b_p_vts_array);
5251 } else {
5252 buf->b_p_vts_array = NULL((void*)0);
5253 }
5254 } else {
5255 buf->b_p_isk = xstrdup(p_isk);
5256 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_ISK)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_ISK] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_ISK]]
.last_set;
5257 did_isk = true1;
5258 buf->b_p_ts = p_ts;
5259 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_TS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_TS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_TS]].last_set;
5260 buf->b_p_vts = xstrdup(p_vts);
5261 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_VTS)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_VTS] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_VTS]]
.last_set;
5262 if (p_vts && p_vts != empty_string_option && !buf->b_p_vts_array) {
5263 tabstop_set(p_vts, &buf->b_p_vts_array);
5264 } else {
5265 buf->b_p_vts_array = NULL((void*)0);
5266 }
5267 buf->b_help = false0;
5268 if (buf->b_p_bt[0] == 'h') {
5269 clear_string_option(&buf->b_p_bt);
5270 }
5271 buf->b_p_ma = p_ma;
5272 COPY_OPT_SCTX(buf, BV_MA)buf->b_p_script_ctx[BV_MA] = options[buf_opt_idx[BV_MA]].last_set;
5273 }
5274 }
5275
5276 // When the options should be copied (ignoring BCO_ALWAYS), set the
5277 // flag that indicates that the options have been initialized.
5278 if (should_copy) {
5279 buf->b_p_initialized = true1;
5280 }
5281 }
5282
5283 check_buf_options(buf); // make sure we don't have NULLs
5284 if (did_isk) {
5285 buf_init_chartab(buf, false0);
5286 }
5287}
5288
5289/// Reset the 'modifiable' option and its default value.
5290void reset_modifiable(void)
5291{
5292 curbuf->b_p_ma = false0;
5293 p_ma = false0;
5294 options[kOptModifiable].def_val.boolean = false0;
5295}
5296
5297/// Set the global value for 'iminsert' to the local value.
5298void set_iminsert_global(buf_T *buf)
5299{
5300 p_iminsert = buf->b_p_iminsert;
5301}
5302
5303/// Set the global value for 'imsearch' to the local value.
5304void set_imsearch_global(buf_T *buf)
5305{
5306 p_imsearch = buf->b_p_imsearch;
5307}
5308
5309static OptIndex expand_option_idx = kOptInvalid;
5310static int expand_option_start_col = 0;
5311static char expand_option_name[5] = { 't', '_', NUL'\000', NUL'\000', NUL'\000' };
5312static int expand_option_flags = 0;
5313static bool_Bool expand_option_append = false0;
5314
5315/// @param opt_flags OPT_GLOBAL and/or OPT_LOCAL
5316void set_context_in_set_cmd(expand_T *xp, char *arg, int opt_flags)
5317{
5318 expand_option_flags = opt_flags;
5319
5320 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTINGS;
5321 if (*arg == NUL'\000') {
5322 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
5323 return;
5324 }
5325 char *p = arg + strlen(arg) - 1;
5326 if (*p == ' ' && *(p - 1) != '\\') {
5327 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
5328 return;
5329 }
5330 while (p > arg) {
5331 char *s = p;
5332 // count number of backslashes before ' ' or ','
5333 if (*p == ' ' || *p == ',') {
5334 while (s > arg && *(s - 1) == '\\') {
5335 s--;
5336 }
5337 }
5338 // break at a space with an even number of backslashes
5339 if (*p == ' ' && ((p - s) & 1) == 0) {
5340 p++;
5341 break;
5342 }
5343 p--;
5344 }
5345 if (strncmp(p, "no", 2) == 0) {
5346 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS;
5347 xp->xp_prefix = XP_PREFIX_NO;
5348 p += 2;
5349 } else if (strncmp(p, "inv", 3) == 0) {
5350 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS;
5351 xp->xp_prefix = XP_PREFIX_INV;
5352 p += 3;
5353 }
5354 xp->xp_pattern = p;
5355 arg = p;
5356
5357 char nextchar;
5358 uint32_t flags = 0;
5359 OptIndex opt_idx = 0;
5360 bool_Bool is_term_option = false0;
5361
5362 if (*arg == '<') {
5363 while (*p != '>') {
5364 if (*p++ == NUL'\000') { // expand terminal option name
5365 return;
5366 }
5367 }
5368 int key = get_special_key_code(arg + 1);
5369 if (key == 0) { // unknown name
5370 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5371 return;
5372 }
5373 nextchar = *++p;
5374 is_term_option = true1;
5375 expand_option_name[2] = (char)(uint8_t)KEY2TERMCAP0(key)((-(key)) & 0xff);
5376 expand_option_name[3] = (char)(uint8_t)KEY2TERMCAP1(key)(((unsigned)(-(key)) >> 8) & 0xff);
5377 } else {
5378 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_') {
5379 p += 2;
5380 if (*p != NUL'\000') {
5381 p++;
5382 }
5383 if (*p == NUL'\000') {
5384 return; // expand option name
5385 }
5386 nextchar = *++p;
5387 is_term_option = true1;
5388 expand_option_name[2] = p[-2];
5389 expand_option_name[3] = p[-1];
5390 } else {
5391 // Allow * wildcard.
5392 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*p)) || *p == '_' || *p == '*') {
5393 p++;
5394 }
5395 if (*p == NUL'\000') {
5396 return;
5397 }
5398 nextchar = *p;
5399 opt_idx = find_option_len(arg, (size_t)(p - arg));
5400 if (opt_idx == kOptInvalid || options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) {
5401 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5402 return;
5403 }
5404 flags = options[opt_idx].flags;
5405 if (option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean)) {
5406 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5407 return;
5408 }
5409 }
5410 }
5411 // handle "-=" and "+="
5412 expand_option_append = false0;
5413 bool_Bool expand_option_subtract = false0;
5414 if ((nextchar == '-' || nextchar == '+' || nextchar == '^') && p[1] == '=') {
5415 if (nextchar == '-') {
5416 expand_option_subtract = true1;
5417 }
5418 if (nextchar == '+' || nextchar == '^') {
5419 expand_option_append = true1;
5420 }
5421 p++;
5422 nextchar = '=';
5423 }
5424 if ((nextchar != '=' && nextchar != ':')
5425 || xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS) {
5426 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_UNSUCCESSFUL;
5427 return;
5428 }
5429
5430 // Below are for handling expanding a specific option's value after the '=' or ':'
5431
5432 if (is_term_option) {
5433 expand_option_idx = kOptInvalid;
5434 } else {
5435 expand_option_idx = opt_idx;
5436 }
5437
5438 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
5439 expand_option_start_col = (int)(p + 1 - xp->xp_line);
5440
5441 // Certain options currently have special case handling to reuse the
5442 // expansion logic with other commands.
5443 if (options[opt_idx].var == &p_syn) {
5444 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_OWNSYNTAX;
5445 return;
5446 }
5447 if (options[opt_idx].var == &p_ft) {
5448 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_FILETYPE;
5449 return;
5450 }
5451 if (options[opt_idx].var == &p_keymap) {
5452 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_KEYMAP;
5453 return;
5454 }
5455
5456 // Now pick. If the option has a custom expander, use that. Otherwise, just
5457 // fill with the existing option value.
5458 if (expand_option_subtract) {
5459 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTING_SUBTRACT;
5460 return;
5461 } else if (expand_option_idx != kOptInvalid && options[expand_option_idx].opt_expand_cb != NULL((void*)0)) {
5462 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_STRING_SETTING;
5463 } else if (*xp->xp_pattern == NUL'\000') {
5464 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_OLD_SETTING;
5465 return;
5466 } else {
5467 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
5468 }
5469
5470 if (is_term_option || option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeNumber)) {
5471 return;
5472 }
5473
5474 // Only string options below
5475
5476 // Options that have P_EXPAND are considered to all use file/dir expansion.
5477 if (flags & P_EXPAND0x02U) {
5478 p = options[opt_idx].var;
5479 if (p == (char *)&p_bdir
5480 || p == (char *)&p_dir
5481 || p == (char *)&p_path
5482 || p == (char *)&p_pp
5483 || p == (char *)&p_rtp
5484 || p == (char *)&p_cdpath
5485 || p == (char *)&p_vdir) {
5486 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_DIRECTORIES;
5487 if (p == (char *)&p_path || p == (char *)&p_cdpath) {
5488 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_THREE;
5489 } else {
5490 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_ONE;
5491 }
5492 } else {
5493 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_FILES;
5494 // for 'tags' need three backslashes for a space
5495 if (p == (char *)&p_tags) {
5496 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_THREE;
5497 } else {
5498 xp->xp_backslash = XP_BS_ONE;
5499 }
5500 }
5501 if (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) {
5502 xp->xp_backslash |= XP_BS_COMMA;
5503 }
5504 }
5505
5506 // For an option that is a list of file names, or comma/colon-separated
5507 // values, split it by the delimiter and find the start of the current
5508 // pattern, while accounting for backslash-escaped space/commas/colons.
5509 // Triple-backslashed escaped file names (e.g. 'path') can also be
5510 // delimited by space.
5511 if ((flags & P_EXPAND0x02U) || (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) || (flags & P_COLON0x10000000U)) {
5512 for (p = arg + strlen(arg) - 1; p > xp->xp_pattern; p--) {
5513 // count number of backslashes before ' ' or ','
5514 if (*p == ' ' || *p == ',' || (*p == ':' && (flags & P_COLON0x10000000U))) {
5515 char *s = p;
5516 while (s > xp->xp_pattern && *(s - 1) == '\\') {
5517 s--;
5518 }
5519 if ((*p == ' ' && ((xp->xp_backslash & XP_BS_THREE) && (p - s) < 3))
5520#if defined(BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME)
5521 || (*p == ',' && (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) && (p - s) < 1)
5522#else
5523 || (*p == ',' && (flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) && (p - s) < 2)
5524#endif
5525 || (*p == ':' && (flags & P_COLON0x10000000U))) {
5526 xp->xp_pattern = p + 1;
5527 break;
5528 }
5529 }
5530 }
5531 }
5532
5533 // An option that is a list of single-character flags should always start
5534 // at the end as we don't complete words.
5535 if (flags & P_FLAGLIST0x8000U) {
5536 xp->xp_pattern = arg + strlen(arg);
5537 }
5538
5539 // Some options can either be using file/dir expansions, or custom value
5540 // expansion depending on what the user typed. Unfortunately we have to
5541 // manually handle it here to make sure we have the correct xp_context set.
5542 // for 'spellsuggest' start at "file:"
5543 if (options[opt_idx].var == &p_sps) {
5544 if (strncmp(xp->xp_pattern, "file:", 5) == 0) {
5545 xp->xp_pattern += 5;
5546 return;
5547 } else if (options[expand_option_idx].opt_expand_cb != NULL((void*)0)) {
5548 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_STRING_SETTING;
5549 }
5550 }
5551}
5552
5553/// Returns true if "str" either matches "regmatch" or fuzzy matches "pat".
5554///
5555/// If "test_only" is true and "fuzzy" is false and if "str" matches the regular
5556/// expression "regmatch", then returns true. Otherwise returns false.
5557///
5558/// If "test_only" is false and "fuzzy" is false and if "str" matches the
5559/// regular expression "regmatch", then stores the match in matches[idx] and
5560/// returns true.
5561///
5562/// If "test_only" is true and "fuzzy" is true and if "str" fuzzy matches
5563/// "fuzzystr", then returns true. Otherwise returns false.
5564///
5565/// If "test_only" is false and "fuzzy" is true and if "str" fuzzy matches
5566/// "fuzzystr", then stores the match details in fuzmatch[idx] and returns true.
5567static bool_Bool match_str(char *const str, regmatch_T *const regmatch, char **const matches,
5568 const int idx, const bool_Bool test_only, const bool_Bool fuzzy,
5569 const char *const fuzzystr, fuzmatch_str_T *const fuzmatch)
5570{
5571 if (!fuzzy) {
5572 if (vim_regexec(regmatch, str, 0)) {
5573 if (!test_only) {
5574 matches[idx] = xstrdup(str);
5575 }
5576 return true1;
5577 }
5578 } else {
5579 const int score = fuzzy_match_str(str, fuzzystr);
5580 if (score != 0) {
5581 if (!test_only) {
5582 fuzmatch[idx].idx = idx;
5583 fuzmatch[idx].str = xstrdup(str);
5584 fuzmatch[idx].score = score;
5585 }
5586 return true1;
5587 }
5588 }
5589 return false0;
5590}
5591
5592int ExpandSettings(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, char *fuzzystr, int *numMatches,
5593 char ***matches, const bool_Bool can_fuzzy)
5594{
5595 int num_normal = 0; // Nr of matching non-term-code settings
5596 int count = 0;
5597 static char *(names[]) = { "all" };
5598 int ic = regmatch->rm_ic; // remember the ignore-case flag
5599
5600 fuzmatch_str_T *fuzmatch = NULL((void*)0);
5601 const bool_Bool fuzzy = can_fuzzy && cmdline_fuzzy_complete(fuzzystr);
5602
5603 // do this loop twice:
5604 // loop == 0: count the number of matching options
5605 // loop == 1: copy the matching options into allocated memory
5606 for (int loop = 0; loop <= 1; loop++) {
5607 regmatch->rm_ic = ic;
5608 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS) {
5609 for (int match = 0; match < (int)ARRAY_SIZE(names)((sizeof(names)/sizeof((names)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(names
) % sizeof((names)[0])))));
5610 match++) {
5611 if (match_str(names[match], regmatch, *matches,
5612 count, (loop == 0), fuzzy, fuzzystr, fuzmatch)) {
5613 if (loop == 0) {
5614 num_normal++;
5615 } else {
5616 count++;
5617 }
5618 }
5619 }
5620 }
5621 char *str;
5622 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
5623 str = options[opt_idx].fullname;
5624 if (options[opt_idx].var == NULL((void*)0)) {
5625 continue;
5626 }
5627 if (xp->xp_context == EXPAND_BOOL_SETTINGS
5628 && !(option_has_type(opt_idx, kOptValTypeBoolean))) {
5629 continue;
5630 }
5631
5632 if (match_str(str, regmatch, *matches, count, (loop == 0),
5633 fuzzy, fuzzystr, fuzmatch)) {
5634 if (loop == 0) {
5635 num_normal++;
5636 } else {
5637 count++;
5638 }
5639 } else if (!fuzzy && options[opt_idx].shortname != NULL((void*)0)
5640 && vim_regexec(regmatch, options[opt_idx].shortname, 0)) {
5641 // Compare against the abbreviated option name (for regular
5642 // expression match). Fuzzy matching (previous if) already
5643 // matches against both the expanded and abbreviated names.
5644 if (loop == 0) {
5645 num_normal++;
5646 } else {
5647 (*matches)[count++] = xstrdup(str);
5648 }
5649 }
5650 }
5651
5652 if (loop == 0) {
5653 if (num_normal > 0) {
5654 *numMatches = num_normal;
5655 } else {
5656 return OK1;
5657 }
5658 if (!fuzzy) {
5659 *matches = xmalloc((size_t)(*numMatches) * sizeof(char *));
5660 } else {
5661 fuzmatch = xmalloc((size_t)(*numMatches) * sizeof(fuzmatch_str_T));
5662 }
5663 }
5664 }
5665
5666 if (fuzzy) {
5667 fuzzymatches_to_strmatches(fuzmatch, matches, count, false0);
5668 }
5669
5670 return OK1;
5671}
5672
5673/// Escape an option value that can be used on the command-line with :set.
5674/// Caller needs to free the returned string, unless NULL is returned.
5675static char *escape_option_str_cmdline(char *var)
5676{
5677 // A backslash is required before some characters. This is the reverse of
5678 // what happens in do_set().
5679 char *buf = vim_strsave_escaped(var, escape_chars);
5680
5681#ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
5682 // For MS-Windows et al. we don't double backslashes at the start and
5683 // before a file name character.
5684 // The reverse is found at stropt_copy_value().
5685 for (var = buf; *var != NUL'\000'; MB_PTR_ADV(var)(var += utfc_ptr2len((char *)var))) {
5686 if (var[0] == '\\' && var[1] == '\\'
5687 && expand_option_idx != kOptInvalid
5688 && (options[expand_option_idx].flags & P_EXPAND0x02U)
5689 && vim_isfilec((uint8_t)var[2])
5690 && (var[2] != '\\' || (var == buf && var[4] != '\\'))) {
5691 STRMOVE(var, var + 1)memmove((var), (var + 1), strlen(var + 1) + 1);
5692 }
5693 }
5694#endif
5695 return buf;
5696}
5697
5698/// Expansion handler for :set= when we just want to fill in with the existing value.
5699int ExpandOldSetting(int *numMatches, char ***matches)
5700{
5701 char *var = NULL((void*)0);
5702
5703 *numMatches = 0;
5704 *matches = xmalloc(sizeof(char *));
5705
5706 // For a terminal key code expand_option_idx is kOptInvalid.
5707 if (expand_option_idx == kOptInvalid) {
5708 expand_option_idx = find_option(expand_option_name);
5709 }
5710
5711 if (expand_option_idx != kOptInvalid) {
5712 // Put string of option value in NameBuff.
5713 option_value2string(&options[expand_option_idx], expand_option_flags);
5714 var = NameBuff;
5715 } else {
5716 var = "";
5717 }
5718
5719 char *buf = escape_option_str_cmdline(var);
5720
5721 (*matches)[0] = buf;
5722 *numMatches = 1;
5723 return OK1;
5724}
5725
5726/// Expansion handler for :set=/:set+= when the option has a custom expansion handler.
5727int ExpandStringSetting(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, int *numMatches, char ***matches)
5728{
5729 if (expand_option_idx == kOptInvalid || options[expand_option_idx].opt_expand_cb == NULL((void*)0)) {
5730 // Not supposed to reach this. This function is only for options with
5731 // custom expansion callbacks.
5732 return FAIL0;
5733 }
5734
5735 optexpand_T args = {
5736 .oe_varp = get_varp_scope(&options[expand_option_idx], expand_option_flags),
5737 .oe_append = expand_option_append,
5738 .oe_regmatch = regmatch,
5739 .oe_xp = xp,
5740 .oe_set_arg = xp->xp_line + expand_option_start_col,
5741 };
5742 args.oe_include_orig_val = !expand_option_append && (*args.oe_set_arg == NUL'\000');
5743
5744 // Retrieve the existing value, but escape it as a reverse of setting it.
5745 // We technically only need to do this when oe_append or
5746 // oe_include_orig_val is true.
5747 option_value2string(&options[expand_option_idx], expand_option_flags);
5748 char *var = NameBuff;
5749 char *buf = escape_option_str_cmdline(var);
5750 args.oe_opt_value = buf;
5751
5752 int num_ret = options[expand_option_idx].opt_expand_cb(&args, numMatches, matches);
5753
5754 xfree(buf);
5755 return num_ret;
5756}
5757
5758/// Expansion handler for :set-=
5759int ExpandSettingSubtract(expand_T *xp, regmatch_T *regmatch, int *numMatches, char ***matches)
5760{
5761 if (expand_option_idx == kOptInvalid) {
5762 // term option
5763 return ExpandOldSetting(numMatches, matches);
5764 }
5765
5766 char *option_val = *(char **)get_option_varp_scope_from(expand_option_idx,
5767 expand_option_flags,
5768 curbuf, curwin);
5769
5770 uint32_t option_flags = options[expand_option_idx].flags;
5771
5772 if (option_has_type(expand_option_idx, kOptValTypeNumber)) {
5773 return ExpandOldSetting(numMatches, matches);
5774 } else if (option_flags & P_COMMA0x1000U) {
5775 // Split the option by comma, then present each option to the user if
5776 // it matches the pattern.
5777 // This condition needs to go first, because 'whichwrap' has both
5778 // P_COMMA and P_FLAGLIST.
5779
5780 if (*option_val == NUL'\000') {
5781 return FAIL0;
5782 }
5783
5784 // Make a copy as we need to inject null characters destructively.
5785 char *option_copy = xstrdup(option_val);
5786 char *next_val = option_copy;
5787
5788 garray_T ga;
5789 ga_init(&ga, sizeof(char *), 10);
5790
5791 do {
5792 char *item = next_val;
5793 char *comma = vim_strchr(next_val, ',');
5794 while (comma != NULL((void*)0) && comma != next_val && *(comma - 1) == '\\') {
5795 // "\," is interpreted as a literal comma rather than option
5796 // separator when reading options in copy_option_part(). Skip
5797 // it.
5798 comma = vim_strchr(comma + 1, ',');
5799 }
5800 if (comma != NULL((void*)0)) {
5801 *comma = NUL'\000'; // null-terminate this value, required by later functions
5802 next_val = comma + 1;
5803 } else {
5804 next_val = NULL((void*)0);
5805 }
5806
5807 if (*item == NUL'\000') {
5808 // empty value, don't add to list
5809 continue;
5810 }
5811
5812 if (!vim_regexec(regmatch, item, 0)) {
5813 continue;
5814 }
5815
5816 char *buf = escape_option_str_cmdline(item);
5817 GA_APPEND(char *, &ga, buf)do { ga_grow(&ga, 1); ((char * *)(&ga)->ga_data)[(
&ga)->ga_len] = (buf); (&ga)->ga_len++; } while
(0);
5818 } while (next_val != NULL((void*)0));
5819
5820 xfree(option_copy);
5821
5822 *matches = ga.ga_data;
5823 *numMatches = ga.ga_len;
5824 return OK1;
5825 } else if (option_flags & P_FLAGLIST0x8000U) {
5826 // Only present the flags that are set on the option as the other flags
5827 // are not meaningful to do set-= on.
5828
5829 if (*xp->xp_pattern != NUL'\000') {
5830 // Don't suggest anything if cmdline is non-empty. Vim's set-=
5831 // behavior requires consecutive strings and it's usually
5832 // unintuitive to users if they try to subtract multiple flags at
5833 // once.
5834 return FAIL0;
5835 }
5836
5837 size_t num_flags = strlen(option_val);
5838 if (num_flags == 0) {
5839 return FAIL0;
5840 }
5841
5842 *matches = xmalloc(sizeof(char *) * (num_flags + 1));
5843
5844 int count = 0;
5845
5846 (*matches)[count++] = xstrdup(option_val);
5847
5848 if (num_flags > 1) {
5849 // If more than one flags, split the flags up and expose each
5850 // character as individual choice.
5851 for (char *flag = option_val; *flag != NUL'\000'; flag++) {
5852 (*matches)[count++] = xmemdupz(flag, 1);
5853 }
5854 }
5855
5856 *numMatches = count;
5857 return OK1;
5858 }
5859
5860 return ExpandOldSetting(numMatches, matches);
5861}
5862
5863/// Get the value for the numeric or string option///opp in a nice format into
5864/// NameBuff[]. Must not be called with a hidden option!
5865///
5866/// @param opt_flags OPT_GLOBAL and/or OPT_LOCAL
5867///
5868/// TODO(famiu): Replace this with optval_to_cstr() if possible.
5869static void option_value2string(vimoption_T *opt, int scope)
5870{
5871 void *varp = get_varp_scope(opt, scope);
5872
5873 if (option_has_type(get_opt_idx(opt), kOptValTypeNumber)) {
5874 OptInt wc = 0;
5875
5876 if (wc_use_keyname(varp, &wc)) {
5877 xstrlcpy(NameBuff, get_special_key_name((int)wc, 0), sizeof(NameBuff));
5878 } else if (wc != 0) {
5879 xstrlcpy(NameBuff, transchar((int)wc), sizeof(NameBuff));
5880 } else {
5881 snprintf(NameBuff,
5882 sizeof(NameBuff),
5883 "%" PRId64"l" "d",
5884 (int64_t)(*(OptInt *)varp));
5885 }
5886 } else { // string
5887 varp = *(char **)(varp);
5888 if (varp == NULL((void*)0)) { // Just in case.
5889 NameBuff[0] = NUL'\000';
5890 } else if (opt->flags & P_EXPAND0x02U) {
5891 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), varp, NameBuff, MAXPATHL4096, false0);
5892 } else {
5893 xstrlcpy(NameBuff, varp, MAXPATHL4096);
5894 }
5895 }
5896}
5897
5898/// Return true if "varp" points to 'wildchar' or 'wildcharm' and it can be
5899/// printed as a keyname.
5900/// "*wcp" is set to the value of the option if it's 'wildchar' or 'wildcharm'.
5901static int wc_use_keyname(const void *varp, OptInt *wcp)
5902{
5903 if (((OptInt *)varp == &p_wc) || ((OptInt *)varp == &p_wcm)) {
5904 *wcp = *(OptInt *)varp;
5905 if (IS_SPECIAL(*wcp)((*wcp) < 0) || find_special_key_in_table((int)(*wcp)) >= 0) {
5906 return true1;
5907 }
5908 }
5909 return false0;
5910}
5911
5912/// @returns true if "x" is present in 'shortmess' option, or
5913/// 'shortmess' contains 'a' and "x" is present in SHM_ALL_ABBREVIATIONS.
5914bool_Bool shortmess(int x)
5915{
5916 return (p_shm != NULL((void*)0)
5917 && (vim_strchr(p_shm, x) != NULL((void*)0)
5918 || (vim_strchr(p_shm, 'a') != NULL((void*)0)
5919 && vim_strchr(SHM_ALL_ABBREVIATIONS((char[]) { SHM_RO, SHM_MOD, SHM_LINES, SHM_WRI, 0 }), x) != NULL((void*)0))));
5920}
5921
5922/// vimrc_found() - Called when a vimrc or "VIMINIT" has been found.
5923///
5924/// Set the values for options that didn't get set yet to the defaults.
5925/// When "fname" is not NULL, use it to set $"envname" when it wasn't set yet.
5926void vimrc_found(char *fname, char *envname)
5927{
5928 if (fname != NULL((void*)0) && envname != NULL((void*)0)) {
5929 char *p = vim_getenv(envname);
5930 if (p == NULL((void*)0)) {
5931 // Set $MYVIMRC to the first vimrc file found.
5932 p = FullName_save(fname, false0);
5933 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
5934 os_setenv(envname, p, 1);
5935 xfree(p);
5936 }
5937 } else {
5938 xfree(p);
5939 }
5940 }
5941}
5942
5943/// Check whether global option has been set.
5944///
5945/// @param[in] name Option name.
5946///
5947/// @return True if option was set.
5948bool_Bool option_was_set(OptIndex opt_idx)
5949{
5950 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 5950,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
5951 return options[opt_idx].flags & P_WAS_SET0x20U;
5952}
5953
5954/// Reset the flag indicating option "name" was set.
5955///
5956/// @param[in] name Option name.
5957void reset_option_was_set(OptIndex opt_idx)
5958{
5959 assert(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)((void) sizeof ((opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (opt_idx != kOptInvalid) ; else __assert_fail ("opt_idx != kOptInvalid"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 5959,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
5960 options[opt_idx].flags &= ~P_WAS_SET0x20U;
5961}
5962
5963/// fill_culopt_flags() -- called when 'culopt' changes value
5964int fill_culopt_flags(char *val, win_T *wp)
5965{
5966 char *p;
5967 uint8_t culopt_flags_new = 0;
5968
5969 if (val == NULL((void*)0)) {
5970 p = wp->w_p_culoptw_onebuf_opt.wo_culopt;
5971 } else {
5972 p = val;
5973 }
5974 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
5975 // Note: Keep this in sync with p_culopt_values.
5976 if (strncmp(p, "line", 4) == 0) {
5977 p += 4;
5978 culopt_flags_new |= CULOPT_LINE0x01;
5979 } else if (strncmp(p, "both", 4) == 0) {
5980 p += 4;
5981 culopt_flags_new |= CULOPT_LINE0x01 | CULOPT_NBR0x04;
5982 } else if (strncmp(p, "number", 6) == 0) {
5983 p += 6;
5984 culopt_flags_new |= CULOPT_NBR0x04;
5985 } else if (strncmp(p, "screenline", 10) == 0) {
5986 p += 10;
5987 culopt_flags_new |= CULOPT_SCRLINE0x02;
5988 }
5989
5990 if (*p != ',' && *p != NUL'\000') {
5991 return FAIL0;
5992 }
5993 if (*p == ',') {
5994 p++;
5995 }
5996 }
5997
5998 // Can't have both "line" and "screenline".
5999 if ((culopt_flags_new & CULOPT_LINE0x01) && (culopt_flags_new & CULOPT_SCRLINE0x02)) {
6000 return FAIL0;
6001 }
6002 wp->w_p_culopt_flags = culopt_flags_new;
6003
6004 return OK1;
6005}
6006
6007/// Get the value of 'magic' taking "magic_overruled" into account.
6008bool_Bool magic_isset(void)
6009{
6010 switch (magic_overruled) {
6011 case OPTION_MAGIC_ON:
6012 return true1;
6013 case OPTION_MAGIC_OFF:
6014 return false0;
6015 case OPTION_MAGIC_NOT_SET:
6016 break;
6017 }
6018 return p_magic;
6019}
6020
6021/// Set the callback function value for an option that accepts a function name,
6022/// lambda, et al. (e.g. 'operatorfunc', 'tagfunc', etc.)
6023/// @return OK if the option is successfully set to a function, otherwise FAIL
6024int option_set_callback_func(char *optval, Callback *optcb)
6025{
6026 if (optval == NULL((void*)0) || *optval == NUL'\000') {
6027 callback_free(optcb);
6028 return OK1;
6029 }
6030
6031 typval_T *tv;
6032 if (*optval == '{'
6033 || (strncmp(optval, "function(", 9) == 0)
6034 || (strncmp(optval, "funcref(", 8) == 0)) {
6035 // Lambda expression or a funcref
6036 tv = eval_expr(optval, NULL((void*)0));
6037 if (tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
6038 return FAIL0;
6039 }
6040 } else {
6041 // treat everything else as a function name string
6042 tv = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*tv));
6043 tv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
6044 tv->vval.v_string = xstrdup(optval);
6045 }
6046
6047 Callback cb;
6048 if (!callback_from_typval(&cb, tv) || cb.type == kCallbackNone) {
6049 tv_free(tv);
6050 return FAIL0;
6051 }
6052
6053 callback_free(optcb);
6054 *optcb = cb;
6055 tv_free(tv);
6056 return OK1;
6057}
6058
6059static void didset_options_sctx(int opt_flags, int *buf)
6060{
6061 for (int i = 0;; i++) {
6062 if (buf[i] == kOptInvalid) {
6063 break;
6064 }
6065
6066 set_option_sctx(buf[i], opt_flags, current_sctx);
6067 }
6068}
6069
6070/// Check if backspacing over something is allowed.
6071/// @param what BS_INDENT, BS_EOL, BS_START, or BS_NOSTOP
6072bool_Bool can_bs(int what)
6073{
6074 if (what == BS_START's' && bt_prompt(curbuf)) {
6075 return false0;
6076 }
6077
6078 // support for number values was removed but we keep '2' since it is used in
6079 // legacy tests
6080 if (*p_bs == '2') {
6081 return what != BS_NOSTOP'p';
6082 }
6083
6084 return vim_strchr(p_bs, what) != NULL((void*)0);
6085}
6086
6087/// Get the local or global value of 'backupcopy'.
6088///
6089/// @param buf The buffer.
6090unsigned get_bkc_value(buf_T *buf)
6091{
6092 return buf->b_bkc_flags ? buf->b_bkc_flags : bkc_flags;
6093}
6094
6095/// Get the local or global value of 'formatlistpat'.
6096///
6097/// @param buf The buffer.
6098char *get_flp_value(buf_T *buf)
6099{
6100 if (buf->b_p_flp == NULL((void*)0) || *buf->b_p_flp == NUL'\000') {
6101 return p_flp;
6102 }
6103 return buf->b_p_flp;
6104}
6105
6106/// Get the local or global value of the 'virtualedit' flags.
6107unsigned get_ve_flags(win_T *wp)
6108{
6109 return (wp->w_ve_flagsw_onebuf_opt.wo_ve_flags ? wp->w_ve_flagsw_onebuf_opt.wo_ve_flags : ve_flags) & ~(VE_NONE16U | VE_NONEU32U);
6110}
6111
6112/// Get the local or global value of 'showbreak'.
6113///
6114/// @param win If not NULL, the window to get the local option from; global
6115/// otherwise.
6116char *get_showbreak_value(win_T *const win)
6117 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
6118{
6119 if (win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr == NULL((void*)0) || *win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr == NUL'\000') {
6120 return p_sbr;
6121 }
6122 if (strcmp(win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr, "NONE") == 0) {
6123 return empty_string_option;
6124 }
6125 return win->w_p_sbrw_onebuf_opt.wo_sbr;
6126}
6127
6128/// Return the current end-of-line type: EOL_DOS, EOL_UNIX or EOL_MAC.
6129int get_fileformat(const buf_T *buf)
6130 FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
6131{
6132 int c = (unsigned char)(*buf->b_p_ff);
6133
6134 if (buf->b_p_bin || c == 'u') {
6135 return EOL_UNIX0;
6136 }
6137 if (c == 'm') {
6138 return EOL_MAC2;
6139 }
6140 return EOL_DOS1;
6141}
6142
6143/// Like get_fileformat(), but override 'fileformat' with "p" for "++opt=val"
6144/// argument.
6145///
6146/// @param eap can be NULL!
6147int get_fileformat_force(const buf_T *buf, const exarg_T *eap)
6148 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
6149{
6150 int c;
6151
6152 if (eap != NULL((void*)0) && eap->force_ff != 0) {
6153 c = eap->force_ff;
6154 } else {
6155 if ((eap != NULL((void*)0) && eap->force_bin != 0)
6156 ? (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1) : buf->b_p_bin) {
6157 return EOL_UNIX0;
6158 }
6159 c = (unsigned char)(*buf->b_p_ff);
6160 }
6161 if (c == 'u') {
6162 return EOL_UNIX0;
6163 }
6164 if (c == 'm') {
6165 return EOL_MAC2;
6166 }
6167 return EOL_DOS1;
6168}
6169
6170/// Return the default fileformat from 'fileformats'.
6171int default_fileformat(void)
6172{
6173 switch (*p_ffs) {
6174 case 'm':
6175 return EOL_MAC2;
6176 case 'd':
6177 return EOL_DOS1;
6178 }
6179 return EOL_UNIX0;
6180}
6181
6182/// Set the current end-of-line type to EOL_UNIX, EOL_MAC, or EOL_DOS.
6183///
6184/// Sets 'fileformat'.
6185///
6186/// @param eol_style End-of-line style.
6187/// @param opt_flags OPT_LOCAL and/or OPT_GLOBAL
6188void set_fileformat(int eol_style, int opt_flags)
6189{
6190 char *p = NULL((void*)0);
6191
6192 switch (eol_style) {
6193 case EOL_UNIX0:
6194 p = FF_UNIX"unix";
6195 break;
6196 case EOL_MAC2:
6197 p = FF_MAC"mac";
6198 break;
6199 case EOL_DOS1:
6200 p = FF_DOS"dos";
6201 break;
6202 }
6203
6204 // p is NULL if "eol_style" is EOL_UNKNOWN.
6205 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
6206 set_string_option_direct(kOptFileformat, p, opt_flags, 0);
6207 }
6208
6209 // This may cause the buffer to become (un)modified.
6210 redraw_buf_status_later(curbuf);
6211 redraw_tabline = true1;
6212 need_maketitle = true1; // Set window title later.
6213}
6214
6215/// Skip to next part of an option argument: skip space and comma
6216char *skip_to_option_part(const char *p)
6217{
6218 if (*p == ',') {
6219 p++;
6220 }
6221 while (*p == ' ') {
6222 p++;
6223 }
6224 return (char *)p;
6225}
6226
6227/// Isolate one part of a string option separated by `sep_chars`.
6228///
6229/// @param[in,out] option advanced to the next part
6230/// @param[in,out] buf copy of the isolated part
6231/// @param[in] maxlen length of `buf`
6232/// @param[in] sep_chars chars that separate the option parts
6233///
6234/// @return length of `*option`
6235size_t copy_option_part(char **option, char *buf, size_t maxlen, char *sep_chars)
6236{
6237 size_t len = 0;
6238 char *p = *option;
6239
6240 // skip '.' at start of option part, for 'suffixes'
6241 if (*p == '.') {
6242 buf[len++] = *p++;
6243 }
6244 while (*p != NUL'\000' && vim_strchr(sep_chars, (uint8_t)(*p)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
6245 // Skip backslash before a separator character and space.
6246 if (p[0] == '\\' && vim_strchr(sep_chars, (uint8_t)p[1]) != NULL((void*)0)) {
6247 p++;
6248 }
6249 if (len < maxlen - 1) {
6250 buf[len++] = *p;
6251 }
6252 p++;
6253 }
6254 buf[len] = NUL'\000';
6255
6256 if (*p != NUL'\000' && *p != ',') { // skip non-standard separator
6257 p++;
6258 }
6259 p = skip_to_option_part(p); // p points to next file name
6260
6261 *option = p;
6262 return len;
6263}
6264
6265/// Return true when 'shell' has "csh" in the tail.
6266int csh_like_shell(void)
6267{
6268 return strstr(path_tail(p_sh), "csh") != NULL((void*)0);
6269}
6270
6271/// Return true when 'shell' has "fish" in the tail.
6272bool_Bool fish_like_shell(void)
6273{
6274 return strstr(path_tail(p_sh), "fish") != NULL((void*)0);
6275}
6276
6277/// Get window or buffer local options
6278dict_T *get_winbuf_options(const int bufopt)
6279 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
6280{
6281 dict_T *const d = tv_dict_alloc();
6282
6283 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
6284 vimoption_T *opt = &options[opt_idx];
6285
6286 if ((bufopt && (opt->indir & PV_BUF))
6287 || (!bufopt && (opt->indir & PV_WIN))) {
6288 void *varp = get_varp(opt);
6289
6290 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
6291 typval_T opt_tv = optval_as_tv(optval_from_varp(opt_idx, varp), true1);
6292 tv_dict_add_tv(d, opt->fullname, strlen(opt->fullname), &opt_tv);
6293 }
6294 }
6295 }
6296
6297 return d;
6298}
6299
6300/// Return the effective 'scrolloff' value for the current window, using the
6301/// global value when appropriate.
6302int get_scrolloff_value(win_T *wp)
6303{
6304 // Disallow scrolloff in terminal-mode. #11915
6305 if (State & MODE_TERMINAL) {
6306 return 0;
6307 }
6308 return (int)(wp->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so < 0 ? p_so : wp->w_p_sow_onebuf_opt.wo_so);
6309}
6310
6311/// Return the effective 'sidescrolloff' value for the current window, using the
6312/// global value when appropriate.
6313int get_sidescrolloff_value(win_T *wp)
6314{
6315 return (int)(wp->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso < 0 ? p_siso : wp->w_p_sisow_onebuf_opt.wo_siso);
6316}
6317
6318Dictionary get_vimoption(String name, int scope, buf_T *buf, win_T *win, Arena *arena, Error *err)
6319{
6320 OptIndex opt_idx = find_option_len(name.data, name.size);
6321 VALIDATE_S(opt_idx != kOptInvalid, "option (not found)", name.data, {do { if (!(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)) { api_err_invalid(err, "option (not found)"
, name.data, 0, 1); { return (Dictionary){ .size = 0, .capacity
= 0, .items = ((void*)0) }; }; } } while (0)
6322 return (Dictionary)ARRAY_DICT_INIT;do { if (!(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)) { api_err_invalid(err, "option (not found)"
, name.data, 0, 1); { return (Dictionary){ .size = 0, .capacity
= 0, .items = ((void*)0) }; }; } } while (0)
6323 })do { if (!(opt_idx != kOptInvalid)) { api_err_invalid(err, "option (not found)"
, name.data, 0, 1); { return (Dictionary){ .size = 0, .capacity
= 0, .items = ((void*)0) }; }; } } while (0);
6324
6325 return vimoption2dict(&options[opt_idx], scope, buf, win, arena);
6326}
6327
6328Dictionary get_all_vimoptions(Arena *arena)
6329{
6330 Dictionary retval = arena_dict(arena, kOptIndexCount357);
6331 for (OptIndex opt_idx = 0; opt_idx < kOptIndexCount357; opt_idx++) {
6332 Dictionary opt_dict = vimoption2dict(&options[opt_idx], OPT_GLOBAL, curbuf, curwin, arena);
6333 PUT_C(retval, options[opt_idx].fullname, DICTIONARY_OBJ(opt_dict))(*((retval).items + ((retval).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .
key = cstr_as_string(options[opt_idx].fullname), .value = ((Object
) { .type = kObjectTypeDictionary, .data.dictionary = opt_dict
}) })));
6334 }
6335 return retval;
6336}
6337
6338static Dictionary vimoption2dict(vimoption_T *opt, int req_scope, buf_T *buf, win_T *win,
6339 Arena *arena)
6340{
6341 Dictionary dict = arena_dict(arena, 13);
6342
6343 PUT_C(dict, "name", CSTR_AS_OBJ(opt->fullname))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("name"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeString
, .data.string = cstr_as_string(opt->fullname) }) })));
6344 PUT_C(dict, "shortname", CSTR_AS_OBJ(opt->shortname))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("shortname"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeString
, .data.string = cstr_as_string(opt->shortname) }) })));
6345
6346 const char *scope;
6347 if (opt->indir & PV_BUF) {
6348 scope = "buf";
6349 } else if (opt->indir & PV_WIN) {
6350 scope = "win";
6351 } else {
6352 scope = "global";
6353 }
6354
6355 PUT_C(dict, "scope", CSTR_AS_OBJ(scope))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("scope"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeString
, .data.string = cstr_as_string(scope) }) })));
6356
6357 // welcome to the jungle
6358 PUT_C(dict, "global_local", BOOLEAN_OBJ(opt->indir & PV_BOTH))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("global_local"), .value = ((Object) { .type =
kObjectTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = opt->indir & PV_BOTH
}) })));
6359 PUT_C(dict, "commalist", BOOLEAN_OBJ(opt->flags & P_COMMA))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("commalist"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeBoolean
, .data.boolean = opt->flags & 0x1000U }) })));
6360 PUT_C(dict, "flaglist", BOOLEAN_OBJ(opt->flags & P_FLAGLIST))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("flaglist"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeBoolean
, .data.boolean = opt->flags & 0x8000U }) })));
6361
6362 PUT_C(dict, "was_set", BOOLEAN_OBJ(opt->flags & P_WAS_SET))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("was_set"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeBoolean
, .data.boolean = opt->flags & 0x20U }) })));
6363
6364 LastSet last_set = { .channel_id = 0 };
6365 if (req_scope == OPT_GLOBAL) {
6366 last_set = opt->last_set;
6367 } else {
6368 // Scope is either OPT_LOCAL or a fallback mode was requested.
6369 if (opt->indir & PV_BUF) {
6370 last_set = buf->b_p_script_ctx[opt->indir & PV_MASK];
6371 }
6372 if (opt->indir & PV_WIN) {
6373 last_set = win->w_p_script_ctxw_onebuf_opt.wo_script_ctx[opt->indir & PV_MASK];
6374 }
6375 if (req_scope != OPT_LOCAL && last_set.script_ctx.sc_sid == 0) {
6376 last_set = opt->last_set;
6377 }
6378 }
6379
6380 PUT_C(dict, "last_set_sid", INTEGER_OBJ(last_set.script_ctx.sc_sid))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("last_set_sid"), .value = ((Object) { .type =
kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = last_set.script_ctx.sc_sid
}) })));
6381 PUT_C(dict, "last_set_linenr", INTEGER_OBJ(last_set.script_ctx.sc_lnum))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("last_set_linenr"), .value = ((Object) { .type
= kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = last_set.script_ctx.sc_lnum
}) })));
6382 PUT_C(dict, "last_set_chan", INTEGER_OBJ((int64_t)last_set.channel_id))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("last_set_chan"), .value = ((Object) { .type =
kObjectTypeInteger, .data.integer = (int64_t)last_set.channel_id
}) })));
6383
6384 // TODO(bfredl): do you even nocp?
6385 OptVal def = optval_from_varp(get_opt_idx(opt), &opt->def_val);
6386
6387 PUT_C(dict, "type", CSTR_AS_OBJ(optval_type_get_name(def.type)))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("type"), .value = ((Object) { .type = kObjectTypeString
, .data.string = cstr_as_string(optval_type_get_name(def.type
)) }) })));
6388 PUT_C(dict, "default", optval_as_object(def))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("default"), .value = optval_as_object(def) })
));
6389 PUT_C(dict, "allows_duplicates", BOOLEAN_OBJ(!(opt->flags & P_NODUP)))(*((dict).items + ((dict).size++)) = (((KeyValuePair) { .key =
cstr_as_string("allows_duplicates"), .value = ((Object) { .type
= kObjectTypeBoolean, .data.boolean = !(opt->flags & 0x4000U
) }) })));
6390
6391 return dict;
6392}
6393
6394/// Check if option is multitype (supports multiple types).
6395static bool_Bool option_is_multitype(OptIndex opt_idx)
6396{
6397 const OptTypeFlags type_flags = get_option(opt_idx)->type_flags;
6398 assert(type_flags != 0)((void) sizeof ((type_flags != 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if
(type_flags != 0) ; else __assert_fail ("type_flags != 0", "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c"
, 6398, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
6399 return !is_power_of_two(type_flags);
6400}
6401
6402/// Check if option supports a specific type.
6403bool_Bool option_has_type(OptIndex opt_idx, OptValType type)
6404{
6405 // Ensure that type flags variable can hold all types.
6406 STATIC_ASSERT(kOptValTypeSize <= sizeof(OptTypeFlags) * 8,do { clang diagnostic push clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc11-extensions"
_Static_assert((kOptValTypeString + 1) <= sizeof(OptTypeFlags
) * 8, "Option type_flags cannot fit all option types"); clang
diagnostic pop } while (0)
6407 "Option type_flags cannot fit all option types")do { clang diagnostic push clang diagnostic ignored "-Wc11-extensions"
_Static_assert((kOptValTypeString + 1) <= sizeof(OptTypeFlags
) * 8, "Option type_flags cannot fit all option types"); clang
diagnostic pop } while (0);
6408 // Ensure that the type is valid before accessing type_flags.
6409 assert(type > kOptValTypeNil && type < kOptValTypeSize)((void) sizeof ((type > kOptValTypeNil && type <
(kOptValTypeString + 1)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if (type
> kOptValTypeNil && type < (kOptValTypeString +
1)) ; else __assert_fail ("type > kOptValTypeNil && type < kOptValTypeSize"
, "/home/runner/work/doc/doc/neovim/src/nvim/option.c", 6409,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
6410 // Bitshift 1 by the value of type to get the type's corresponding flag, and check if it's set in
6411 // the type_flags bit field.
6412 return get_option(opt_idx)->type_flags & (1 << type);
6413}
